raw_payload.title: PhD Position Piezoelectric Energy Harvesting from Heavy Mechanical Loads
raw_payload.description:
Job description
We are seeking a highly motivated PhD candidate to join our research group in the field of piezoelectric microsystems. The successful candidate will work on the design, modelling, fabrication, and experimental implementation of piezoelectric energy harvesters capable of operating under heavy mechanical loads.

This project aims to develop innovative devices that can convert large-scale mechanical stress into useful electrical energy, enabling autonomous sensors and systems in demanding industrial and structural environments. The research will involve a combination of analytical modelling, multiphysics simulations, device implementation, and experimental validation.

Key responsibilities:
  • Develop theoretical and numerical models of piezoelectric energy harvesters under heavy-load conditions.
  • Design and optimize device architectures using finite element simulations.
  • Fabricate prototypes using 3D printing, and cleanroom technologies.
  • Implement test setups and assess devices performance through mechanical and electrical characterization techniques.
  • Disseminate research results through scientific publications, conferences, and collaborative meetings.
  • Contribute to teaching and supervision of MSc students within the group...

Job requirements
  • MSc degree (or equivalent) in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Materials Science, or a related discipline.
  • Strong background in one or more of the following areas: piezoelectric materials, MEMS/NEMS, finite element modelling (e.g., COMSOL), mechanical design, or energy harvesting.
  • Hands-on experience with experimental characterization of sensors or other electrical devices.
  • Experience with microfabrication is an advantage.
  • Proficiency in spoken and written English.
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a multidisciplinary team.      

TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.

At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.

Challenge. Change. Impact!

Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science
The Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science (EEMCS) brings together three scientific disciplines. Combined, they reinforce each other and are the driving force behind the technology we all use in our daily lives. Technology such as the electricity grid, which our faculty is helping to make completely sustainable and future-proof. At the same time, we are developing the chips and sensors of the future, whilst also setting the foundations for the software technologies to run on this new generation of equipment – which of course includes AI. Meanwhile we are pushing the limits of applied mathematics, for example mapping out disease processes using single cell data, and using mathematics to simulate gigantic ash plumes after a volcanic eruption. In other words: there is plenty of room at the faculty for ground-breaking research. We educate innovative engineers and have excellent labs and facilities that underline our strong international position. In total, more than 1000 employees and 4,000 students work and study in this innovative environment.

Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science.


Conditions of employment
Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.

Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities , increasing from €3059 - €3881 gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.

As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills.

The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.

Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit, Coming to Delft Service, offers information on their website to help you prepare your relocation. In addition, Coming to Delft Service organises events to help you settle in the Netherlands, and expand your (social) network in Delft. A Dual Career Programme is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands.

Additional information
If you would like more information about this vacancy or the selection procedure, please contact Tomas Manzaneque or Sijun Du, via t.manzanequegarcia@tudelft.nl of Sijun.du@tudelft.nl.

Application procedure
Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than 7 Dec 2025 via the application button and upload the following documents:
  • CV
  • Motivational letter

You can address your application to Tomas Manzaneque or Sijun Du.

Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.

Please note:
  • You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
  • As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.
  • Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.

items.description_en:
Job description
You will design, manufacture, test and validate two smart material systems/demonstrators: (i) a catheter for invasive surgery with shape and property morphing and (ii) an assistive tool to navigate and guide visually impaired people. You will (i) select appropriate materials for the intended applications, (ii) by 3D printing fabricate smart material systems with magnetic shape memory materials as active components, (iii) study the effect of a number of parameters (related both to the magnetic material and the printing process) on the shape-morphing behaviour so as to obtain the optimum combination of material and manufacturing process. (iv) The results of these tests are employed to draw up a set of design guidelines that can be used by designers. The level of technological readiness of these smart materials is still low, which makes their integration in a smart material system with various segments a challenging design assignment. Therefore, it needs elaborative testing and characterisation (developing of testing procedures).
The ultimate goal is to prototype demonstrators that are responsive in a magnetic field, with fast response and remote control. These prototypes will demonstrate how appropriate integration of smart components in the structure enhances operational functionality, taking into account a complex series of boundary conditions (base functionality, reliability, processability and user experience).
Your tasks will include :
- Systematic selection of smart materials tailored to specific applications
- Designing, manufacturing, assembling, and architecting smart material systems, resulting in two functional demonstrators
- Rigorous performance evaluation under various conditions, including static and dynamic characterization
For this project, the PhD candidate will spend 6 months at Sophion (Denmark), 4 months at Technical University Denmark (Denmark) and 3 months at Excillum (Sweden).

职位描述
您将设计、制造、测试和验证两种智能材料系统/演示器：(i) 具有形状和属性变形的用于侵入性手术的导管，以及 (ii) 用于导航和引导视障人士的辅助工具。您将（i）为预期应用选择合适的材料，（ii）通过3D打印制造以磁性形状记忆材料作为活性组件的智能材料系统，（iii）研究许多参数（与磁性材料和打印工艺相关）对形状变形行为的影响，以获得材料和制造工艺的最佳组合。 (iv) 这些测试的结果用于制定一套可供设计人员使用的设计指南。这些智能材料的技术准备水平仍然较低，这使得它们与各个领域的智能材料系统的集成成为一项具有挑战性的设计任务。因此，需要精细的测试和表征（开发测试程序）。
最终目标是制作能够在磁场中响应、快速响应和远程控制的原型演示器。这些原型将展示智能组件在结构中的适当集成如何增强操作功能，同时考虑一系列复杂的边界条件（基本功能、可靠性、可加工性和用户体验）。
您的任务将包括：
- 针对特定应用系统地选择智能材料
- 设计、制造、组装和构建智能材料系统，产生两个功能演示器
- 各种条件下的严格性能评估，包括静态和动态特性
对于该项目，博士生将在 Sophion（丹麦）学习 6 个月，在丹麦技术大学（丹麦）学习 4 个月，在 Excillum（瑞典）学习 3 个月。
TU Delft（代尔夫特理工大学）
代尔夫特理工大学有着坚实的基础。作为举世闻名的荷兰水厂的创建者和生物技术的先驱，代尔夫特理工大学是一所集科学、工程和设计于一体的顶尖国际大学。它在教育、研究和创新方面提供世界一流的成果，以应对能源、气候、流动性、健康和数字社会领域的挑战。几代人以来，我们的工程师已被证明是商业和社会环境中的企业家问题解决者。在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们的核心之一
价值观
并且我们积极地
参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们重视不同的观点和品质。我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同想象、发明和创造利用技术对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平的考虑。
挑战。改变。影响！
学院 工业设计工程
将人类的进化与技术革命的速度相匹配。这是工业设计工程学院（IDE）的重点。代尔夫特设计师充当技术进步与人们、组织和社会需求之间的桥梁，创造有目的的产品、服务和系统。IDE 是移动性、可持续性和健康应用领域的设计研究以及设计工具和方法开发的领导者。由 350 人组成的强大研究团队和 2,000 多名学生在我们鼓舞人心的大厅、实验室和工作室中一起工作。通过与行业、公共部门和非政府组织密切合作，我们预演了研究和教育方面可能的未来，以设计一个复杂的未来。点击
这里
访问工业设计工程学院网站。
雇佣条件
博士生聘用期原则上为4年，但采用2份聘用合同的形式。最初的 1.5 年合同，并在 15 个月内进行正式的进展/不进展评估。如果一切顺利且满足性能要求，接下来将签订剩余 2.5 年的附加合同。
工资和福利符合荷兰大学集体劳动协议，从第一年到第四年，根据全职合同（38小时），每月从 Promovendus 毛额开始增加，另加 8% 的假期津贴和 8.3% 的年终奖金。
根据MSCA津贴和接收机构的规定，博士生将获得有竞争力的薪酬。 TUD 每月总金额为 3.059 欧元。此外，还提供资金用于技术和个人技能培训以及参与国际研究活动。

可以为您的随行伴侣在荷兰寻找工作提供支持。

在招聘之日，您尚未拥有博士学位。已成功通过博士学位论文答辩但尚未正式授予博士学位的研究人员不符合资格。

申请人可以是任何国籍，但研究人员在受聘之日前的36个月内不得在东道国居住或进行主要活动（工作、学习等）超过12个月。义务兵役、假期等短期停留以及根据《日内瓦公约》获得难民身份的程序所花费的时间不予考虑。

items.description_zh:
职位描述
您是否好奇过为什么某些语言是这样设计的？您想弥合编程语言研究和行业需求之间的差距吗？
如果您对解决深入的研究挑战和现实世界的软件问题感到兴奋，那么这个项目适合您。
寻找一位重视形式推理的优势，同时认识到其当前局限性的博士生，致力于探索超越单独验证所能实现的解决方案。
该博士项目专注于开发增强软件互操作性的分析和程序修复技术。例如，当 Rust 与遗留的 C 代码集成时，我们如何恢复它的安全保证？更一般地说，我们如何确保由不同作者（例如人类开发人员和人工智能助理）以不同语言编写的软件组件始终按照其预期规范进行交互？
该项目旨在在验证、分析和测试之间建立协同作用，以修复有缺陷的软件，从而增强软件的可信度。
关于环境：
我们希望创造一些东西，并以某种方式成长，即使其他一切都在变化，它们也能保持稳定。我们重视协作，也尊重专注、独立工作的需要。学术界为我们提供了探索的空间，但我们也喜欢与工业界合作，寻求新的想法和现实世界的影响。我们鼓励好奇心和主动性，并始终优先考虑友善、清晰的沟通，因为我们相信新颖性源于联系和开放的心态。
TU Delft（代尔夫特理工大学）
代尔夫特理工大学有着坚实的基础。作为举世闻名的荷兰水厂的创建者和生物技术的先驱，代尔夫特理工大学是一所集科学、工程和设计于一体的顶尖国际大学。它在教育、研究和创新方面提供世界一流的成果，以应对能源、气候、流动性、健康和数字社会领域的挑战。几代人以来，我们的工程师已被证明是商业和社会环境中的企业家问题解决者。
在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们的核心之一
价值观
并且我们积极地
参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们重视不同的观点和品质。我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同想象、发明和创造利用技术对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平的考虑。
挑战。改变。影响！
电气工程、数学和计算机科学学院
电气工程、数学和计算机科学学院 (EEMCS) 汇集了三个科学学科。它们相辅相成，是我们日常生活中使用的技术背后的驱动力。我们的教师正在帮助电网等技术实现完全可持续且面向未来的技术。与此同时，我们正在开发未来的芯片和传感器，同时也为在新一代设备上运行的软件技术奠定了基础——当然其中也包括人工智能。与此同时，我们正在突破应用数学的极限，例如使用单细胞数据绘制疾病过程，并使用数学模拟火山喷发后巨大的火山灰羽流。换句话说：学院有足够的空间进行突破性研究。我们培养创新工程师，并拥有优秀的实验室和设施，这些都凸显了我们强大的国际地位。总共有 1000 多名员工和 4,000 名学生在这个创新环境中工作和学习。
点击
这里
访问电气工程、数学和计算机科学学院的网站。

博士生聘用期原则上为4年，但采用2份聘用合同的形式。最初的 1.5 年合同，并在 15 个月内进行正式的进展/不进展评估。如果一切顺利且满足性能要求，接下来将签订剩余 2.5 年的附加合同。
工资和福利符合荷兰大学集体劳动协议，从第一年到第四年，基于全职合同（38小时），每月毛额从3059欧元增加到3881欧元，另加8%的假期津贴和8.3%的年终奖金。

来到代尔夫特服务
，在其网站上提供信息以帮助您准备搬迁。此外，“来到代尔夫特服务”还组织活动来帮助您在荷兰定居，并扩展您在代尔夫特的（社交）网络。一个
双轨制职业计划
可以为您的随行伴侣在荷兰寻找工作提供支持。
附加信息
如果您想了解有关此职位空缺或选拔程序的更多信息，请联系 Dr. Andreea Costea，通过 m.a.costea@tudelft.nl。
请注意：
- 您可以在线申请。我们不会处理通过电子邮件和/或邮寄发送的申请。
- 作为知识安全的一部分，代尔夫特理工大学在人员招聘过程中进行风险评估。除其他外，我们这样做是为了防止敏感知识和技术的不必要转移。评估基于候选人自己提供的信息，例如他们的动机信和简历，并在选拔过程的最后阶段进行。当评估结果是否定的时，候选人将被告知。风险评估背景下的个人数据处理是在 GDPR 的法律基础上进行的：为了公共利益执行公共任务。您可以在我们有关知识安全的网站上找到有关此评估的更多信息。

items.title_en: PhD Position Study Genetic Impacts on Brain Cells Using Single-Cell and Spatial ML Techniques
items.title_zh: 博士职位使用单细胞和空间机器学习技术研究遗传对脑细胞的影响
items.description_en:
Join us to decode how genetic variation reprograms brain cells and disrupts their communication using AI
Job description
We are looking for a PhD student to work at the intersection of machine learning, single-cell genomics, and neurogenetics. Your project will focus on developing new methods to understand how genetic variants affect not only individual brain cells but also change the way cells interact and communicate — insights that are essential for understanding the cellular origins of brain disorders.
Despite major progress in genetics research, we still don’t know how genetic risk factors for brain disorders like schizophrenia, alzheimer, and depression disrupt brain function. Genetic discoveries point to thousands of disease-associated SNPs, but most of them act in subtle and cell type–specific ways, and their downstream biological effects remain poorly understood.
This project tackles this fundamental gap — by building computational models that simulate what goes wrong in the brain, one cell (and one cell–cell interaction) at a time.
You will work with large-scale single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data to develop and apply single-cell foundation models — generative machine learning models that represent the structure and variation of cell states. These models act as virtual cells simulating how perturbing the expression of genes altered by genetic variants affects the cell’s identity, behavior, and trajectory. You will extend these models to understand how genetic risk factors alter cell–cell communication networks. Spatial transcriptomics datasets will be used to anchor these models in real tissue context, revealing how spatially organized cell communities rewire under genetic perturbation.
Key challenges
- Use and improve single-cell foundation models to predict SNP-driven shifts in cell state and cell fate.
- Integrate spatial transcriptomics data to anchor these predictions in tissue context.
- Develop machine learning methods (e.g. graph neural networks, variational or diffusion models) to model cell–cell communication dynamics under genetic perturbation.
- Investigate how local interactions between perturbed and unperturbed cells reshape signaling networks and tissue states.
- Closely collobarate with neuroscientists in the BRAINSCAPES consortium to link model predictions to experimental and clinical relevance.
Benefits
- Shape next-generation models for understanding brain disease mechanisms.
- Work in a collaborative, interdisciplinary, and dynamic environment with leading experts in machine learning, computational biology, and neurogenomics.
- Access cutting-edge datasets, infrastructure, and computational and experimental facilities.
- Receive support for professional development and participation in international conferences.
TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. 职位描述
我们正在寻找一名博士生，从事机器学习、单细胞基因组学和神经遗传学交叉领域的工作。您的项目将侧重于开发新方法来了解遗传变异如何不仅影响单个脑细胞，而且还改变细胞相互作用和交流的方式——这些见解对于理解脑部疾病的细胞起源至关重要。
尽管遗传学研究取得了重大进展，但我们仍然不知道精神分裂症、阿尔茨海默症和抑郁症等大脑疾病的遗传风险因素如何破坏大脑功能。基因发现指向数以千计的与疾病相关的 SNP，但其中大多数以微妙的、细胞类型特异性的方式发挥作用，而它们的下游生物学效应仍然知之甚少。
该项目通过构建计算模型来解决这一根本差距，该模型可以一次模拟大脑中一个细胞（以及一个细胞与细胞的相互作用）中出现的问题。
您将使用大规模单细胞和空间转录组数据来开发和应用单细胞基础模型 - 代表细胞状态的结构和变化的生成机器学习模型。这些模型充当虚拟细胞，模拟遗传变异改变的基因表达的扰动如何影响细胞的身份、行为和轨迹。您将扩展这些模型以了解遗传风险因素如何改变细胞间通信网络。空间转录组学数据集将用于将这些模型锚定在真实的组织环境中，揭示空间组织的细胞群落如何在遗传扰动下重新连接。
主要挑战
- 使用和改进单细胞基础模型来预测 SNP 驱动的细胞状态和细胞命运的变化。
- 整合空间转录组学数据，将这些预测锚定在组织背景中。
- 开发机器学习方法（例如图神经网络、变分或扩散模型）来模拟遗传扰动下的细胞间通讯动态。
- 研究扰动和未扰动细胞之间的局部相互作用如何重塑信号网络和组织状态。
- 与 BRAINSCAPES 联盟的神经科学家密切合作，将模型预测与实验和临床相关性联系起来。
好处
- 塑造下一代模型以了解脑部疾病机制。
- 与机器学习、计算生物学和神经基因组学领域的领先专家一起在协作、跨学科和动态的环境中工作。

在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们的核心之一
价值观
并且我们积极地
参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们重视不同的观点和品质。我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同想象、发明和创造利用技术对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平的考虑。
挑战。改变。影响！

raw_payload.description:
Join us to decode how genetic variation reprograms brain cells and disrupts their communication using AI

Job description
We are looking for a PhD student to work at the intersection of machine learning, single-cell genomics, and neurogenetics. Your project will focus on developing new methods to understand how genetic variants affect not only individual brain cells but also change the way cells interact and communicate — insights that are essential for understanding the cellular origins of brain disorders.

Despite major progress in genetics research, we still don’t know how genetic risk factors for brain disorders like schizophrenia, alzheimer, and depression disrupt brain function. Genetic discoveries point to thousands of disease-associated SNPs, but most of them act in subtle and cell type–specific ways, and their downstream biological effects remain poorly understood.

This project tackles this fundamental gap — by building computational models that simulate what goes wrong in the brain, one cell (and one cell–cell interaction) at a time.

You will work with large-scale single-cell and spatial transcriptomics data to develop and apply single-cell foundation models — generative machine learning models that represent the structure and variation of cell states. These models act as virtual cells simulating how perturbing the expression of genes altered by genetic variants affects the cell’s identity, behavior, and trajectory. You will extend these models to understand how genetic risk factors alter cell–cell communication networks. Spatial transcriptomics datasets will be used to anchor these models in real tissue context, revealing how spatially organized cell communities rewire under genetic perturbation.

Key challenges
  • Use and improve single-cell foundation models to predict SNP-driven shifts in cell state and cell fate.
  • Integrate spatial transcriptomics data to anchor these predictions in tissue context.
  • Develop machine learning methods (e.g. graph neural networks, variational or diffusion models) to model cell–cell communication dynamics under genetic perturbation.
  • Investigate how local interactions between perturbed and unperturbed cells reshape signaling networks and tissue states.
  • Closely collobarate with neuroscientists in the BRAINSCAPES consortium to link model predictions to experimental and clinical relevance.

items.title_en: PhD - student: Measuring charges and fields in semiconductor metrology
items.title_zh: 博士生：测量半导体计量中的电荷和场
items.description_en:
Work Activities
In semiconductor devices and materials, electric fields can arise due to doping, laser excitation, and other processes. Measuring these fields and/or the charges that create them, is nontrivial as it is highly undesirable to attach physical electrodes to semiconductor devices just for this purpose. At the same time, the ability to measure these fields is highly interesting as it offers the possibility to apply it as a diagnostic tool for quality control. A non-contact way to measure static or slowly varying electric fields is Electric-Field Induced Second Harmonic generation, or EFISH. In isotropic media, optical second harmonic generation (SHG) is normally not allowed. Static electric fields, however, break inversion symmetry, allowing SHG. This means that SHG can be used as a probe of the local static electric field and charge distribution in a material. EFISH is also direction dependent, in principle allowing for measurement of the electric field vector.
Project goal
In this project you will work towards exploring and understanding EFISH to measure static fields and charge distributions in various materials and structures. For this you will learn to work with (tunable) femtosecond laser pulses generated by the laser systems available in the Light/Matter Interaction groups at ARCN. These laser pulses have high peak power and are therefore ideal for the nonlinear optical EFISH process. You will design your own setup, get acquainted with nonlinear optics, perform experiments on relevant materials, and learn how to analyze your data.
Qualifications
Applicants must hold, or be nearing completion of, a Master’s degree in Physics, Chemistry, Materials Science, or a closely related discipline, in accordance with Dutch university requirements for enrollment in a PhD program. While prior experience with femtosecond lasers is not a prerequisite, it will be considered a distinct advantage. Candidates should demonstrate a strong interest in nonlinear optics, materials science, and chemistry, coupled with excellent critical thinking and innovative problem-solving skills. Proficiency in both written and spoken English is mandatory.
Work environment
ARCNL performs fundamental research, focusing on the physics and chemistry involved in current and future key technologies in nanolithography, primarily for the semiconductor industry. While the academic setting and research style are geared towards establishing scientific excellence, the topics in ARCNL’s research program are intimately connected with the interests of the industrial partner ASML. The institute is located at Amsterdam Science Park and currently employs about 100 persons of which 65 are ambitious (young) researchers from all over the globe.
www.arcnl.nl
About the Light/Matter Interaction group
The research activities of the Light/Matter Interaction group focus on the (non-)linear optical and terahertz response of materials within the context of photo-acoustics, light-induced damage, and local field measurements.
Working conditions
The position is intended as full-time (40 hours / week, 12 months / year) appointment in the service of the Netherlands Foundation of Scientific Research Institutes (NWO-I) for the duration of four years, with a starting salary of gross € 2,968 per month and a
range of employment benefits
. After successful completion of the PhD research a PhD degree will be granted at a Dutch University. Several courses are offered, specially developed for PhD-students. ARCNL assists any new foreign PhD-student with housing and visa applications and compensates their transport costs and furnishing expenses.
More information?
For further information about the position, please contact Prof. dr. P. Planken: p.planken@arcnl.nl
Diversity code
ARCNL is highly committed to an inclusive and diverse work environment: we want to develop talent and creativity by bringing together people from different backgrounds and cultures. We recruit and select on the basis of competencies and talents. We strongly encourage anyone with the right qualifications to apply for the vacancy, regardless of age, gender, origin, sexual orientation or physical ability.
Commercial activities in response to this ad are not appreciated.
items.description_zh:
工作活动
在半导体器件和材料中，掺杂、激光激发和其他过程可能会产生电场。测量这些场和/或产生它们的电荷并非易事，因为仅出于此目的将物理电极连接到半导体器件是非常不希望的。同时，测量这些场的能力非常有趣，因为它提供了将其用作质量控制诊断工具的可能性。测量静态或缓慢变化电场的一种非接触方式是电场感应二次谐波发生（EFISH）。在各向同性介质中，通常不允许光学二次谐波发生 (SHG)。然而，静电场打破了反演对称性，从而允许二次谐波产生。这意味着二次谐波可以用作材料中局部静电场和电荷分布的探针。 EFISH 也与方向相关，原则上允许测量电场矢量。
项目目标
在本项目中，您将致力于探索和理解 EFISH 来测量各种材料和结构中的静电场和电荷分布。为此，您将学习如何使用 ARCN 光/物质相互作用小组中可用的激光系统生成的（可调谐）飞秒激光脉冲。这些激光脉冲具有高峰值功率，因此非常适合非线性光学 EFISH 工艺。您将设计自己的设置，熟悉非线性光学，对相关材料进行实验，并学习如何分析数据。
资质
根据荷兰大学攻读博士学位课程的要求，申请人必须持有或即将完成物理、化学、材料科学或密切相关学科的硕士学位。虽然以前使用飞秒激光器的经验不是先决条件，但它将被视为一个明显的优势。候选人应表现出对非线性光学、材料科学和化学的浓厚兴趣，以及出色的批判性思维和创新解决问题的能力。必须熟练掌握英语书面和口语。
工作环境
ARCNL 开展基础研究，重点关注纳米光刻技术当前和未来关键技术所涉及的物理和化学，主要针对半导体行业。虽然学术环境和研究风格旨在建立卓越的科学水平，但 ARCNL 的研究项目主题与工业合作伙伴 ASML 的利益密切相关。该研究所位于阿姆斯特丹科学园，目前拥有约 100 名员工，其中 65 名是来自全球各地雄心勃勃的（年轻）研究人员。
www.arcnl.nl
关于光/物质相互作用组
光/物质相互作用小组的研究活动重点关注光声学、光致损伤和局部场测量背景下材料的（非线性）光学和太赫兹响应。
工作条件
该职位为荷兰科学研究所基金会 (NWO-I) 的全职（每周 40 小时，每年 12 个月）任命，为期四年，起薪为每月 2,968 欧元，
就业福利范围
。成功完成博士研究后，荷兰大学将授予博士学位。提供专门为博士生开发的几门课程。 ARCNL 协助所有新的外国博士生申请住房和签证，并补偿他们的交通费用和家具费用。
更多信息？
有关该职位的更多信息，请联系教授博士。 P.普兰肯：p.planken@arcnl.nl
多样性代码
ARCNL 高度致力于营造包容和多元化的工作环境：我们希望通过将来自不同背景和文化的人们聚集在一起来开发人才和创造力。我们根据能力和人才进行招聘和选拔。我们强烈鼓励任何具有适当资格的人申请该职位空缺，无论年龄、性别、出身、性取向或身体能力。
不赞赏针对该广告的商业活动。

items.title_en: PhD position in multi-agent modeling of integrated heating-electricity systems
items.title_zh: 热电一体化系统多智能体建模博士职位
items.description_en:
Background
Energy systems are undergoing rapid changes, both in terms of electrical power generation, but also in the fast transition taking place in other energy-intensive sectors such as heating of buildings. This presents many opportunities, but also requires careful planning and operation to deal with emerging challenges such as network congestion. Recently, positive energy districts (PEDs), i.e. communities of homes that have very low or net-zero greenhouse gas emission and are highly energy-efficient, have become a key component of the energy transition.
The EmPowerEd project is a large national project that focuses on tackling the challenges that PEDs face in the transition to carbon-neutral heating. It is a large project, bringing together several Dutch universities, companies and municipalities to address this key societal challenges. It is also highly interdisciplinary, bringing together expertise ranging from mechanical and electrical engineering, computer science, built environment, to social sciences, economics and regulation.
Job description
The project of the PhD student based at CWI in Amsterdam will focus on techno-economic models (and in particular multi-agent modeling) of energy exchange and flexibility for positive energy districts. A specific focus will be placed on designing incentives and sharing models between prosumers in PEDs. This includes both peer-peer trading models between individual prosumers (based on their own energy assets such as PVs, home batteries, heat pumps etc.), and models where joint electricity and heating infrastructure is shared in a local cooperative or coalition.
Potential topics that are relevant for this PhD position include:
- Modeling of peer-peer energy exchanges between prosumers in energy communities, considering their energy preferences and constraints
- Coalitional models for efficient sharing of joint energy infrastructure (such as a community heating network or community battery). This can use, e.g. techniques from coalition theory such as Shapley values.
- Models of network congestion, and solutions for planning and co-optimizing electricity and heating networks to avoid congestion issues
- . Validation of proposed techniques through principled multi-agent simulations, complex systems analysis or other data-driven methods.
items.description_zh:
背景
能源系统正在经历快速变化，无论是在发电方面，还是在建筑物供暖等其他能源密集型行业的快速转型中。这带来了许多机会，但也需要仔细规划和运营，以应对网络拥塞等新出现的挑战。最近，正能源区（PED），即温室气体排放量极低或净零排放且能源效率高的家庭社区，已成为能源转型的关键组成部分。
EmPowerEd 项目是一个大型国家项目，重点解决 PED 在向碳中和供暖过渡过程中面临的挑战。这是一个大型项目，汇集了荷兰的几所大学、公司和市政当局，以应对这一关键的社会挑战。它也是高度跨学科的，汇集了机械和电气工程、计算机科学、建筑环境、社会科学、经济学和监管等专业知识。
职位描述
阿姆斯特丹 CWI 博士生的项目将重点关注能源交换的技术经济模型（特别是多主体建模）和正能量区域的灵活性。将特别关注设计 PED 中产消者之间的激励措施和共享模型。这包括个体产消者之间的点对点交易模式（基于他们自己的能源资产，如光伏、家用电池、热泵等），以及在当地合作社或联盟中共享联合电力和供热基础设施的模式。
与该博士职位相关的潜在主题包括：
- 对能源社区产消者之间的点对点能源交换进行建模，考虑他们的能源偏好和约束
- 有效共享联合能源基础设施（例如社区供热网络或社区电池）的联盟模型。这可以使用，例如来自联盟理论的技术，例如沙普利值。
- 网络拥塞模型以及规划和共同优化电力和供热网络以避免拥塞问题的解决方案
- .通过原则性多主体模拟、复杂系统分析或其他数据驱动方法验证所提出的技术。

items.title_en: PhD Position Sustainable Additive Manufacturing from Recycled Stainless Steel
items.title_zh: 博士职位利用再生不锈钢进行可持续增材制造
items.description_en:
Can scrap steels become the future of high-performance 3D printing? Join us in reshaping metal manufacturing by turning industrial waste into precision-engineered components through 3D-printing!
Job description
Join the Extreme Materials & Mechanics (X2M) Group at the Department of Materials Science and Engineering (MSE), TU Delft, in a cutting-edge PhD project that aims to revolutionize how stainless steel scrap is reused in high-performance applications. This research is part of the national Groeien met Groen Staal (GGS) programme, which supports the Dutch steel sector’s transition to a circular, CO₂-neutral future by 2050.
Additive Manufacturing (AM) is transforming the way we design and produce metal components. However, the sustainability of AM depends on the availability of high-quality powders—and that’s where this project comes in. Instead of relying on virgin materials, we aim to recycle 316L stainless steel from decommissioned industrial components into powders suitable for additive manufacturing processes.
This PhD project will experimentally validate the use of recycled stainless steel powders in AM by:
- Producing powders via gas atomization (with program partner Space XYZ) and ultrasonic atomization (TU Delft).
- Characterizing powder morphology, flowability, oxidation, and contamination.
- Fabricating parts using LPBF printing, optimizing process parameters for recycled feedstock.
- Benchmarking mechanical properties (tensile strength, elongation, hardness) against commercial powders.
- Identifying industrial applications for recycled AM parts in sectors such as aerospace, medical, automotive, and marine.
You’ll work with TU Delft’s state-of-the-art facilities, including:
- Powder analysis: SEM, laser diffraction, flowmeter, XPS, LECO, EDS.
- Additive manufacturing: LPBF and Binder Jetting printers, post-processing tools.
- Mechanical testing: tensile, hardness, nanoindentation, in-situ testing.
- Microstructural analysis: optical microscopy, SEM, EBSD, XRD.
The expected start date is December 2025 (but can be later, depending on the candidate's availability and immigration procedures); the contract duration is 4 years.
TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.
At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core
values
and we actively
engage
to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.
Challenge. Change. Impact!
Faculty Mechanical Engineering
From chip to ship. From machine to human being. From idea to solution. Driven by a deep-rooted desire to understand our environment and discover its underlying mechanisms, research and education at the ME faculty focusses on fundamental understanding, design, production including application and product improvement, materials, processes and (mechanical) systems.
ME is a dynamic and innovative faculty with high-tech lab facilities and international reach. It’s a large faculty but also versatile, so we can often make unique connections by combining different disciplines. This is reflected in ME’s outstanding, state-of-the-art education, which trains students to become responsible and socially engaged engineers and scientists. We translate our knowledge and insights into solutions to societal issues, contributing to a sustainable society and to the development of prosperity and well-being. That is what unites us in pioneering research, inspiring education and (inter)national cooperation.
Click
here
to go to the website of the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering. Do you want to experience working at our faculty? These
videos
will introduce you to some of our researchers and their work.
Conditions of employment
Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.
Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities , increasing from Promovendus gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.
As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills. Teaching activities are part of your PhD trajectory and may include, for example: supervising workgroups or lab sessions, assisting in courses, or mentoring BSc and MSc students. While teaching will not be your main responsibility, it offers valuable experience that supports your development and prepares you for future academic or professional roles.
The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.

废钢能否成为高性能3D打印的未来？与我们一起通过 3D 打印将工业废物转化为精密设计的部件，重塑金属制造！
职位描述
加入代尔夫特理工大学材料科学与工程系 (MSE) 的极限材料与力学 (X2M) 小组的尖端博士项目，该项目旨在彻底改变不锈钢废料在高性能应用中的再利用方式。这项研究是国家 Groeien met Groen Staal (GGS) 计划的一部分，该计划支持荷兰钢铁行业到 2050 年向循环、二氧化碳中和的未来过渡。
增材制造 (AM) 正在改变我们设计和生产金属部件的方式。然而，增材制造的可持续性取决于高质量粉末的可用性，这就是该项目的用武之地。我们的目标不是依赖原始材料，而是将退役工业部件中的 316L 不锈钢回收成适合增材制造工艺的粉末。
该博士项目将通过以下方式通过实验验证再生不锈钢粉末在增材制造中的使用：
- 通过气体雾化（与项目合作伙伴 Space XYZ）和超声波雾化（代尔夫特理工大学）生产粉末。
- 表征粉末形态、流动性、氧化和污染。
- 使用 LPBF 打印制造零件，优化回收原料的工艺参数。
- 针对商业粉末进行机械性能（拉伸强度、伸长率、硬度）基准测试。
- 确定回收的增材制造零件在航空航天、医疗、汽车和船舶等领域的工业应用。
您将使用代尔夫特理工大学最先进的设施，包括：
- 粉末分析：SEM、激光衍射、流量计、XPS、LECO、EDS。
- 增材制造：LPBF 和粘合剂喷射打印机、后处理工具。
- 机械测试：拉伸、硬度、纳米压痕、原位测试。
- 微观结构分析：光学显微镜、SEM、EBSD、XRD。
预计开始日期为 2025 年 12 月（但可能会更晚，具体取决于候选人的空缺情况和移民程序）；合同期限为4年。
TU Delft（代尔夫特理工大学）
代尔夫特理工大学有着坚实的基础。作为举世闻名的荷兰水厂的创建者和生物技术的先驱，代尔夫特理工大学是一所集科学、工程和设计于一体的顶尖国际大学。它在教育、研究和创新方面提供世界一流的成果，以应对能源、气候、流动性、健康和数字社会领域的挑战。几代人以来，我们的工程师已被证明是商业和社会环境中的企业家问题解决者。
在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们的核心之一
价值观
并且我们积极地
参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们重视不同的观点和品质。我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同想象、发明和创造利用技术对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平的考虑。
挑战。改变。影响！
机械工程学院
从芯片到船舶。从机器到人。从想法到解决方案。在了解我们的环境并发现其潜在机制的根深蒂固的愿望的推动下，ME 教师的研究和教育侧重于基础理解、设计、生产，包括应用和产品改进、材料、工艺和（机械）系统。
ME 是一支充满活力和创新精神的教师队伍，拥有高科技实验室设施和国际影响力。它的师资力量雄厚，但也多才多艺，因此我们经常可以通过结合不同学科来建立独特的联系。这体现在 ME 杰出、最先进的教育中，它培养学生成为负责任的、积极参与社会的工程师和科学家。我们将知识和见解转化为社会问题的解决方案，为可持续发展的社会以及繁荣和福祉的发展做出贡献。这就是我们在开拓性研究、启发性教育和（国际）国家合作方面团结起来的原因。

raw_payload.title: PhD Position Sustainable Additive Manufacturing from Recycled Stainless Steel
raw_payload.description:
Can scrap steels become the future of high-performance 3D printing? Join us in reshaping metal manufacturing by turning industrial waste into precision-engineered components through 3D-printing!

Job description
Join the Extreme Materials & Mechanics (X2M) Group at the Department of Materials Science and Engineering (MSE), TU Delft, in a cutting-edge PhD project that aims to revolutionize how stainless steel scrap is reused in high-performance applications. This research is part of the national Groeien met Groen Staal (GGS) programme, which supports the Dutch steel sector’s transition to a circular, CO₂-neutral future by 2050.

Additive Manufacturing (AM) is transforming the way we design and produce metal components. However, the sustainability of AM depends on the availability of high-quality powders—and that’s where this project comes in. Instead of relying on virgin materials, we aim to recycle 316L stainless steel from decommissioned industrial components into powders suitable for additive manufacturing processes.

This PhD project will experimentally validate the use of recycled stainless steel powders in AM by:
  • Producing powders via gas atomization (with program partner Space XYZ) and ultrasonic atomization (TU Delft).
  • Characterizing powder morphology, flowability, oxidation, and contamination.
  • Fabricating parts using LPBF printing, optimizing process parameters for recycled feedstock.
  • Benchmarking mechanical properties (tensile strength, elongation, hardness) against commercial powders.
  • Identifying industrial applications for recycled AM parts in sectors such as aerospace, medical, automotive, and marine.

You’ll work with TU Delft’s state-of-the-art facilities, including:
  • Powder analysis: SEM, laser diffraction, flowmeter, XPS, LECO, EDS.
  • Additive manufacturing: LPBF and Binder Jetting printers, post-processing tools.
  • Mechanical testing: tensile, hardness, nanoindentation, in-situ testing.
  • Microstructural analysis: optical microscopy, SEM, EBSD, XRD.

The expected start date is December 2025 (but can be later, depending on the candidate's availability and immigration procedures); the contract duration is 4 years.

Job requirements
It is highly recommended that the candidate is familiar with (or has a strong interest in):
  • Additive manufacturing, powder metallurgy, and sustainability.
  • Experience with experimental microstructural and mechanical characterization is a plus.

Other job requirements:
  • MSc degree in Materials Science, Metallurgy, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
  • excellent analytical skills, initiative, inventiveness, curiosity, diligence, and critical thinking.
  • ability to work with scientific and industrial partners.
  • strong communication skills (high English proficiency), team player, and good social behaviour.

TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.

At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.

Challenge. Change. Impact!

Faculty Mechanical Engineering
From chip to ship. From machine to human being. From idea to solution. Driven by a deep-rooted desire to understand our environment and discover its underlying mechanisms, research and education at the ME faculty focusses on fundamental understanding, design, production including application and product improvement, materials, processes and (mechanical) systems.

ME is a dynamic and innovative faculty with high-tech lab facilities and international reach. It’s a large faculty but also versatile, so we can often make unique connections by combining different disciplines. This is reflected in ME’s outstanding, state-of-the-art education, which trains students to become responsible and socially engaged engineers and scientists. We translate our knowledge and insights into solutions to societal issues, contributing to a sustainable society and to the development of prosperity and well-being. That is what unites us in pioneering research, inspiring education and (inter)national cooperation.

Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering. Do you want to experience working at our faculty? These videos will introduce you to some of our researchers and their work.

Conditions of employment
Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.

Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities , increasing from Promovendus gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.

As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills. Teaching activities are part of your PhD trajectory and may include, for example: supervising workgroups or lab sessions, assisting in courses, or mentoring BSc and MSc students. While teaching will not be your main responsibility, it offers valuable experience that supports your development and prepares you for future academic or professional roles.

The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.

Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit, Coming to Delft Service, offers information on their website to help you prepare your relocation. In addition, Coming to Delft Service organises events to help you settle in the Netherlands, and expand your (social) network in Delft. A Dual Career Programme is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands.

Additional information
Specific technical questions regarding the vacancy can be sent to Vera Popovich (v.popovich@tudelft.nl).

Application procedure
Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than 19 November 2025 via the application button and upload the following documents:
  • Your detailed CV
  • A cover (motivation) letter, two references
  • The abstract of your MSc thesis in English

You can address your application to Vera Popovich.

Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.

Please note:
  • You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
  • As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.
  • Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.

items.title_en: PhD position Circular Economy, Additive Manufacturing and Law (4 years)
items.title_zh: 博士职位循环经济、增材制造和法律（4 年）
items.description_en:
Erasmus School of Law, department Law & Markets, is looking for a fulltime PhD researcher in Circular Economy, Additive Manufacturing and Law (4 years).
PhD project Circular Economy, Additive Manufacturing and Law
Are you interested in how law and policy can accelerate the transition to a circular economy? Do you want to conduct critical and in-depth legal research at the intersection of sustainability, technology and regulation?
Then this PhD position at Erasmus School of Law is for you. Within the Law & Markets team, you will spend 4 years researching how European and Dutch regulatory frameworks can support the advancement of the circular economy through additive manufacturing (AM). How can legislation overcome obstacles such as consumer protection rules that prioritise “new” products over repair, intellectual property rights that restrict access to spare parts, or fragmented tax regimes? And how can binding, principle-based legal frameworks help turn circular economy goals into enforceable practice?
This PhD project will be part of a larger,
NWO-funded project on Additive Manufacturing in repair and remanufacturing (called ADD-ReAM),
which includes, in total, 15 PhD researchers who focus on other aspects such as technical design aspects, logistics, sustainability assessment, consumer behaviour, and more. This project will focus on the legal aspects of this challenge.
What will you research?
The circular economy is a cornerstone of the European Green Deal, yet current legal frameworks remain too focused on linear product lifespans. Existing initiatives like the Circular Economy Action Plan, Ecodesign regulation, Extended Producer Responsibility and the Right to Repair have laid important groundwork but fall short of enabling a systemic shift. At the same time, lobbying pressures, greenwashing risks and inconsistent regulatory incentives create barriers for innovative sectors such as additive manufacturing, which has the potential to radically change production and repair practices.
In this PhD research, you will legally analyse these regulatory barriers and explore how law and policy can create a clearer, more effective framework for circular practices. You will investigate both general legal challenges and selected case studies, combining desk research with stakeholder engagement through surveys, interviews and workshops. The aim is to develop actionable legal insights and recommendations that support the integration of circular economy principles into practice, with a specific focus on additive manufacturing.
There is plenty of room to develop your own research angle within this broad theme. We encourage a critical and independent perspective – your contribution matters.
Supervisor: Prof. dr. L. (Leonie) Reins, co-supervisor: Dr. A. (Alberto) Quintavalla
items.description_zh:
伊拉斯谟法学院法律与市场系正在寻找循环经济、增材制造和法律领域的全职博士研究员（4 年）。
博士项目循环经济、增材制造和法律
您对法律和政策如何加速向循环经济转型感兴趣吗？您想在可持续发展、技术和监管的交叉点进行批判性和深入的法律研究吗？
那么伊拉斯谟法学院的这个博士职位非常适合您。在法律与市场团队中，您将花费 4 年时间研究欧洲和荷兰监管框架如何通过增材制造 (AM) 支持循环经济的发展。立法如何克服障碍，例如优先考虑“新”产品而不是维修的消费者保护规则、限制获得备件的知识产权或分散的税收制度？具有约束力、基于原则的法律框架如何帮助将循环经济目标转化为可执行的实践？
该博士项目将是一个更大的、
NWO 资助的修复和再制造增材制造项目（称为 ADD-ReAM），
其中总共包括 15 名博士研究人员，他们专注于技术设计、物流、可持续性评估、消费者行为等其他方面。该项目将重点关注这一挑战的法律方面。
你会研究什么？
循环经济是欧洲绿色协议的基石，但当前的法律框架仍然过于关注线性产品寿命。循环经济行动计划、生态设计监管、生产者延伸责任和维修权等现有举措奠定了重要的基础，但未能实现系统性转变。与此同时，游说压力、漂绿风险和不一致的监管激励措施给增材制造等创新行业造成了障碍，而增材制造有可能从根本上改变生产和维修实践。
在这项博士研究中，您将从法律上分析这些监管障碍，并探索法律和政策如何为循环实践创建更清晰、更有效的框架。您将调查一般法律挑战和选定的案例研究，通过调查、访谈和研讨会将案头研究与利益相关者的参与结合起来。其目的是制定可操作的法律见解和建议，支持将循环经济原则融入实践，特别关注增材制造。
在这个广泛的主题内，有足够的空间来发展自己的研究角度。我们鼓励批判性和独立的观点——您的贡献很重要。
导师：教授、博士。 L. (Leonie) Reins，联合导师：A. (Alberto) Quintavalla 博士

items.title_en: Promovendus Landelijke Inventarisatie Particuliere Historische Buitenplaatsen
items.title_zh: 博士生国家私人历史乡村庄园清单
items.description_en:
Word jij de onderzoeker die de verborgen rijkdom van Nederlandse buitenplaatsen in kaart brengt? Verbind erfgoed, landschap en data in een uniek promotieproject.
Functieomschrijving
Nederland kent nog altijd veel historische buitenplaatsen, kastelen en landgoederen, die diep verweven zijn met het landschap. Deze buitenplaatslandschappen vormen unieke culturele, landschappelijke en ecologische systemen, maar hun toekomst staat onder druk door klimaatverandering, verstedelijking en veranderend gebruik.
Om dit waardevolle erfgoed te behouden en toekomstbestendig te maken, is overzicht en actuele kennis onmisbaar. Hoe kun je immers beschermen wat je niet kent? Daarom slaan de TU Delft en de Vereniging Particuliere Historische Buitenplaatsen (VPHB) de handen ineen voor de Landelijke Inventarisatie Particuliere Historische Buitenplaatsen: een promotieonderzoek dat een compleet en gedetailleerd overzicht ontwikkelt van particuliere complex historische buitenplaatsen en informatie samenbrengt over hun ruimtelijke opbouw en gebruik.
Het onderzoek start met de circa 200 buitenplaatsen binnen de VPHB en wordt later uitgebreid naar buitenplaatsen in de rest van Nederland. Deze zijn zorgvuldig ontworpen ensembles van gebouwen, tuinen en groenstructuren. Ze bestaan doorgaans uit een (voormalig) versterkt huis, kasteel, buiten- of landhuis met bijgebouwen, omgeven door tuinen, grachten, lanen, parken, (sier)weiden, waterpartijen en moestuinen. Samen vormen deze onderdelen een historisch gegroeid geheel waarin de wisselwerking tussen cultuur, natuur en ontwerp centraal staat.
Als promovendus speel jij een sleutelrol in dit project. Je brengt particuliere buitenplaatsen systematisch in kaart en bouwt aan een GIS-gebaseerde digitale database die inzicht biedt in ligging, gebruik, eigendom en ruimtelijke structuur. Hiervoor ontwikkel je een enquête die via persoonlijke interviews met particuliere eigenaren wordt afgenomen. De verkregen informatie vormt de basis voor de database, die je structureert, analyseert en visualiseert. Daarbij besteed je bijzondere aandacht aan de individuele buitenplaats, de historische groenaanleg en de manier waarop deze binnen bredere buitenplaatslandschappen functioneren.
Naast dit empirische werk ontwikkel je een wetenschappelijke methode en theoretisch kader voor het analyseren en representeren van buitenplaatslandschappen. Je onderzoekt hoe digitale kartering, data-integratie en landschapsanalyse kunnen bijdragen aan het behoud, beheer en toekomstgerichte ontwikkeling van dit particuliere erfgoed.
Het project vindt plaats in nauwe samenwerking met de VPHB, die toegang biedt tot een groot netwerk van particuliere eigenaren en buitenplaatsen. Je werkt binnen een interdisciplinair team met expertise in landschapsarchitectuur, cultuurgeschiedenis en erfgoedbeheer, verbonden aan de TU Delft, de Rijksuniversiteit Groningen en de Radboud Universiteit.
Binnen deze context krijg je ruimte voor eigen initiatief, verdieping en samenwerking. Je draagt bij aan de ontwikkeling van een digitale kennisinfrastructuur die niet alleen wetenschappelijke inzichten oplevert, maar ook praktische waarde heeft voor beleid, beheer en toekomstig onderzoek.
Tot je werkzaamheden behoren het ontwikkelen van een methodologie voor dataverzameling, kartering en analyse, en het ontwerpen en uitvoeren van een enquête die via persoonlijke interviews met particuliere eigenaren wordt afgenomen. Je bouwt en beheert een GIS-database met ruimtelijke en beschrijvende gegevens, voert analyses en visualisaties uit, en vertaalt de resultaten naar wetenschappelijke publicaties en je proefschrift. Daarnaast presenteer je bevindingen aan academische en maatschappelijke partners en draag je actief bij aan kennisdeling binnen de VPHB en aan een publieksgerichte digitale kaart.
Je maakt deel uit van de Sectie Landschapsarchitectuur, met een sterke onderzoekstraditie in buitenplaatsen en innovatieve technologie. In deze internationale omgeving versterken landschapsarchitectuur, erfgoed en technologie elkaar, en draag jij bij aan inzicht in hoe particuliere buitenplaatsen functioneren en duurzaam kunnen worden beheerd .
Functie-eisen
- Achtergrond in een relavant domein zoals landschapsarchitectuur, erfgoedstudies, geografie, planologie, landschapsgeschiedenis of een verwante discipline.
- Ervaring met ruimtelijke analyse, databewerking en/of erfgoedonderzoek.
- Interesse in de relatie tussen landschap, erfgoed en eigendom, en in de rol van particuliere buitenplaatsen in ruimtelijke kwaliteit en beleid.
- Vaardig met GIS (bijv. ArcGIS, QGIS) en databases.
- Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en gevoelig voor menselijke en institutionele relaties.
- Bekend met wetenschappelijke methoden voor dataverzameling en analyse, en bij voorkeur met interviewtechnieken, cartografische visualisatie of landschapsanalyse.
- In staat om samen te werken in een interdisciplinair team, initiatief te nemen en resultaatgericht te werken.
- Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal (mondeling en schriftelijk) en goede kennis van het Engels.
TU Delft
De Technische Universiteit Delft heeft een sterk fundament. Als bouwer van de wereldberoemde Nederlandse waterwerken en pionier in biotech is TU Delft een internationale topuniversiteit die wetenschap, engineering en design combineert. TU Delft staat voor onderwijs, onderzoek en innovatie van wereldklasse om uitdagingen op het gebied van energie, klimaat, mobiliteit, gezondheid en digitale maatschappij aan te gaan. Generaties Delftse ingenieurs hebben bewezen ondernemende probleemoplossers te zijn in bedrijfsleven en in sociale context.
Bij TU Delft omarmen we diversiteit als een van onze
kernwaarden
en
zetten we ons actief in
om een universiteit te zijn waar jij je thuis voelt en kunt floreren. We hechten veel waarde aan verschillende perspectieven en kwaliteiten, omdat wij geloven dat dit ons werk innovatiever, de TU Delft-gemeenschap levendiger en de wereld rechtvaardiger maakt. Samen bedenken en ontwikkelen we oplossingen die een positieve invloed hebben op wereldwijde schaal. Daarom nodigen we jou uit om te solliciteren. Je sollicitatie krijgt een eerlijke behandeling.
Challenge. Change. Impact!
Faculteit Bouwkunde
De faculteit Bouwkunde heeft wereldwijd een leidende rol in onderwijs en onderzoek. De drijvende kracht achter het succes van de faculteit is het robuuste onderzoeksprofiel in combinatie met de energie en creativiteit van de studenten en de academische gemeenschap. Het is een bruisende plek waar ruim vierduizend mensen van 's morgens vroeg tot 's avonds laat studeren, werken, ontwerpen, onderzoek doen en kennis vergaren en verspreiden. Onze faculteit heeft een sterke focus op ‘ontwerpgericht onderzoek' dat al enkele jaren wordt erkend en bekroond, met als resultaat een toppositie op de wereldranglijsten. Medewerkers en studenten werken aan de verbetering van de gebouwde omgeving met behulp van een breed scala aan disciplines, waaronder architectonisch ontwerp, stedenbouw, bouwtechnologie, sociale wetenschappen, procesmanagement en geo-informatiewetenschappen. De faculteit werkt nauw samen met andere faculteiten, universiteiten, private partijen en de publieke sector en heeft een uitgebreid netwerk, zowel in Nederland als internationaal.
Klik
hier
om naar de website van faculteit Bouwkunde te gaan.
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Promovendi krijgen in principe een dienstverband van 4 jaar aangeboden, maar in de vorm van 2 arbeidscontracten. Een eerste contract van 1,5 jaar met een officiële go/no go voortgangsbeoordeling binnen 15 maanden. Gevolgd door een aanvullend contract voor de resterende 2,5 jaar, ervan uitgaande dat alles goed gaat en aan de prestatie-eisen wordt voldaan.
Salaris en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn conform de CAO Nederlandse Universiteiten, oplopend van €3059 per maand in het eerste jaar tot €3881 in het vierde jaar. Als promovendus word je ingeschreven bij de TU Delft Graduate School. De TU Delft Graduate School biedt een inspirerende onderzoeksomgeving met een uitstekend team van begeleiders, wetenschappelijk personeel en een mentor. Het Doctoral Education Programme is gericht op het ontwikkelen van je overdraagbare, discipline-gerelateerde en onderzoeksvaardigheden.
De TU Delft biedt een aanpasbaar compensatiepakket, korting op de ziektekostenverzekering en een maandelijkse werkkostenbijdrage. Flexibele werkroosters zijn mogelijk.
Verhuis je naar Nederland voor deze baan? De TU Delft probeert er alles aan te doen om je verhuizing zo soepel mogelijk te laten verlopen! Coming to Delft Service, onderdeel van HR, biedt informatie via hun website om je te helpen bij het voorbereiden van de verhuizing. Daarnaast organiseert
Coming to Delft Service
evenementen om je (sociale) netwerk uit te breiden in Delft. Verder wordt er een
Dual Career Programma
aangeboden, om je meereizende partner te ondersteunen bij het zoeken naar een baan in Nederland.
Additionele informatie

Promoveren aan de TU Delft vereist Engelse taalvaardigheid op een bepaald niveau om ervoor te zorgen dat de kandidaat goed kan communiceren en interageren, kan deelnemen aan Engelstalige doctoraalcursussen en wetenschappelijke artikelen en een eindscriptie kan schrijven. De beoordeling gebeurt op basis van informatie die door kandidaat zelf is aangeleverd, zoals de motivatiebrief en het cv. De beoordeling vindt plaats bij de laatst overgebleven kandidaten in het selectieproces. Wanneer de uitkomst van de risicobeoordeling negatief is, dan wordt de kandidaat daarover geïnformeerd. De verwerking van persoonsgegevens in het kader van deze risicobeoordeling vindt plaats op basis van de wettelijke grondslag van de AVG ‘uitvoering van de publieke taak van algemeen belang’. items.description_zh:
您会成为绘制荷兰乡村庄园隐藏财富地图的研究人员吗？通过独特的宣传项目将遗产、景观和数据联系起来。
职位描述
荷兰仍然拥有许多历史悠久的乡村庄园、城堡和庄园，它们与风景深深地交织在一起。这些乡村庄园景观形成了独特的文化、景观和生态系统，但它们的未来面临着气候变化、城市化和用途变化的压力。
为了保护这一宝贵的遗产并使其面向未来，概述和最新知识是必不可少的。毕竟，你如何能保护你不知道的东西呢？这就是代尔夫特理工大学和私人历史乡村庄园协会 (VPHB) 联手开展国家私人历史乡村庄园清单的原因：这是一个博士研究项目，对私人历史乡村庄园进行完整而详细的概述，并汇集有关其空间结构和使用的信息。
该研究从 VPHB 内的约 200 个乡村庄园开始，随后将扩展到荷兰其他地区的乡村庄园。这些是精心设计的建筑、花园和绿色结构的整体。它们通常由（前）强化房屋、城堡、乡间别墅或带附属建筑的乡间别墅组成，周围环绕着花园、运河、大道、公园、（装饰性）草地、水景和菜园。这些部分共同构成了一个历史发展的整体，其中文化、自然和设计之间的相互作用是核心。
作为一名博士生，您在这个项目中发挥着关键作用。您系统地绘制私人乡村庄园的地图，并构建基于 GIS 的数字数据库，以深入了解位置、使用、所有权和空间结构。为此，您需要开展一项通过与私人业主进行个人访谈的调查。获得的信息构成数据库的基础，您可以构建、分析和可视化数据库。您特别关注各个乡村庄园、历史悠久的绿化以及它们在更广阔的乡村庄园景观中的运作方式。
除了这项实证工作之外，您还开发了一种科学方法和理论框架来分析和表示乡村庄园景观。您将研究数字测绘、数据集成和景观分析如何为这一私人遗产的保护、管理和面向未来的发展做出贡献。
该项目是与 VPHB 密切合作进行的，VPHB 提供了与私人业主和乡村庄园组成的大型网络的联系。您在隶属于代尔夫特理工大学、格罗宁根大学和拉德堡德大学的跨学科团队中工作，该团队拥有景观设计、文化历史和遗产管理方面的专业知识。
在此背景下，您将有发挥自己的主动性、深度和协作的空间。您为数字知识基础设施的发展做出贡献，该基础设施不仅提供科学见解，而且对政策、管理和未来研究具有实用价值。
您的职责将包括开发数据收集、绘图和分析的方法，以及设计和实施通过与私人业主进行个人访谈进行的调查。您使用空间和描述性数据构建和管理 GIS 数据库，执行分析和可视化，并将结果转化为科学出版物和论文。此外，您还向学术和社会合作伙伴展示研究结果，并积极为 VPHB 内的知识共享和面向公众的数字地图做出贡献。
您是景观设计部门的一员，在户外领域和创新技术方面拥有强大的研究传统。在这个国际环境中，景观设计、遗产和技术相互促进，您有助于深入了解私人乡村庄园如何运作和可持续管理。
职位要求
- 相关领域的背景，如景观设计、遗产研究、地理学、城市规划、景观历史或相关学科。
- 空间分析、数据处理和/或遗产研究方面的经验。
- 对景观、遗产和财产之间的关系以及私人乡村庄园在空间质量和政策中的作用感兴趣。
- 精通GIS（例如ArcGIS、QGIS）和数据库。
- 良好的沟通能力，对人际关系和机构关系敏感。
- 熟悉数据收集和分析的科学方法，最好熟悉访谈技术、制图可视化或景观分析。
- 能够在跨学科团队中合作，积极主动，以结果为导向。
- 精通荷兰语（口语和书面）并精通英语。
代尔夫特理工大学
代尔夫特理工大学基础雄厚。作为举世闻名的荷兰水厂的建设者和生物技术的先驱，代尔夫特理工大学是一所集科学、工程和设计于一体的国际顶尖大学。代尔夫特理工大学代表着世界一流的教育、研究和创新，以应对能源、气候、交通、健康和数字社会领域的挑战。代尔夫特的几代工程师已被证明是商业和社会环境中富有进取心的问题解决者。
在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们自己的一员
核心价值观
和
我们积极参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们非常重视不同的观点和品质，因为我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同设计和开发对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平对待。
挑战。改变。影响！
建筑学院
建筑学院在全球教育和研究领域发挥着主导作用。教师成功背后的驱动力是其强大的研究实力以及学生和学术界的活力和创造力。这是一个充满活力的地方，有四千多人从清晨到深夜学习、工作、设计、进行研究以及收集和传播知识。我们的教师非常注重“以设计为导向的研究”，多年来一直受到认可和奖励，在世界排名中名列前茅。教职员工和学生致力于利用建筑设计、城市规划、建筑技术、社会科学、过程管理和地理信息科学等广泛学科来改善建筑环境。该学院与其他院系、大学、私人团体和公共部门密切合作，在荷兰和国际上拥有广泛的网络。
点击
这里
访问建筑学院网站。
就业条件
原则上，博士生的聘用合同期限为4年，但采用2份聘用合同的形式。初始合同为期 1.5 年，并在 15 个月内进行正式的进展/不进展评估。假设一切顺利且满足性能要求，随后将签订剩余 2.5 年的附加合同。
工资和第二就业条件符合荷兰大学集体劳动协议，从第一年每月 3059 欧元增加到第四年每月 3881 欧元。作为博士候选人，您将在代尔夫特理工大学研究生院注册。代尔夫特理工大学研究生院提供了一个鼓舞人心的研究环境，拥有一支优秀的导师、科研人员和导师团队。博士教育计划旨在培养您的可转移、学科相关和研究技能。
代尔夫特理工大学提供适应性强的薪酬方案、健康保险折扣和每月工作费用缴款。灵活的工作安排是可能的。
您为了这份工作要搬到荷兰吗？代尔夫特理工大学竭尽全力让您的搬迁尽可能顺利！ Coming to Delft Service（人力资源部的一部分）通过其网站提供信息，帮助您为搬家做好准备。此外，还组织
来到代尔夫特服务
扩大您在代尔夫特（社交）网络的活动。此外，还将有一个
双轨制职业计划
愿意支持您的随行伴侣在荷兰找工作。
附加信息

s.nijhuis@tudelft.nl
。
有关申请程序的更多信息，请联系人力资源顾问 Stephanie Ip，电子邮件
招聘-BK@tudelft.nl

在代尔夫特理工大学获得博士学位需要一定水平的英语语言技能，以确保候选人能够良好地沟通和互动、参加英语博士课程和科学文章，并撰写最终论文。有关更多信息，请参阅
