items.description_en:
Are you interested in doing an experimental PhD at the interface of physics and chemistry, working on a fundamental research question with societal relevance? At the University of Amsterdam, we are looking for a PhD candidate who will use state-of-the-art techniques to investigate how the shape and aggregation of proteins is influenced by their interaction with nanoparticles.
Finding out how proteins interact with nanoparticles
Plastic nanoparticles are everywhere, including in our own bodies, and there is increasing evidence that these nanoparticles affect our health. The biological effects of nanoparticles are ultimately due to their interaction with proteins. However, very little is known about the underlying nanoplastic-protein interactions that give rise to these biological effects. In this project, you will use advanced spectroscopy methods to investigate how plastic nanoparticles change the shape and aggregation behavior of proteins. This project will be done in collaboration with prof. Mireille Claessens (WUR), dr. Ioana Ilie (UvA) and dr. Alberto Pérez de Alba Ortíz (UvA).
This is what you are going to do
- You will set up and perform experiments on nanoparticles and proteins using spectroscopy methods, in particular two-dimensional and diffusion-ordered optical spectroscopy
- You will learn to quantitatively analyze the multidimensional data sets resulting from your experiments
- You will cooperate with computer-simulation and biophysics research groups to interpret your data
- You will report your results in peer-reviewed journals and at international conferences
This is what we ask of you
- A MSc degree in physics or chemistry
- Good communication skills in oral and written English
- Experience with spectroscopy and/or soft matter is an advantage (but not required)
- Your interest in the specific topic of the research project should be explained in your application (otherwise you might not receive an answer to your application)
This is what we offer you
A temporary contract for 38 hours per week for the duration of 4 years (the initial contract will be for a period of 18 months and after satisfactory evaluation it will be extended for a total duration of 4 years). This should lead to a dissertation (PhD thesis). We will draft an educational plan that includes attendance of courses and (international) meetings. We also expect you to assist in teaching undergraduates and master students.
The gross monthly salary, based on 38 hours per week and ranges between €3,059 (1st year) to €3,881 (last year), scale P. This does not include 8% holiday allowance and 8,3% year-end allowance. The UFO profile Promovendus is applicable. A favourable tax agreement, the ‘30% ruling’, may apply to non-Dutch applicants. The
Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities
is applicable.
Besides the salary and a vibrant and challenging environment at Science Park we offer you multiple fringe benefits:
- 232 holiday hours per year (based on fulltime) and extra holidays between Christmas and 1 January;
- multiple courses to follow from our Teaching and Learning Centre;
- multiple courses on topics such as leadership for academic staff;
- multiple courses on topics such as time management, handling stress and an online learning platform with 100+ different courses;
- 7 weeks birth leave (partner leave) with 100% salary;
- partly paid parental leave;
- the possibility to set up a workplace at home;
- a pension at ABP for which UvA pays two third part of the contribution;
- the possibility to follow courses to learn Dutch.
Are you curious to read more about our extensive package of secondary employment benefits, take a look
here.
This is where you will work
The
Van 't Hoff Institute for Molecular Sciences
(HIMS) is one of eight institutes of the University of Amsterdam (UvA)
Faculty of Science
. HIMS performs internationally recognized chemistry and molecular research, curiosity driven as well as application driven. Research is organized into four themes:
Analytical Chemistry
,
Computational Chemistry
,
Synthesis & Catalysis
and
Molecular Photonics
. We cooperate closely with the
Soft-Matter research group
of the
Institute of Physics
(UvA).
The Faculty of Science has a student body of around 8,000, as well as 1,800 members of staff working in education, research or support services. Researchers and students at the Faculty of Science are fascinated by every aspect of how the world works, be it elementary particles, the birth of the universe or the functioning of the brain.

items.title_en: PhD Position on the History of the Indonesian Programme of Radio Netherlands Wereldomroep 1945-1965
items.title_zh: 荷兰 Wereldomroep 广播电台印度尼西亚节目历史博士职位 1945-1965
items.description_en:
Are you interested in radio studies and the shared history of Indonesia and the Netherlands? Then we are looking for you. The Amsterdam School of Historical Studies is inviting applications for a position of PhD candidate in the NWO-funded project ‘Distant Voices: Uncovering the Agency of Indonesian Broadcasters at Radio Netherlands Wereldomroep (1945-1965)’.
Pioneering radio studies
The project ‘Distant Voices’ pioneers a new methodology in radio studies by analyzing the agency of broadcasters from the Global South in media organizations in the Global North. The PhD candidate will write a thesis on a relevant case study: the history of the Indonesian programme of the Dutch international broadcaster Radio Netherlands Wereldomroep (1945-1965). The project’s preliminary outcomes will be discussed within an international network of media historians based in Asia and Europe. In addition the PhD candidate will contribute to joint activities of the University of Amsterdam and the project’s main institutional partner, the Netherlands Institute for Sound &Vision.
The PhD candidate will be supervised by Elizabeth Buettner and Vincent Kuitenbrouwer (History Department). The daily supervision is in the hands of Vincent Kuitenbrouwer, who is the Project Leader of ‘Distant Voices’.
This is what you will be doing
The PhD position aims to answer the project’s main research question: what was the role of Indonesians in shaping Radio Netherlands Wereldomroep broadcasts in Bahasa Indonesia between 1945 and 1965? The research for the thesis (written in English) will be based on a preselected set of digitized documents in Bahasa Indonesia and Dutch: the logbooks of the Indonesian programme of RNW containing transcripts and schedules. In addition the PhD candidate will have access to relevant collections of the Netherlands Institute for Sound &Vision.
The PhD candidate is expected to fulfill the following tasks:
- submission of a PhD thesis within the period of appointment;
- presenting intermediate research results at workshops and conferences;
- participating in the Research School and Faculty of Humanities PhD training programmes.
- co-organising knowledge dissemination activities;
- participating in meetings of the project research group in the Netherlands and Indonesia;
- (co-)teaching courses at BA-level in the second and third year of the appointment (maximum 0,2 fte per year).
This is what we ask of you
- a completed Master's degree in History, Media Studies or a related discipline;
- excellent research skills demonstrated by a Master thesis;
- the ability to independently formulate research questions, combined with a clear and convincing style of writing
- good command of Bahasa Indonesia, Dutch and English;
- a strong cooperative attitude and willingness to engage in collaborative research.
Please note that if you already hold a doctorate/PhD or are working towards obtaining a similar degree elsewhere, you will not be admitted to a doctoral programme at the UvA.
This is what we offer you
- We offer a temporary employment contract for the period of 48 months. The first contract will be for 16 months, with an extension for the following 32 months, contingent on a positive performance evaluation within the first 12 months. The preferred starting date is 1 May 2026.
- PhD candidates receive a tuition fee waiver;
- PhD candidates have free access to courses offered by the Graduate School of Humanities and the Dutch National Research Schools ;
Graduate School of Humanities
National Research Schools
- Excellent possibilities for further professional development and educations;
- An inspiring academic and international work environment in the heart of Amsterdam;
- An enthusiastic and professional academic team.
This is where you will be working
The Amsterdam School of Historical Studies (ASH) represents and fosters the study of the human past from Antiquity to the present day. It brings together more than 200 academics from Amsterdam’s Faculty of Humanities. ASH does not limit itself to a particular period, area or method, but integrates a variety of (inter)disciplinary perspectives, including history, literature and media studies.
For questions about the position or department, you can contact us during office hours at:
- Vincent Kuitenbrouwer, j.j.v.kuitenbrouwer@uva.nl , Senior Lecturer, History Department/Project Leader ‘Distant Voices’
j.j.v.kuitenbrouwer@uva.nl
If you recognize yourself in the profile and are interested in the position, we look forward to receiving your application. We ask the following documents:
- Motivation letter
- CV
- A short research statement on the PhD project, including a reflection on academic relevance and a provisional four-year work plan (maximum 2 pages)
- MA certificate and gradelist
- Contact information of two people who could act as reference
Please send these documents as a single PDF file.
The vacancy closes on 15-12-2025. The interviews will take place in the last week of January 2026.

开创性的无线电研究
“遥远的声音”项目通过分析南半球广播公司在北半球媒体组织中的作用，开创了广播研究的新方法。博士候选人将撰写一篇有关相关案例研究的论文：荷兰国际广播电台荷兰 Wereldomroep 电台的印度尼西亚节目的历史（1945-1965）。该项目的初步成果将在亚洲和欧洲的媒体历史学家国际网络中进行讨论。此外，博士候选人还将为阿姆斯特丹大学和该项目的主要机构合作伙伴荷兰声音与视觉研究所的联合活动做出贡献。
博士生将由 Elizabeth Buettner 和 Vincent Kuitenbrouwer（历史系）指导。日常监督由“遥远的声音”项目负责人文森特·奎滕布劳威尔负责。
这就是你要做的
该博士职位旨在回答该项目的主要研究问题：1945 年至 1965 年间，印度尼西亚人在塑造荷兰 Wereldomroep 广播电台印尼语广播方面发挥了什么作用？该论文的研究（以英语撰写）将基于一组预先选定的印尼语和荷兰语数字化文档：包含成绩单和时间表的 RNW 印尼项目日志。此外，博士候选人将有机会访问荷兰声音与视觉研究所的相关藏品。
博士候选人预计完成以下任务：
- 在聘期内提交博士学位论文；
- 在研讨会和会议上展示中间研究成果；
- 参加研究学院和人文学院的博士培训计划。
- 共同组织知识传播活动；
- 参加荷兰和印度尼西亚的项目研究组会议；
- 在任命的第二年和第三年（共同）教授学士学位课程（每年最多 0.2 名全职员工）。
这就是我们对你的要求
- 已完成历史、媒体研究或相关学科的硕士学位；
- 硕士论文展示了出色的研究技能；
- 独立提出研究问题的能力，结合清晰且令人信服的写作风格
- 精通印度尼西亚语、荷兰语和英语；
- 强烈的合作态度和参与合作研究的意愿。
请注意，如果您已经拥有博士学位或正在其他地方努力获得类似学位，您将不会被 UvA 的博士课程录取。
这就是我们为您提供的
- 我们提供为期 48 个月的临时雇佣合同。第一份合同为期 16 个月，根据前 12 个月内的积极绩效评估，可延期 32 个月。首选开始日期是 2026 年 5 月 1 日。
- 博士生获得学费减免；
- 博士生可以免费学习人文研究生院和荷兰国家研究学院提供的课程；
人文科学研究科
国家研究学校
- 进一步专业发展和教育的绝佳机会；
- 位于阿姆斯特丹市中心的鼓舞人心的学术和国际工作环境；

这就是您将工作的地方
阿姆斯特丹历史研究学院（ASH）代表并促进了对从古代至今的人类过去的研究。它汇集了来自阿姆斯特丹人文学院的 200 多名学者。 ASH并不局限于特定的时期、地区或方法，而是融合了多种（跨）学科视角，包括历史、文学和媒体研究。
如果对职位或部门有疑问，您可以在办公时间内联系我们：

j.j.v.kuitenbrouwer@uva.nl
如果您在个人资料中认出了自己并且对该职位感兴趣，我们期待收到您的申请。我们要求提供以下文件：

- 两个可以作为参考的人的联系信息
请将这些文档作为单个 PDF 文件发送。
该职位空缺将于 2025 年 12 月 15 日截止。面试将于 2026 年 1 月的最后一周进行。

raw_payload.title: PhD Position on the History of the Indonesian Programme of Radio Netherlands Wereldomroep 1945-1965
raw_payload.description:
Are you interested in radio studies and the shared history of Indonesia and the Netherlands? Then we are looking for you. The Amsterdam School of Historical Studies is inviting applications for a position of PhD candidate in the NWO-funded project ‘Distant Voices: Uncovering the Agency of Indonesian Broadcasters at Radio Netherlands Wereldomroep (1945-1965)’.

Pioneering radio studies
The project ‘Distant Voices’ pioneers a new methodology in radio studies by analyzing the agency of broadcasters from the Global South in media organizations in the Global North. The PhD candidate will write a thesis on a relevant case study: the history of the Indonesian programme of the Dutch international broadcaster Radio Netherlands Wereldomroep (1945-1965). The project’s preliminary outcomes will be discussed within an international network of media historians based in Asia and Europe. In addition the PhD candidate will contribute to joint activities of the University of Amsterdam and the project’s main institutional partner, the Netherlands Institute for Sound &Vision.

The PhD candidate will be supervised by Elizabeth Buettner and Vincent Kuitenbrouwer (History Department). The daily supervision is in the hands of Vincent Kuitenbrouwer, who is the Project Leader of ‘Distant Voices’.

This is what you will be doing
The PhD position aims to answer the project’s main research question: what was the role of Indonesians in shaping Radio Netherlands Wereldomroep broadcasts in Bahasa Indonesia between 1945 and 1965? The research for the thesis (written in English) will be based on a preselected set of digitized documents in Bahasa Indonesia and Dutch: the logbooks of the Indonesian programme of RNW containing transcripts and schedules. In addition the PhD candidate will have access to relevant collections of the Netherlands Institute for Sound &Vision.

The PhD candidate is expected to fulfill the following tasks:
  • submission of a PhD thesis within the period of appointment;
  • presenting intermediate research results at workshops and conferences;
  • participating in the Research School and Faculty of Humanities PhD training programmes.
  • co-organising knowledge dissemination activities;
  • participating in meetings of the project research group in the Netherlands and Indonesia;
  • (co-)teaching courses at BA-level in the second and third year of the appointment (maximum 0,2 fte per year).

This is what we ask of you
  • a completed Master's degree in History, Media Studies or a related discipline;
  • excellent research skills demonstrated by a Master thesis;
  • the ability to independently formulate research questions, combined with a clear and convincing style of writing
  • good command of Bahasa Indonesia, Dutch and English;
  • a strong cooperative attitude and willingness to engage in collaborative research.

Please note that if you already hold a doctorate/PhD or are working towards obtaining a similar degree elsewhere, you will not be admitted to a doctoral programme at the UvA.

This is what we offer you
  • We offer a temporary employment contract for the period of 48 months. The first contract will be for 16 months, with an extension for the following 32 months, contingent on a positive performance evaluation within the first 12 months. The preferred starting date is 1 May 2026.
  • PhD candidates receive a tuition fee waiver;
  • PhD candidates have free access to courses offered by the Graduate School of Humanities and the Dutch National Research Schools;
  • Excellent possibilities for further professional development and educations;
  • An inspiring academic and international work environment in the heart of Amsterdam;
  • An enthusiastic and professional academic team.

This is where you will be working
The Amsterdam School of Historical Studies (ASH) represents and fosters the study of the human past from Antiquity to the present day. It brings together more than 200 academics from Amsterdam’s Faculty of Humanities. ASH does not limit itself to a particular period, area or method, but integrates a variety of (inter)disciplinary perspectives, including history, literature and media studies.

For questions about the position or department, you can contact us during office hours at:
  • Vincent Kuitenbrouwer, j.j.v.kuitenbrouwer@uva.nl, Senior Lecturer, History Department/Project Leader ‘Distant Voices’

If you recognize yourself in the profile and are interested in the position, we look forward to receiving your application. We ask the following documents:
  • Motivation letter
  • CV
  • A short research statement on the PhD project, including a reflection on academic relevance and a provisional four-year work plan (maximum 2 pages)
  • MA certificate and gradelist
  • Contact information of two people who could act as reference

Please send these documents as a single PDF file.

The vacancy closes on 15-12-2025. The interviews will take place in the last week of January 2026.

items.title_en: Arts onderzoeker promovendus bloed biomarkers bij abdominaal aorta aneurysma
items.title_zh: 腹主动脉瘤的医生研究员博士生血液生物标志物
items.description_en:
Heb je interesse in medische wetenschap en ben je nieuwsgierig naar de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van cardiovasculaire ziekten? Wil je jouw onderzoeksvaardigheden inzetten voor baanbrekend onderzoek met directe impact op de zorg? Dit is je kans!
Binnen de unit Klinische Epidemiologie van de afdeling Cardiologie, in samenwerking met Vaatchirurgie en Radiologie, zoeken we een enthousiaste arts-onderzoeker voor een vernieuwend project. Dit onderzoek richt zich op de relatie tussen bloed biomarkers en volumeveranderingen (zoals gemeten op CT) bij patiënten met een abdominaal aorta aneurysma. Het cohort is al compleet en we hebben de eerste follow-up afgerond. We gaan nu de diepte in voor een lange-termijn follow-up.
Dit ga je doen:
- Je hebt een belangrijke rol in de klinische dataverzameling van de tweede follow-upronde.
- Je gaat aan de slag met de data-analyse van bestaande en nieuwe gegevens.
- Je zorgt voor verslaglegging in wetenschappelijke artikelen, resulterend in een proefschrift.
- Je krijgt de mogelijkheid om mee te werken aan andere innovatieve onderzoeksprojecten binnen de Cardiologie en Vaatchirurgie.
Waarom dit een unieke kans is:
- Je werkt samen met deskundigen op het gebied van epidemiologie, cardiologie en vaatchirurgie.
- Je krijgt de ruimte om jouw onderzoekstalent verder te ontwikkelen en ervaring op te doen in een interdisciplinaire omgeving.
- Je hebt een directe impact op de wetenschap én de zorg van de toekomst.
items.description_zh:
您对医学感兴趣，对心血管疾病领域的最新进展感到好奇吗？您想利用您的研究技能进行对医疗保健有直接影响的突破性研究吗？这是你的机会！
在心脏病科的临床流行病学部门内，我们正在与血管外科和放射科合作，为一个创新项目寻找一位热心的医生兼研究员。本研究重点关注腹主动脉瘤患者血液生物标志物与体积变化（通过 CT 测量）之间的关系。该队列已经完成，我们已经完成了第一次后续行动。我们现在深入进行长期跟进。
这就是你要做的：
- 您在第二轮随访的临床数据收集中发挥着重要作用。
- 您将致力于现有数据和新数据的数据分析。
- 您在科学文章中提供报告，从而形成论文。
- 您将有机会参与心脏病学和血管外科领域的其他创新研究项目。
为什么这是一个独特的机会：
- 您与流行病学、心脏病学和血管外科领域的专家一起工作。
- 您将有机会进一步发展您的研究才能并在跨学科环境中获得经验。
- 您对未来的科学和医疗保健有直接影响。

items.title_en: PhD Position on High-Efficiency Power Electronics for Solar-Integrated E-Mobility Systems (SUN-TRANS Project)
items.title_zh: 太阳能集成电动汽车系统高效电力电子博士职位（SUN-TRANS 项目）
items.description_en:
Join the University of Twente’s Power Electronics group to pioneer the next generation of wide-bandgap, high-efficiency converters for solar-integrated electric buses and last-mile delivery vehicles. This PhD will develop automotive-grade DC-DC and bidirectional converter systems that enable vehicle-integrated photovoltaics (VIPV) and intelligent charging hubs under the Horizon Europe project SUN-TRANS - Solar Urban e-Mobility Transition.
Cities worldwide are racing toward zero-emission mobility. The Horizon Europe project SUN-TRANS-ranked #1 in its EU call, unites leading universities, OEMs, and technology companies to develop solar-integrated electric buses, smart charging hubs, and advanced grid services.
Within this project, the University of Twente is involved in developing multi-port, high-efficiency converters based on SiC/GaN wide-bandgap devices and resonant topologies to achieve > 98% efficiency.
You will design, simulate, and experimentally validate DC-DC and DC-AC converter prototypes for vehicle-integrated photovoltaics (VIPV) and PV-powered charging stations, ensuring compliance with safety standards.
Working in an interdisciplinary environment, you will collaborate closely with European partners such as TÜBITAK MAM, Siemens, University of Warwick, Bozankaya, and ODTÜ-GÜNAM, and contribute to pilot demonstrations in Romania, Türkiye, and Spain.
The project provides a good mix of hands-on lab development, modelling, and system-level optimization in one of Europe’s most vibrant research ecosystems for sustainable energy and transport.
items.description_zh:
加入特文特大学的电力电子团队，为太阳能集成电动公交车和最后一英里运输车辆开发下一代宽带隙、高效转换器。该博士将开发汽车级 DC-DC 和双向转换器系统，在 Horizo​​n Europe 项目 SUN-TRANS - 太阳能城市电动交通转型下实现车辆集成光伏 (VIPV) 和智能充电中心。
世界各地的城市都在竞相实现零排放交通。 Horizo​​n Europe 项目 SUN-TRANS 在其欧盟呼吁中排名第一，联合领先的大学、原始设备制造商和技术公司开发太阳能集成电动公交车、智能充电中心和先进的电网服务。
在该项目中，特文特大学参与开发基于 SiC/GaN 宽带隙器件和谐振拓扑的多端口高效转换器，以实现 > 98% 的效率。
您将为车辆集成光伏 (VIPV) 和光伏供电充电站设计、模拟和实验验证 DC-DC 和 DC-AC 转换器原型，确保符合安全标准。
在跨学科环境中工作，您将与 TÜBITAK MAM、西门子、华威大学、Bozankaya 和 ODTÜ-GÜNAM 等欧洲合作伙伴密切合作，并为罗马尼亚、土耳其和西班牙的试点示范做出贡献。
该项目在欧洲最具活力的可持续能源和交通研究生态系统之一中提供了实践实验室开发、建模和系统级优化的良好组合。

items.title_en: PhD on contract-based design of complex dynamical systems
items.title_zh: 复杂动力系统契约设计博士
items.description_en:
Are you passionate about dynamical systems and system theory? Are you interested in making the design process of complex dynamical systems simpler by smart new tools for systems engineering? Are you eager to apply and valorize scientific results in this field in high-tech domains such as semiconductor machines and robots, together with highly innovative companies? Would you like to work in a team of 4 PhD students? Then, these PhD positions are made for you!
Information
We invite highly motivated students with a strong background in dynamical systems, mathematical system theory and control, and structural dynamics to apply for one of these PhD positions within the Dynamics and Control section at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Eindhoven University of Technology. The mission of the
Dynamics and Control
Section is to perform research and train next-generation students [BB1] on the topic of understanding and predicting the dynamics of complex engineering systems in order to develop advanced control, estimation, planning, and learning strategies which are at the core of the intelligent autonomous systems of the future:
Designing and realizing smart autonomous systems for industry and society.
Complex high-tech systems, such as semiconductor equipment, robots, industrial printers, self-driving cars, electron microscopes, etc., consists of many interconnected modules, together warranting the functionalities with[BB2] extreme requirements on speed and accuracy, for example to make the AI chips of the future. Translating requirements on the dynamical behaviour of the system as whole to design specifications (on dynamical behaviour) for these modules is an extremely challenging task, now typically performed by highly experienced system engineers.
Within this project, in which 4 PhD students will be employed (two at the Eindhoven University of Technology and two at Groningen University, both in the Netherlands), you will develop novel tools based on contract-based system theory to automate and make more precise these translations between system and module requirements. This will make design process both better and faster.
The first vacancy at TU/e involves a position with which tools will be developed to analyze system-level dynamics-related requirements (on both time- and frequency domain behaviour) on the basis of such requirements on the modules of which the system consists. Within the second vacancy, this challenge is considered for a particularly important class of systems, namely second-order structural dynamics systems with nonlinearities, often encountered in mechatronic and robotic applications.
You will have the chance to collaborate with 4 different high-tech companies in the field of chip manufacturing and robotics to apply the developed results in an industrial context, thereby building both a strong academic and industrial profile.
You will have access to the graduate courses at the Dutch Institute of Systems and Control (DISC) and the Engineering Mechanics Research School (EM) and will have the opportunity to collaborate with industry in the Brainport region and academic researchers worldwide. By joining us, you will be part of a vibrant community of more than 60 researchers including faculty members, postdocs and PhDs working on diverse topics in the field of dynamical systems and control and its applications.
This PhD position is jointly supervised by Nathan van de Wouw and Bart Besselink (University of Groningen).
items.description_zh:
您对动力系统和系统理论充满热情吗？您是否有兴趣通过智能新系统工程工具简化复杂动力系统的设计过程？您是否渴望与高度创新的公司一起在半导体机器和机器人等高科技领域应用和评估该领域的科学成果？您愿意在一个由 4 名博士生组成的团队中工作吗？那么，这些博士职位就是为您量身定做的！
信息
我们邀请在动力系统、数学系统理论与控制以及结构动力学方面具有深厚背景、积极性高的学生申请埃因霍温理工大学机械工程系动力与控制部门的博士职位之一。的使命
动力学与控制
该部分旨在进行研究并培训下一代学生 [BB1]，主题是理解和预测复杂工程系统的动态，以便开发先进的控制、估计、规划和学习策略，这些策略是未来智能自主系统的核心：
为工业和社会设计和实现智能自主系统。
复杂的高科技系统，如半导体设备、机器人、工业打印机、自动驾驶汽车、电子显微镜等，由许多互连的模块组成，共同保证了对速度和精度[BB2]极端要求的功能，例如制造未来的人工智能芯片。将整个系统动态行为的要求转化为这些模块的设计规范（动态行为）是一项极具挑战性的任务，现在通常由经验丰富的系统工程师来执行。
在这个项目中，将雇用 4 名博士生（两名在荷兰埃因霍温理工大学，两名在格罗宁根大学，均位于荷兰），您将开发基于契约系统理论的新颖工具，以实现系统和模块需求之间的自动化和更精确的转换。这将使设计过程变得更好更快。
TU/e 的第一个职位空缺涉及一个职位，该职位将开发工具来根据系统组成模块的要求来分析系统级动态相关要求（时域和频域行为）。在第二个空缺中，这一挑战被认为是针对一类特别重要的系统，即具有非线性的二阶结构动力学系统，在机电一体化和机器人应用中经常遇到。
您将有机会与芯片制造和机器人领域的 4 家不同高科技公司合作，将开发的成果应用于工业环境，从而建立强大的学术和工业形象。
您将有机会学习荷兰系统与控制研究所 (DISC) 和工程力学研究学院 (EM) 的研究生课程，并将有机会与 Brainport 地区的工业界和世界各地的学术研究人员合作。加入我们，您将成为一个由 60 多名研究人员组成的充满活力的社区的一部分，其中包括教职员工、博士后和博士，致力于动力系统和控制及其应用领域的不同主题。
该博士职位由 Nathan van de Wouw 和 Bart Besselink（格罗宁根大学）共同指导。

raw_payload.title: PhD on contract-based design of complex dynamical systems
raw_payload.description:
Are you passionate about dynamical systems and system theory? Are you interested in making the design process of complex dynamical systems simpler by smart new tools for systems engineering? Are you eager to apply and valorize scientific results in this field in high-tech domains such as semiconductor machines and robots, together with highly innovative companies? Would you like to work in a team of 4 PhD students? Then, these PhD positions are made for you!

Information
We invite highly motivated students with a strong background in dynamical systems, mathematical system theory and control, and structural dynamics to apply for one of these PhD positions within the Dynamics and Control section at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Eindhoven University of Technology. The mission of the Dynamics and Control Section is to perform research and train next-generation students [BB1] on the topic of understanding and predicting the dynamics of complex engineering systems in order to develop advanced control, estimation, planning, and learning strategies which are at the core of the intelligent autonomous systems of the future: Designing and realizing smart autonomous systems for industry and society.

Complex high-tech systems, such as semiconductor equipment, robots, industrial printers, self-driving cars, electron microscopes, etc., consists of many interconnected modules, together warranting the functionalities with[BB2] extreme requirements on speed and accuracy, for example to make the AI chips of the future. Translating requirements on the dynamical behaviour of the system as whole to design specifications (on dynamical behaviour) for these modules is an extremely challenging task, now typically performed by highly experienced system engineers.

Within this project, in which 4 PhD students will be employed (two at the Eindhoven University of Technology and two at Groningen University, both in the Netherlands), you will develop novel tools based on contract-based system theory to automate and make more precise these translations between system and module requirements. This will make design process both better and faster.

The first vacancy at TU/e involves a position with which tools will be developed to analyze system-level dynamics-related requirements (on both time- and frequency domain behaviour) on the basis of such requirements on the modules of which the system consists. Within the second vacancy, this challenge is considered for a particularly important class of systems, namely second-order structural dynamics systems with nonlinearities, often encountered in mechatronic and robotic applications.

You will have the chance to collaborate with 4 different high-tech companies in the field of chip manufacturing and robotics to apply the developed results in an industrial context, thereby building both a strong academic and industrial profile.

You will have access to the graduate courses at the Dutch Institute of Systems and Control (DISC) and the Engineering Mechanics Research School (EM) and will have the opportunity to collaborate with industry in the Brainport region and academic researchers worldwide. By joining us, you will be part of a vibrant community of more than 60 researchers including faculty members, postdocs and PhDs working on diverse topics in the field of dynamical systems and control and its applications.

This PhD position is jointly supervised by Nathan van de Wouw and Bart Besselink (University of Groningen).

items.description_en:
The PhD will develop AI methods and approaches to enable accurate characterization of metal scrap, for more efficient metal recovery and recycling
Job description
The volume of available metal scrap is steadily increasing, driven by rising end-of-life products, recycling opportunities, and growing industrial turnover. As this secondary resource becomes more abundant and diverse, it presents both a challenge and a strategic opportunity for circular metallurgy. Efficient and advanced recycling of scrap is critical to meet the growing demand for metals in a resource-constrained world and reduce their environmental footprint.In this context, the optimization of material recovery from end-of-life vehicle scrap is challenged not only by the heterogeneous and evolving nature of this scrap, but also by the diverse operational constraints and economic motivations across the value chain.
To address these challenges, the project will develop multi-modal artificial intelligence methods to characterize metal scrap composition with unprecedented detail, enabling dynamic, data-driven insight into the recoverable value of materials. Agentic AI systems will be designed to autonomously explore and propose optimal dismantling, sorting, and processing routes tailored to specific scrap streams. These intelligent agents will integrate scrap data and industry constraints to recommend strategies that maximize resource recovery and economic return. Together, these AI-driven tools will serve as a foundation for decision-making platforms that guide industry stakeholders toward more efficient, profitable, and sustainable recycling practices across the circular steel ecosystem.
This PhD position is part of the Groeien met Groen Staal program from the Dutch national growth fund (https://groeienmetgroenstaal.nl). The Groein met Groen Staal program is the enabler of a revolution in green steel production at national and international arenas. It will develop solutions to overcome technical, economic and societal bottlenecks towards the following overarching goals: i) Making Dutch steel sector a leader in sustainable steel; ii) Quadrupling of scrap sorting activities; iii) Tripling of steel reuse and remanufacturing activities; iv) Reducing dependence on foreign steel/iron ore through scrap recycling; v) Reducing industry CO2 emissions by 30% and reduce other emissions (including nitrogen oxides and particulate matter) by 50%.
The project contributes to reaching this overarching objective by enabling increased: i) cost/energy efficiency in recycling/recovery of metals from scrap, ii) scrap value, iii) recycled scrap amounts, iv) amounts of recovered critical elements.
This PhD position is also part of the interdisciplinary Climate Safety & Security centre (CaSS) at TU Delft | Campus The Hague. This centre runs an ambitious and comprehensive programme that considers climate change and stability in an integrated manner, with focus on human security, security of supply of fundamental needs (water, food) and essential resources (energy, critical materials). The PhD will contribute to the flagship materials security within CaSS. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to collaborate with researchers from across TU Delft, as well as policy makers from (inter)national governments and organisations in The Hague and beyond.
For more information on the TU Delft | Climate Safety & Security centre see:
www.tudelft.nl/en/campusthehague/research/cass
.
TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.
At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core
values
and we actively
engage
to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.
Challenge. Change. Impact!
Faculty Mechanical Engineering
From chip to ship. From machine to human being. From idea to solution. Driven by a deep-rooted desire to understand our environment and discover its underlying mechanisms, research and education at the ME faculty focusses on fundamental understanding, design, production including application and product improvement, materials, processes and (mechanical) systems.
ME is a dynamic and innovative faculty with high-tech lab facilities and international reach. It’s a large faculty but also versatile, so we can often make unique connections by combining different disciplines. This is reflected in ME’s outstanding, state-of-the-art education, which trains students to become responsible and socially engaged engineers and scientists. We translate our knowledge and insights into solutions to societal issues, contributing to a sustainable society and to the development of prosperity and well-being. That is what unites us in pioneering research, inspiring education and (inter)national cooperation.
Click
here
to go to the website of the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering. Do you want to experience working at our faculty? These
videos
will introduce you to some of our researchers and their work.
Conditions of employment
Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.
Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities , increasing from Promovendus gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.
As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills. Teaching activities are part of your PhD trajectory and may include, for example: supervising workgroups or lab sessions, assisting in courses, or mentoring BSc and MSc students. While teaching will not be your main responsibility, it offers valuable experience that supports your development and prepares you for future academic or professional roles.
The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.
The PhD-candidate will generally work at TU Delft main campus (with smart working options available as per TU Delft policies). The PhD-candidate will work one day a week at TU Delft | The Hague Campus (current location Bezuidenhoutseweg 63, Den Haag), together with the other CaSS researchers.
Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit,
Coming to Delft Service

Dual Career Programme
is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands.

该博士将开发人工智能方法和途径，以实现金属废料的准确表征，从而更有效地回收和循环利用金属
职位描述
在报废产品增加、回收机会和工业营业额不断增长的推动下，可用金属废料的数量正在稳步增加。随着这种二次资源变得更加丰富和多样化，它对循环冶金既带来了挑战，也带来了战略机遇。高效、先进的废料回收对于满足资源有限的世界对金属日益增长的需求并减少其环境足迹至关重要。在这种背景下，优化报废汽车废料的材料回收不仅受到这种废料的异质性和不断变化的性质的挑战，而且还受到整个价值链中多样化的运营限制和经济动机的挑战。
为了应对这些挑战，该项目将开发多模式人工智能方法，以前所未有的细节来表征金属废料成分，从而实现对材料可回收价值的动态、数据驱动的洞察。 Agentic AI 系统将被设计为自动探索并提出针对特定废料流定制的最佳拆解、分类和处理路线。这些智能代理将整合废料数据和行业限制，以推荐最大化资源回收和经济回报的策略。这些人工智能驱动的工具将共同成为决策平台的基础，引导行业利益相关者在整个循环钢铁生态系统中实现更高效、更有利可图和可持续的回收实践。
该博士职位是荷兰国家发展基金 (https://groeienmetgroenstaal.nl) 的 Groeien met Groen Staal 计划的一部分。 Groein met Groen Staal 计划是国内和国际舞台上绿色钢铁生产革命的推动者。它将制定解决方案，克服技术、经济和社会瓶颈，实现以下总体目标： i) 使荷兰钢铁行业成为可持续钢铁领域的领导者； ii) 废料分类活动增加四倍； iii) 钢材再利用和再制造活动增加两倍； iv) 通过废钢回收减少对外国钢铁/铁矿石的依赖； v) 工业二氧化碳排放量减少 30%，其他排放量（包括氮氧化物和颗粒物）减少 50%。
该项目通过提高以下各项来帮助实现这一总体目标：i) 从废料中回收/回收金属的成本/能源效率，ii) 废料价值，iii) 回收废料数量，iv) 回收关键元素的数量。
该博士职位也是代尔夫特理工大学跨学科气候安全与安保中心 (CaSS) 的一部分海牙校区。该中心实施了一项雄心勃勃的综合计划，以综合方式考虑气候变化和稳定，重点关注人类安全、基本需求（水、粮食）和基本资源（能源、关键材料）的供应安全。该博士将为 CaSS 内的旗舰材料安全做出贡献。成功的候选人将有机会与代尔夫特理工大学的研究人员以及海牙及其他地区的（国际）国家政府和组织的政策制定者合作。
有关代尔夫特理工大学的更多信息 |气候安全与安保中心参见：
www.tudelft.nl/en/campusthehague/research/cass
。
TU Delft（代尔夫特理工大学）
代尔夫特理工大学有着坚实的基础。作为举世闻名的荷兰水厂的创建者和生物技术的先驱，代尔夫特理工大学是一所集科学、工程和设计于一体的顶尖国际大学。它在教育、研究和创新方面提供世界一流的成果，以应对能源、气候、流动性、健康和数字社会领域的挑战。几代人以来，我们的工程师已被证明是商业和社会环境中的企业家问题解决者。
在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们的核心之一
价值观
并且我们积极地
参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们重视不同的观点和品质。我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同想象、发明和创造利用技术对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平的考虑。
挑战。改变。影响！
机械工程学院
从芯片到船舶。从机器到人。从想法到解决方案。在了解我们的环境并发现其潜在机制的根深蒂固的愿望的推动下，ME 教师的研究和教育侧重于基础理解、设计、生产，包括应用和产品改进、材料、工艺和（机械）系统。
ME 是一支充满活力和创新精神的教师队伍，拥有高科技实验室设施和国际影响力。它的师资力量雄厚，但也多才多艺，因此我们经常可以通过结合不同学科来建立独特的联系。这体现在 ME 杰出、最先进的教育中，它培养学生成为负责任的、积极参与社会的工程师和科学家。我们将知识和见解转化为社会问题的解决方案，为可持续发展的社会以及繁荣和福祉的发展做出贡献。这就是我们在开拓性研究、启发性教育和（国际）国家合作方面团结起来的原因。

博士生聘用期原则上为4年，但采用2份聘用合同的形式。最初的 1.5 年合同，并在 15 个月内进行正式的进展/不进展评估。如果一切顺利且满足性能要求，接下来将签订剩余 2.5 年的附加合同。

作为一名博士候选人，您将被代尔夫特理工大学研究生院录取。代尔夫特理工大学研究生院提供了一个鼓舞人心的研究环境，拥有一支优秀的导师、学术人员和导师团队。博士教育计划旨在培养您的可转移、学科相关和研究技能。教学活动是您的博士学位轨迹的一部分，例如可能包括：监督工作组或实验室会议、协助课程或指导学士和理学硕士学生。虽然教学不是您的主要职责，但它提供了宝贵的经验，支持您的发展并为您未来的学术或专业角色做好准备。
代尔夫特理工大学提供可定制的薪酬方案、健康保险折扣以及每月的工作成本缴款。可以安排灵活的工作时间。

raw_payload.title: PhD Position Metallurgical Model of Scrap Metal Streams
raw_payload.description:
The PhD will develop AI methods and approaches to enable accurate characterization of metal scrap, for more efficient metal recovery and recycling

Job description
The volume of available metal scrap is steadily increasing, driven by rising end-of-life products, recycling opportunities, and growing industrial turnover. As this secondary resource becomes more abundant and diverse, it presents both a challenge and a strategic opportunity for circular metallurgy. Efficient and advanced recycling of scrap is critical to meet the growing demand for metals in a resource-constrained world and reduce their environmental footprint.In this context, the optimization of material recovery from end-of-life vehicle scrap is challenged not only by the heterogeneous and evolving nature of this scrap, but also by the diverse operational constraints and economic motivations across the value chain.

To address these challenges, the project will develop multi-modal artificial intelligence methods to characterize metal scrap composition with unprecedented detail, enabling dynamic, data-driven insight into the recoverable value of materials. Agentic AI systems will be designed to autonomously explore and propose optimal dismantling, sorting, and processing routes tailored to specific scrap streams. These intelligent agents will integrate scrap data and industry constraints to recommend strategies that maximize resource recovery and economic return. Together, these AI-driven tools will serve as a foundation for decision-making platforms that guide industry stakeholders toward more efficient, profitable, and sustainable recycling practices across the circular steel ecosystem.

This PhD position is part of the Groeien met Groen Staal program from the Dutch national growth fund (https://groeienmetgroenstaal.nl). The Groein met Groen Staal program is the enabler of a revolution in green steel production at national and international arenas. It will develop solutions to overcome technical, economic and societal bottlenecks towards the following overarching goals: i) Making Dutch steel sector a leader in sustainable steel; ii) Quadrupling of scrap sorting activities; iii) Tripling of steel reuse and remanufacturing activities; iv) Reducing dependence on foreign steel/iron ore through scrap recycling; v) Reducing industry CO2 emissions by 30% and reduce other emissions (including nitrogen oxides and particulate matter) by 50%.

The project contributes to reaching this overarching objective by enabling increased: i) cost/energy efficiency in recycling/recovery of metals from scrap, ii) scrap value, iii) recycled scrap amounts, iv) amounts of recovered critical elements.

This PhD position is also part of the interdisciplinary Climate Safety & Security centre (CaSS) at TU Delft | Campus The Hague. This centre runs an ambitious and comprehensive programme that considers climate change and stability in an integrated manner, with focus on human security, security of supply of fundamental needs (water, food) and essential resources (energy, critical materials). The PhD will contribute to the flagship materials security within CaSS. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to collaborate with researchers from across TU Delft, as well as policy makers from (inter)national governments and organisations in The Hague and beyond.

For more information on the TU Delft | Climate Safety & Security centre see: www.tudelft.nl/en/campusthehague/research/cass.

Job requirements
We are looking for a highly motivated and self-driven candidate to conduct a research project.

For this PhD position, we are expecting a candidate with the following requisites:
  • MSc in materials science engineering. Backgrounds in chemistry, physics, computer science or a related area are also welcome.
  • Good expertise or strong interest in numerical modeling, machine learning, scientific programming.
  • Good communication skills in English, proficiency in report/paper writing and technical presentations.
  • A good team player, and willing to cooperate with partners and stakeholders (including other scientists and industry partners) relevant to the project.
  • Experience in i) metal recycling and recovery, and/or ii) applying artificial intelligence methods for materials characterization is an added value.

Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final PhD thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.

TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.

At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.

Challenge. Change. Impact!

Faculty Mechanical Engineering
From chip to ship. From machine to human being. From idea to solution. Driven by a deep-rooted desire to understand our environment and discover its underlying mechanisms, research and education at the ME faculty focusses on fundamental understanding, design, production including application and product improvement, materials, processes and (mechanical) systems.

ME is a dynamic and innovative faculty with high-tech lab facilities and international reach. It’s a large faculty but also versatile, so we can often make unique connections by combining different disciplines. This is reflected in ME’s outstanding, state-of-the-art education, which trains students to become responsible and socially engaged engineers and scientists. We translate our knowledge and insights into solutions to societal issues, contributing to a sustainable society and to the development of prosperity and well-being. That is what unites us in pioneering research, inspiring education and (inter)national cooperation.

Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering. Do you want to experience working at our faculty? These videos will introduce you to some of our researchers and their work.


Conditions of employment
Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.

Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities , increasing from Promovendus gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.

As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills. Teaching activities are part of your PhD trajectory and may include, for example: supervising workgroups or lab sessions, assisting in courses, or mentoring BSc and MSc students. While teaching will not be your main responsibility, it offers valuable experience that supports your development and prepares you for future academic or professional roles.

The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.

The PhD-candidate will generally work at TU Delft main campus (with smart working options available as per TU Delft policies). The PhD-candidate will work one day a week at TU Delft | The Hague Campus (current location Bezuidenhoutseweg 63, Den Haag), together with the other CaSS researchers.

Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit, Coming to Delft Service, offers information on their website to help you prepare your relocation. In addition, Coming to Delft Service organises events to help you settle in the Netherlands, and expand your (social) network in Delft. A Dual Career Programme is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands.

Additional information
If you would like more information about this vacancy or the selection procedure, please contact Dr. Kevin Rossi, Assistant professor Department of Materials Science and Engineering.

Email: K.r.rossi@tudelft.nl.

Application procedure
Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than 19 November 2025 via the application button and upload the following documents:
  • Motivation letter.
  • Full CV, with publication list and at least 2 references.
  • A copy of BSc. and MSc. diploma/certificates, and the certified transcripts.

You can address your application to Dr. Kevin Rossi or Dr. Yongxiang Yang.

For more information about position and the application procedure, please contact: Dr. Kevin Rossi via email (K.r.rossi@tudelft.nl).

Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.

Please note:
  • You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
  • As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.
  • Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.

items.description_en:
Wil jij bijdragen aan het ontwerpen van de toekomst van de zorg voor ouderen? Dan is deze unieke PhD-positie iets voor jou!
Functieomschrijving
Wil jij bijdragen aan vernieuwend onderzoek naar verleden, heden en de toekomst van zorg en samenleven? Binnen het NWO-gefinancierde project CARE VISiON onderzoeken wij samen met maatschappelijke partners hoe waarden – zoals solidariteit, autonomie, efficiëntie en rechtvaardigheid – de zorg voor ouderen in Nederland vormgeven. We kijken daarbij zowel naar sociale innovaties zoals “samenredzaamheid” als naar technologische vernieuwingen, en verkennen vanuit dit vertrekpunt ook de rol van waarden in bredere maatschappelijke transities. Het consortium verenigt ontwerpers, sociologen, historici, filosofen, en gezondheidszorgonderzoekers van vijf kennisinstellingen in Rotterdam en Delft, en zoekt promovendi en postdocs die enthousiast worden van interdisciplinair onderzoek en die theorie en praktijk met elkaar weten te verbinden. CARE VISiON biedt je de kans om vanuit je eigen discipline bij te dragen aan onderzoek dat zowel academisch vernieuwend als maatschappelijk relevant is.
Aan de faculteit Industrieel Ontwerpen van de TU Delft zoeken wij per 01-02-2026 een gemotiveerde PhD kandidaat die onderzoek gaat doen naar de toekomst van de ouderenzorg.
Als PhD kandidaat werk je op het snijvlak van toekomstverkenningen, systeemdenken en co-design.
Je werkzaamheden omvatten onder meer:
- Uitvoeren van literatuuronderzoek naar ontwikkelingen in de ouderenzorg, met een focus op waardes, technologie en mantelzorg.
- Toepassen van scenario-ontwikkel methodieken om toekomstscenario's te ontwikkelen.
- Deze vervolgens tastbaar maken in prototypes. Hierbij bouw je voort op de inzichten uit de andere deelstudies.
- Ontwerpen en faciliteren van co-creatie sessies met ouderen, zorgverleners en maatschappelijke partners.
- Beschrijven van je bevindingen in wetenschappelijke artikelen. Daarnaast deel je je bevindingen tijdens in workshops, relevante presentaties en andersoortige publicaties.
- Verzorgen van onderwijs binnen de opleiding Industrieel Ontwerpen van de TU Delft.
Je wordt lid van een inspirerende onderzoeksgroep binnen de afdeling Design, Organisation and Strategy van de faculteit Industrieel Ontwerpen, en werkt nauw samen met andere onderzoekers in de faculteit, het Erasmus MC (Afdeling Maatschappelijke Gezondheidszorg) en de Erasmus Universiteit (Erasmus School of Social and Behavioral Sciences en Erasmus School of Health Policy & Management).
Functie-eisen
- Een afgeronde masteropleiding in design.
- Aantoonbare ervaring of affiniteit met de gezondheidszorg of in het sociale domein.
- Aantoonbare ervaring met prototyping (aantoonbaar in een portfolio)
- Aantoonbare ervaring met design futures (design fiction, speculative design of aanverwante benaderingen)
- Interesse in complexe maatschappelijke vraagstukken.
- Uitstekende samenwerkingsvaardigheden. Ervaring met inter/transdisciplinair samenwerken verdient de aanbeveling.
- Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden. Je bent in staat om in het Engels op academische niveau te communiceren en te schrijven.
- Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal.
TU Delft
De Technische Universiteit Delft heeft een sterk fundament. Als bouwer van de wereldberoemde Nederlandse waterwerken en pionier in biotech is TU Delft een internationale topuniversiteit die wetenschap, engineering en design combineert. TU Delft staat voor onderwijs, onderzoek en innovatie van wereldklasse om uitdagingen op het gebied van energie, klimaat, mobiliteit, gezondheid en digitale maatschappij aan te gaan. Generaties Delftse ingenieurs hebben bewezen ondernemende probleemoplossers te zijn in bedrijfsleven en in sociale context.Bij TU Delft omarmen we diversiteit als een van onze
kernwaarden
en
zetten we ons actief in
om een universiteit te zijn waar jij je thuis voelt en kunt floreren. We hechten veel waarde aan verschillende perspectieven en kwaliteiten, omdat wij geloven dat dit ons werk innovatiever, de TU Delft-gemeenschap levendiger en de wereld rechtvaardiger maakt. Samen bedenken en ontwikkelen we oplossingen die een positieve invloed hebben op wereldwijde schaal. Daarom nodigen we jou uit om te solliciteren. Je sollicitatie krijgt een eerlijke behandeling.
Challenge. Change. Impact!
Faculteit IO (Industrieel Ontwerpen)
Hoe zorgen we ervoor dat de snelheden van menselijke en technologische ontwikkeling gelijke tred houden? Dat is de focus van de faculteit Industrieel Ontwerpen (IO). Delftse ontwerpers zijn een brug tussen technologische innovatie en de behoeftes van mensen, onze maatschappij en organisaties. Zij ontwerpen hiervoor doelbewuste producten, diensten en systemen. IO is leider in ontwerponderzoek, met toepassingen op gebieden als mobiliteit, duurzaamheid en gezondheid, alsook ontwikkeling van ontwerptools en methodes. Een sterk onderzoeksteam van 350 personen en meer dan 2.000 studenten werken samen in onze kenmerkende hal, laboratoria en studio’s. In nauwe samenwerking met de praktijk, de publieke sector en Ngo’s en met oog op de toenemende complexiteit repeteren wij met ons onderzoek en onderwijs mogelijke toekomstscenario’s.
Klik
hier
om naar de website van faculteit Industrieel Ontwerpen te gaan.
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Promovendi krijgen in principe een dienstverband van 4 jaar aangeboden, maar in de vorm van 2 arbeidscontracten. Een eerste contract van 1,5 jaar met een officiële go/no go voortgangsbeoordeling binnen 15 maanden. Gevolgd door een aanvullend contract voor de resterende 2,5 jaar, ervan uitgaande dat alles goed gaat en aan de prestatie-eisen wordt voldaan.
Salaris en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn conform de CAO Nederlandse Universiteitenen lopen op van Promovendus bruto per maand, vanaf het eerste tot en met het vierde jaar op basis van een fulltime contract (38 uur), plus 8% vakantietoeslag en een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,3%.
Als promovendus word je ingeschreven bij de TU Delft Graduate School. De TU Delft Graduate School biedt een inspirerende onderzoeksomgeving met een uitstekend team van begeleiders, wetenschappelijk personeel en een mentor. Het Doctoral Education Programme is gericht op het ontwikkelen van je overdraagbare, discipline-gerelateerde en onderzoeksvaardigheden.
De TU Delft biedt een aanpasbaar compensatiepakket, korting op de ziektekostenverzekering en een maandelijkse werkkostenbijdrage. Flexibele werkroosters zijn mogelijk.
Verhuis je naar Nederland voor deze baan? De TU Delft probeert er alles aan te doen om je verhuizing zo soepel mogelijk te laten verlopen! Coming to Delft Service, onderdeel van HR, biedt informatie via hun website om je te helpen bij het voorbereiden van de verhuizing. Daarnaast organiseert
Coming to Delft Service
evenementen om je (sociale) netwerk uit te breiden in Delft. Verder wordt er een
Dual Career Programma
aangeboden, om je meereizende partner te ondersteunen bij het zoeken naar een baan in Nederland.
Verder bieden wij:
- Een inspirerende werkomgeving op TU Delft.
- Begeleiding en samenwerking binnen een multidisciplinair team van experts.
- Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling, netwerken en profilering binnen een actueel en urgent domein.
- De mogelijkheid om maatschappelijke impact te maken via toegepast ontwerpend onderzoek.
Additionele informatie
Voor inhoudelijke vragen kun je contact opnemen met Judith Rietjens, hoogleraar Design for Public Health via
j.a.c.rietjens@tudelft.nl
21 november 2025
met een motivatiebrief, CV, portfolio, en een voorbeeld van een door jou geschreven academische tekst (scriptie of een ander document).
Je kunt je sollicitatie richten aan Judith Rietjens, hoogleraar Design for Public Health.
Promoveren aan de TU Delft vereist Engelse taalvaardigheid op een bepaald niveau om ervoor te zorgen dat de kandidaat goed kan communiceren en interageren, kan deelnemen aan Engelstalige doctoraalcursussen en wetenschappelijke artikelen en een eindscriptie kan schrijven. Kijk voor meer informatie in de
Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.
Let op:
- Solliciteren gaat eenvoudig online. Sollicitaties die per email en/of post worden verstuurd nemen we niet in behandeling.
- TU Delft voert in het kader van kennisveiligheid een risicobeoordeling uit bij het werven van personeel. Dit doen wij onder meer om ongewenste overdracht van gevoelige kennis en technologie te voorkomen. De beoordeling gebeurt op basis van informatie die door kandidaat zelf is aangeleverd, zoals de motivatiebrief en het cv. De beoordeling vindt plaats bij de laatst overgebleven kandidaten in het selectieproces. Wanneer de uitkomst van de risicobeoordeling negatief is, dan wordt de kandidaat daarover geïnformeerd. De verwerking van persoonsgegevens in het kader van deze risicobeoordeling vindt plaats op basis van de wettelijke grondslag van de AVG ‘uitvoering van de publieke taak van algemeen belang’. Meer informatie over deze beoordeling vind je op onze website over kennisveiligheid .

您想为设计老年人护理的未来做出贡献吗？那么这个独特的博士职位非常适合您！
职位描述
您想为护理和共同生活的过去、现在和未来的创新研究做出贡献吗？在 NWO 资助的 CARE VISION 项目中，我们与社会合作伙伴一起调查团结、自主、效率和正义等价值观如何影响荷兰老年人的护理。我们关注“共依”等社会创新以及技术创新，并从这个出发点探讨价值观在更广泛的社会转型中的作用。该联盟联合了来自鹿特丹和代尔夫特五个知识机构的设计师、社会学家、历史学家、哲学家和医疗保健研究人员，正在寻找热衷于跨学科研究并知道如何将理论与实践联系起来的博士生和博士后。 CARE VISION 为您提供了从自己的学科到学术创新和社会相关研究做出贡献的机会。
在代尔夫特理工大学工业设计学院，我们正在寻找一位积极进取的博士候选人，他将于 2026 年 1 月 2 日开始研究老年护理的未来。
作为一名博士候选人，您的工作涉及未来研究、系统思维和协同设计的交叉点。
您的职责包括：
- 对老年护理的发展进行文献研究，重点关注价值观、技术和非正式护理。
- 应用场景开发方法来开发未来场景。
- 然后在原型中使其具体化。您以其他子研究的见解为基础。
- 设计并促进与老年人、医疗保健提供者和社会合作伙伴的共同创造会议。
- 在科学文章中描述您的发现。您还可以在研讨会、相关演示和其他类型的出版物中分享您的发现。
- 在代尔夫特理工大学的工业设计课程中提供教育。
您将成为工业设计学院设计、组织和战略系的一个鼓舞人心的研究小组的成员，并与该学院、伊拉斯姆斯MC（社会保健系）和伊拉斯姆斯大学（伊拉斯姆斯社会与行为科学学院和伊拉斯姆斯健康政策与管理学院）的其他研究人员密切合作。
职位要求
- 已完成设计硕士学位。
- 在医疗保健或社交领域具有明显的经验或亲和力。
- 具有原型设计经验（可在作品集中展示）
- 具有设计未来的丰富经验（设计小说、推测性设计或相关方法）
- 对复杂社会问题的兴趣。
- 优秀的协作能力。建议具有跨学科合作经验。
- 你有出色的沟通能力。您能够在学术水平上用英语进行交流和写作。
- 掌握荷兰语。
代尔夫特理工大学
代尔夫特理工大学基础雄厚。作为举世闻名的荷兰水厂的建设者和生物技术的先驱，代尔夫特理工大学是一所集科学、工程和设计于一体的国际顶尖大学。代尔夫特理工大学代表着世界一流的教育、研究和创新，以应对能源、气候、交通、健康和数字社会领域的挑战。代尔夫特的几代工程师已被证明是商业和社会环境中富有进取心的问题解决者。在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们的价值观之一
核心价值观
和
我们积极参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们非常重视不同的观点和品质，因为我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同设计和开发对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平对待。
挑战。改变。影响！
IDE学院（工业设计）
我们如何确保人类和技术发展的速度跟上？这是工业设计学院（IDE）的重点。代尔夫特设计师是技术创新与人们、社会和组织需求之间的桥梁。他们有目的地为此目的设计产品、服务和系统。 IO 是设计研究领域的领导者，其应用领域包括移动性、可持续性和健康，以及设计工具和方法的开发。一支由350人组成的强大研究团队和2000多名学生在我们特色的大厅、实验室和工作室里共同工作。鉴于日益复杂的情况，我们与实践、公共部门和非政府组织密切合作，通过我们的研究和教育演练未来可能的情景。
点击
这里
访问工业设计学院网站。
就业条件
原则上，博士生的聘用合同期限为4年，但采用2份聘用合同的形式。初始合同为期 1.5 年，并在 15 个月内进行正式的进展/不进展评估。假设一切顺利且满足性能要求，随后将签订剩余 2.5 年的附加合同。
薪资和第二就业条件符合荷兰大学集体劳动协议，从第一年到第四年，在全职合同（38小时）的基础上，博士候选人每月毛额增加，加上8%的假期津贴和8.3%的年终奖金。
作为博士候选人，您将在代尔夫特理工大学研究生院注册。代尔夫特理工大学研究生院提供了一个鼓舞人心的研究环境，拥有一支优秀的导师、科研人员和导师团队。博士教育计划旨在培养您的可转移、学科相关和研究技能。
代尔夫特理工大学提供适应性强的薪酬方案、健康保险折扣和每月工作费用缴款。灵活的工作安排是可能的。
您为了这份工作要搬到荷兰吗？代尔夫特理工大学竭尽全力让您的搬迁尽可能顺利！ Coming to Delft Service（人力资源部的一部分）通过其网站提供信息，帮助您为搬家做好准备。此外，还组织
来到代尔夫特服务
扩大您在代尔夫特（社交）网络的活动。此外，还将有一个
双轨制职业计划

raw_payload.title: PhD onderzoeker ontwerpen van toekomstscenario's in zorg en samenleving
raw_payload.description:
Wil jij bijdragen aan het ontwerpen van de toekomst van de zorg voor ouderen? Dan is deze unieke PhD-positie iets voor jou!

Functieomschrijving
Wil jij bijdragen aan vernieuwend onderzoek naar verleden, heden en de toekomst van zorg en samenleven? Binnen het NWO-gefinancierde project CARE VISiON onderzoeken wij samen met maatschappelijke partners hoe waarden – zoals solidariteit, autonomie, efficiëntie en rechtvaardigheid – de zorg voor ouderen in Nederland vormgeven. We kijken daarbij zowel naar sociale innovaties zoals “samenredzaamheid” als naar technologische vernieuwingen, en verkennen vanuit dit vertrekpunt ook de rol van waarden in bredere maatschappelijke transities. Het consortium verenigt ontwerpers, sociologen, historici, filosofen, en gezondheidszorgonderzoekers van vijf kennisinstellingen in Rotterdam en Delft, en zoekt promovendi en postdocs die enthousiast worden van interdisciplinair onderzoek en die theorie en praktijk met elkaar weten te verbinden. CARE VISiON biedt je de kans om vanuit je eigen discipline bij te dragen aan onderzoek dat zowel academisch vernieuwend als maatschappelijk relevant is.

Aan de faculteit Industrieel Ontwerpen van de TU Delft zoeken wij per 01-02-2026 een gemotiveerde PhD kandidaat die onderzoek gaat doen naar de toekomst van de ouderenzorg.

Als PhD kandidaat werk je op het snijvlak van toekomstverkenningen, systeemdenken en co-design.

Je werkzaamheden omvatten onder meer:
  • Uitvoeren van literatuuronderzoek naar ontwikkelingen in de ouderenzorg, met een focus op waardes, technologie en mantelzorg.
  • Toepassen van scenario-ontwikkel methodieken om toekomstscenario's te ontwikkelen.
  • Deze vervolgens tastbaar maken in prototypes. Hierbij bouw je voort op de inzichten uit de andere deelstudies.
  • Ontwerpen en faciliteren van co-creatie sessies met ouderen, zorgverleners en maatschappelijke partners.
  • Beschrijven van je bevindingen in wetenschappelijke artikelen. Daarnaast deel je je bevindingen tijdens in workshops, relevante presentaties en andersoortige publicaties.
  • Verzorgen van onderwijs binnen de opleiding Industrieel Ontwerpen van de TU Delft.

Je wordt lid van een inspirerende onderzoeksgroep binnen de afdeling Design, Organisation and Strategy van de faculteit Industrieel Ontwerpen, en werkt nauw samen met andere onderzoekers in de faculteit, het Erasmus MC (Afdeling Maatschappelijke Gezondheidszorg) en de Erasmus Universiteit (Erasmus School of Social and Behavioral Sciences en Erasmus School of Health Policy & Management).

Functie-eisen
  • Een afgeronde masteropleiding in design.
  • Aantoonbare ervaring of affiniteit met de gezondheidszorg of in het sociale domein.
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met prototyping (aantoonbaar in een portfolio)
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met design futures (design fiction, speculative design of aanverwante benaderingen)
  • Interesse in complexe maatschappelijke vraagstukken.
  • Uitstekende samenwerkingsvaardigheden. Ervaring met inter/transdisciplinair samenwerken verdient de aanbeveling.
  • Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden. Je bent in staat om in het Engels op academische niveau te communiceren en te schrijven.
  • Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal.

TU Delft
De Technische Universiteit Delft heeft een sterk fundament. Als bouwer van de wereldberoemde Nederlandse waterwerken en pionier in biotech is TU Delft een internationale topuniversiteit die wetenschap, engineering en design combineert. TU Delft staat voor onderwijs, onderzoek en innovatie van wereldklasse om uitdagingen op het gebied van energie, klimaat, mobiliteit, gezondheid en digitale maatschappij aan te gaan. Generaties Delftse ingenieurs hebben bewezen ondernemende probleemoplossers te zijn in bedrijfsleven en in sociale context.Bij TU Delft omarmen we diversiteit als een van onze kernwaarden en zetten we ons actief in om een universiteit te zijn waar jij je thuis voelt en kunt floreren. We hechten veel waarde aan verschillende perspectieven en kwaliteiten, omdat wij geloven dat dit ons werk innovatiever, de TU Delft-gemeenschap levendiger en de wereld rechtvaardiger maakt. Samen bedenken en ontwikkelen we oplossingen die een positieve invloed hebben op wereldwijde schaal. Daarom nodigen we jou uit om te solliciteren. Je sollicitatie krijgt een eerlijke behandeling.
Challenge. Change. Impact!

Faculteit IO (Industrieel Ontwerpen)
Hoe zorgen we ervoor dat de snelheden van menselijke en technologische ontwikkeling gelijke tred houden? Dat is de focus van de faculteit Industrieel Ontwerpen (IO). Delftse ontwerpers zijn een brug tussen technologische innovatie en de behoeftes van mensen, onze maatschappij en organisaties. Zij ontwerpen hiervoor doelbewuste producten, diensten en systemen. IO is leider in ontwerponderzoek, met toepassingen op gebieden als mobiliteit, duurzaamheid en gezondheid, alsook ontwikkeling van ontwerptools en methodes. Een sterk onderzoeksteam van 350 personen en meer dan 2.000 studenten werken samen in onze kenmerkende hal, laboratoria en studio’s. In nauwe samenwerking met de praktijk, de publieke sector en Ngo’s en met oog op de toenemende complexiteit repeteren wij met ons onderzoek en onderwijs mogelijke toekomstscenario’s.

Klik hier om naar de website van faculteit Industrieel Ontwerpen te gaan.

Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Promovendi krijgen in principe een dienstverband van 4 jaar aangeboden, maar in de vorm van 2 arbeidscontracten. Een eerste contract van 1,5 jaar met een officiële go/no go voortgangsbeoordeling binnen 15 maanden. Gevolgd door een aanvullend contract voor de resterende 2,5 jaar, ervan uitgaande dat alles goed gaat en aan de prestatie-eisen wordt voldaan.

Salaris en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn conform de CAO Nederlandse Universiteitenen lopen op van Promovendus bruto per maand, vanaf het eerste tot en met het vierde jaar op basis van een fulltime contract (38 uur), plus 8% vakantietoeslag en een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,3%.

Als promovendus word je ingeschreven bij de TU Delft Graduate School. De TU Delft Graduate School biedt een inspirerende onderzoeksomgeving met een uitstekend team van begeleiders, wetenschappelijk personeel en een mentor. Het Doctoral Education Programme is gericht op het ontwikkelen van je overdraagbare, discipline-gerelateerde en onderzoeksvaardigheden.

De TU Delft biedt een aanpasbaar compensatiepakket, korting op de ziektekostenverzekering en een maandelijkse werkkostenbijdrage. Flexibele werkroosters zijn mogelijk.

Verhuis je naar Nederland voor deze baan? De TU Delft probeert er alles aan te doen om je verhuizing zo soepel mogelijk te laten verlopen! Coming to Delft Service, onderdeel van HR, biedt informatie via hun website om je te helpen bij het voorbereiden van de verhuizing. Daarnaast organiseert Coming to Delft Service evenementen om je (sociale) netwerk uit te breiden in Delft. Verder wordt er een Dual Career Programma aangeboden, om je meereizende partner te ondersteunen bij het zoeken naar een baan in Nederland.

Verder bieden wij:
  • Een inspirerende werkomgeving op TU Delft.
  • Begeleiding en samenwerking binnen een multidisciplinair team van experts.
  • Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling, netwerken en profilering binnen een actueel en urgent domein.
  • De mogelijkheid om maatschappelijke impact te maken via toegepast ontwerpend onderzoek.

Additionele informatie
Voor inhoudelijke vragen kun je contact opnemen met Judith Rietjens, hoogleraar Design for Public Health via j.a.c.rietjens@tudelft.nl

Sollicitatieprocedure
Heb je interesse in deze vacature? Solliciteer dan uiterlijk 21 november 2025 met een motivatiebrief, CV, portfolio, en een voorbeeld van een door jou geschreven academische tekst (scriptie of een ander document).

Je kunt je sollicitatie richten aan Judith Rietjens, hoogleraar Design for Public Health.

Promoveren aan de TU Delft vereist Engelse taalvaardigheid op een bepaald niveau om ervoor te zorgen dat de kandidaat goed kan communiceren en interageren, kan deelnemen aan Engelstalige doctoraalcursussen en wetenschappelijke artikelen en een eindscriptie kan schrijven. Kijk voor meer informatie in de Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.

Let op:
  • Solliciteren gaat eenvoudig online. Sollicitaties die per email en/of post worden verstuurd nemen we niet in behandeling.
  • TU Delft voert in het kader van kennisveiligheid een risicobeoordeling uit bij het werven van personeel. Dit doen wij onder meer om ongewenste overdracht van gevoelige kennis en technologie te voorkomen. De beoordeling gebeurt op basis van informatie die door kandidaat zelf is aangeleverd, zoals de motivatiebrief en het cv. De beoordeling vindt plaats bij de laatst overgebleven kandidaten in het selectieproces. Wanneer de uitkomst van de risicobeoordeling negatief is, dan wordt de kandidaat daarover geïnformeerd. De verwerking van persoonsgegevens in het kader van deze risicobeoordeling vindt plaats op basis van de wettelijke grondslag van de AVG ‘uitvoering van de publieke taak van algemeen belang’. Meer informatie over deze beoordeling vind je op onze website over kennisveiligheid.
  • Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

items.description_en:
Interested to push the technological limits of energy kites and contribute to the industrialization of a promising disruptive renewable energy technology, collaborating with leading developers?
Job description
Wind energy is a critical component of the energy transition. Although it is one of the fastest-growing renewable energy sources globally, the targeted threefold increase of installed generation capacity until 2030 will be challenging to meet. Airborne wind energy (AWE) is an emerging technology that can complement conventional turbines while reducing the material consumption and environmental impact of energy generation.
This PhD project is part of the MSCA Doctoral Network AWETRAIN (Airborne Wind Energy TRAining for Industrialization Network). Its objective is to investigate the optimal configuration for utility-scale AWE farms, considering the physics, economics, and environmental impact. To determine the optimal scaling strategies for kite farms, a toolchain comprising a statistical description of the wind resource and physics-based models of the AWE system will be combined with a cost model of the farm. Is it better to scale up the individual systems or to combine multiple smaller-scale systems into a farm? The cost model will be augmented with a life cycle analysis to incorporate the environmental impact of the used materials into the analysis. All relevant interaction mechanisms between the individual AWE systems of the farm will be taken into account. Many components of this toolchain already exist and have been validated for smaller-scale AWE systems (
https://github.com/awegroup/
).
The main activities of this project will be: i) combining wind resource statistics with a physics-based system engineering model, focused on kite design and nominal operation, using this toolchain for preliminary optimization of AWE devices and plants based on physical metrics, ii) adding a cost model for AWE farms, and using this for preliminary optimization of AWE systems and farms based on economic metrics, iii) extending the cost model with data on environmental impact from life cycle analysis, using this for optimization of AWE devices and plants based on combinations of physical, economic and environmental metrics.
You will be a member of the Wind Energy Section’s Airborne Wind Energy Research Group, a leading academic player in the AWE sector, and will collaborate with two fellow AWETRAIN PhD researchers in Delft: one with the neighboring Faculty of Technology, Policy and Management (TPM) and one with the research group's spin-off company Kitepower B.V. You will also have the opportunity to meet regularly and collaborate with the other PhD researchers of the AWETRAIN Doctoral Network (
https://awetrain.eu
) that are located all across Europe. This will include secondments to industry partners.
Eligibility criteria
Fulfillment of eligibility criteria is dictated by the European Commission under the Horizon MSCA Doctoral Networks Programme. We welcome applications from PhD candidates from any country fulfilling the following mobility criteria:
- Eligible candidates must not have resided or carried out their main activity (work, studies, etc.) in the country of their first host institution for more than 12 months in the 3 years immediately before their recruitment by the host institution (i.e., the starting date indicated in the employment contract/equivalent direct contract).
- Eligible candidates must have a master’s degree relevant to the chosen position or its equivalent that would entitle them to a doctorate, awarded before the start of the position.
TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.
At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core
values
and we actively
engage
to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.
Challenge. Change. Impact!
Faculty Aerospace Engineering
The Faculty of Aerospace Engineering at Delft University of Technology is one of the world’s most highly ranked (and most comprehensive) research, education and innovation communities devoted entirely to aerospace engineering. More than 200 science staff, around 270 PhD candidates and close to 3000 BSc and MSc students apply aerospace engineering disciplines to address the global societal challenges that threaten us today, climate change without doubt being the most important. Our focal subjects: sustainable aerospace, big data and artificial intelligence, bio-inspired engineering and smart instruments and systems. Working at the faculty means working together. With partners in other faculties, knowledge institutes, governments and industry, both aerospace and non-aerospace. Working in field labs and innovation hubs on our university campus and beyond.
Click
here
to go to the website of the Faculty of Aerospace Engineering.
Conditions of employment
Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.
Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, increasing from See vacancy text gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.
As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills. You can read more about the additional benefits here:
Financial aspects of a Marie Skłodowska-Curie fellowship in the Netherlands
.
The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.
Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit,
Coming to Delft Service
, offers information on their website to help you prepare your relocation. In addition, Coming to Delft Service organises events to help you settle in the Netherlands, and expand your (social) network in Delft. A
Dual Career Programme
is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands.
Additional information
If you would like more information about this vacancy or the selection procedure, please contact Dr. Roland Schmehl, via
r.schmehl@tudelft.nl
.
30 November 2025
via the application button and upload the following documents:

You can address your application to Dr. Roland Schmehl.
Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the
Graduate Schools Admission Requirements
.

We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.
