raw_payload.title: PhD Position in Co-Design for Neuromorphic Control
raw_payload.description:
Derive a novel theoretical framework based on control theory to unlock the efficiency of neuromorphic compute in multi-timescale processing.

Job description
Neuromorphic computing promises new energy efficiency records by taking inspiration from biology. However, while the leaky integrate-and-fire (LIF) neuron is the current de-facto neuron model in neuromorphic hardware, it embeds only one single time constant limited to a few tens of milliseconds. This simple unit is limiting the learning capabilities of recurrent neural network models in tasks characterized by multi-timescale and long-range temporal dependencies.

To implement multi-scale adaptation, in this PhD project, you will investigate the co-design between event-based learning algorithms and neuronal hardware units with multi-scale time constants. The algorithmic methodology will exploit recent developments of adaptive control for event-based systems.

You will drive a novel theoretical framework to learn with bio-inspired multi-scale recurrent neural networks, and design custom neuromorphic hardware that will demonstrate an efficiency advantage on complex temporal scenes based on multi-scale computing units.

At TU Delft, you will be joining the CogSys team (https://cogsys.tudelft.nl/), supervised by Dr. Charlotte Frenkel.
This project will be co-supervised by Prof. Rodolphe Sepulchre at KU Leuven.

On top of participating to the yearly annual retreats organized by the doctoral network participants, you will complete several internships:
  • one short internship at Innatera to ramp up on edge platforms,
  • one or several long internships at KU Leuven with Prof. Rodolphe Sepulchre.

Job requirements
We are looking for a highly motivated Ph.D. candidate. The background is preferably in electrical engineering, computer architecture, control, computational neuroscience, or similar fields. Unconventional backgrounds supported by a strong motivation are also welcome to apply.

You are genuinely curious about the brain and enjoy learning beyond your comfort zone. In the absence of previous background in hardware, machine learning, and/or neuroscience, you must have a keen interest to expand your expertise in these areas. While you are able to take initiative, you are also a team player in order to make the best of interdisciplinary collaborations in a research team and in the broader MSCA network.

Important eligibility conditions include:
  • The applicant must hold an MSc degree by the time of the start of the position. As per the EU MSCA mobility rule, applicants cannot have resided or carried out their main activity (work, studies, etc.) in the Netherlands for more than 12 months in the 3 years immediately before the recruitement date.

TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.

At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.

Challenge. Change. Impact!

Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science
The Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science (EEMCS) brings together three scientific disciplines. Combined, they reinforce each other and are the driving force behind the technology we all use in our daily lives. Technology such as the electricity grid, which our faculty is helping to make completely sustainable and future-proof. At the same time, we are developing the chips and sensors of the future, whilst also setting the foundations for the software technologies to run on this new generation of equipment – which of course includes AI. Meanwhile we are pushing the limits of applied mathematics, for example mapping out disease processes using single cell data, and using mathematics to simulate gigantic ash plumes after a volcanic eruption. In other words: there is plenty of room at the faculty for ground-breaking research. We educate innovative engineers and have excellent labs and facilities that underline our strong international position. In total, more than 1000 employees and 4,000 students work and study in this innovative environment.

Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science.


Conditions of employment
Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.

Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities , increasing from Promovendus gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.

As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills.

The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.

Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit, Coming to Delft Service, offers information on their website to help you prepare your relocation. In addition, Coming to Delft Service organises events to help you settle in the Netherlands, and expand your (social) network in Delft. A Dual Career Programme is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands.

Additional information
If you would like more information about this vacancy or the selection procedure, please contact Dr. Charlotte Frenkel, via c.frenkel@tudelft.nl. and cc dr. Martin Lefebvre@tudelft.nl. Please include "MSCA Application" in the file.

The preferred starting date is in early 2026 (preferred) to mid 2026 (at the latest).

Application procedure
Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than 30 Nov 2025 via the application button and upload the following documents:
  • a cover letter stating your background, motivation, and fit for the position (max 1 page);
  • a detailed curriculum vitae (incl. a list of publications, if any);
  • a list two to three references, incl. the MSc thesis supervisor, who are ready to submit a support letter upon request;
  • transcripts for your BSc and (ongoing) MSc;
  • a summary (max. 2 pages) of your MSc thesis.

You can address your application to Dr. Charlotte Frenkel.

Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.

Please note:
  • You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
  • As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.
  • Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.

items.title_en: PhD Positie in Governance van duurzaamheid in woningrenovatieprogramma's
items.title_zh: 家居装修项目可持续性治理博士职位
items.description_en:
Woningcorporaties en marktpartijen werken samen om woningen sneller en efficiënter te verduurzamen. Jij onderzoekt hoe zij hun gezamenlijke duurzame ambities kunnen sturen en waarmaken.
Functieomschrijving
De verduurzaming van de gebouwde omgeving vraagt om nieuwe vormen van samenwerking tussen woningcorporaties en marktpartijen. Steeds vaker werken partijen programmatisch samen om hun woningbezit toekomstbestendig te maken. Deze samenwerkingen leiden tot snellere renovaties en meer tevreden bewoners. Maar hoe zorg je dat de duurzaamheidsdoelen die op programmaniveau zijn afgesproken, ook in de uitvoering van afzonderlijke projecten worden bereikt?
Als PhD binnen de leerstoel Publiek Opdrachtgeverschap in de bouw aan de faculteit Bouwkunde onderzoek jij deze vraag. Je richt je op de sturing en governance binnen langdurige samenwerkingsprogramma’s, en onderzoekt hoe organisaties duurzame ambities kunnen bewaken en vertalen naar concrete resultaten. Daarbij gebruik je zowel casestudies bij woningcorporaties en bedrijven als actieonderzoek, waarmee je direct bijdraagt aan kennis die in de praktijk toepasbaar is.
Je maakt deel uit van een betrokken en interdisciplinair team dat onderzoek doet naar vernieuwende vormen van publiek opdrachtgeverschap. Een team waarin samenwerking, reflectie en maatschappelijke relevantie centraal staan. Binnen je promotietraject heb je veel vrijheid om je onderzoeksaanpak te bepalen en werk je in een inspirerende academische omgeving met veel ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Zo draag jij bij aan duurzamere woningen én aan kennis over hoe organisaties in de bouw beter kunnen samenwerken voor maatschappelijke impact.
Functie-eisen
- Je hebt een afgeronde master in bestuurskunde, organisatiekunde, bouwkunde, civiele techniek of een gerelateerd vakgebied.
- Je hebt aantoonbare affiniteit met governance, organisatie-inrichting en samenwerkingsvraagstukken.
- Je bent geïnteresseerd in publiek-private samenwerking in de context van woningbouw en verduurzaming.
- Je kunt zelfstandig onderzoek opzetten en uitvoeren met oog voor maatschappelijke relevantie.
- Je communiceert helder, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
- Je schrijft en spreekt goed Nederlands en Engels.
TU Delft
De Technische Universiteit Delft heeft een sterk fundament. Als bouwer van de wereldberoemde Nederlandse waterwerken en pionier in biotech is TU Delft een internationale topuniversiteit die wetenschap, engineering en design combineert. TU Delft staat voor onderwijs, onderzoek en innovatie van wereldklasse om uitdagingen op het gebied van energie, klimaat, mobiliteit, gezondheid en digitale maatschappij aan te gaan. Generaties Delftse ingenieurs hebben bewezen ondernemende probleemoplossers te zijn in bedrijfsleven en in sociale context.
Bij TU Delft omarmen we diversiteit als een van onze
kernwaarden
en
zetten we ons actief in
om een universiteit te zijn waar jij je thuis voelt en kunt floreren. We hechten veel waarde aan verschillende perspectieven en kwaliteiten, omdat wij geloven dat dit ons werk innovatiever, de TU Delft-gemeenschap levendiger en de wereld rechtvaardiger maakt. Samen bedenken en ontwikkelen we oplossingen die een positieve invloed hebben op wereldwijde schaal. Daarom nodigen we jou uit om te solliciteren. Je sollicitatie krijgt een eerlijke behandeling.
Challenge. Change. Impact!
Faculteit Bouwkunde
De faculteit Bouwkunde heeft wereldwijd een leidende rol in onderwijs en onderzoek. De drijvende kracht achter het succes van de faculteit is het robuuste onderzoeksprofiel in combinatie met de energie en creativiteit van de studenten en de academische gemeenschap. Het is een bruisende plek waar ruim vierduizend mensen van 's morgens vroeg tot 's avonds laat studeren, werken, ontwerpen, onderzoek doen en kennis vergaren en verspreiden. Onze faculteit heeft een sterke focus op ‘ontwerpgericht onderzoek' dat al enkele jaren wordt erkend en bekroond, met als resultaat een toppositie op de wereldranglijsten. Medewerkers en studenten werken aan de verbetering van de gebouwde omgeving met behulp van een breed scala aan disciplines, waaronder architectonisch ontwerp, stedenbouw, bouwtechnologie, sociale wetenschappen, procesmanagement en geo-informatiewetenschappen. De faculteit werkt nauw samen met andere faculteiten, universiteiten, private partijen en de publieke sector en heeft een uitgebreid netwerk, zowel in Nederland als internationaal.
Klik
hier
om naar de website van faculteit Bouwkunde te gaan.
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Promovendi krijgen in principe een dienstverband van 4 jaar aangeboden, maar in de vorm van 2 arbeidscontracten. Een eerste contract van 1,5 jaar met een officiële go/no go voortgangsbeoordeling binnen 15 maanden. Gevolgd door een aanvullend contract voor de resterende 2,5 jaar, ervan uitgaande dat alles goed gaat en aan de prestatie-eisen wordt voldaan.
Salaris en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn conform de CAO Nederlandse Universiteitenen lopen op van €3059 - €3881 bruto per maand, vanaf het eerste tot en met het vierde jaar op basis van een fulltime contract (38 uur), plus 8% vakantietoeslag en een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,3%.
Als promovendus word je ingeschreven bij de TU Delft Graduate School. De TU Delft Graduate School biedt een inspirerende onderzoeksomgeving met een uitstekend team van begeleiders, wetenschappelijk personeel en een mentor. Het Doctoral Education Programme is gericht op het ontwikkelen van je overdraagbare, discipline-gerelateerde en onderzoeksvaardigheden.
De TU Delft biedt een aanpasbaar compensatiepakket, korting op de ziektekostenverzekering en een maandelijkse werkkostenbijdrage. Flexibele werkroosters zijn mogelijk.
Verhuis je naar Nederland voor deze baan? De TU Delft probeert er alles aan te doen om je verhuizing zo soepel mogelijk te laten verlopen! Coming to Delft Service, onderdeel van HR, biedt informatie via hun website om je te helpen bij het voorbereiden van de verhuizing. Daarnaast organiseert
Coming to Delft Service
evenementen om je (sociale) netwerk uit te breiden in Delft. Verder wordt er een
Dual Career Programma
aangeboden, om je meereizende partner te ondersteunen bij het zoeken naar een baan in Nederland.
Additionele informatie
Voor meer informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure, neem contact op met dr.ir. Ad Straub, associate professor Publiek Opdrachtgeverschap in de Bouw via
a.straub@tudelft.nl
.
16 november 2025
via de sollicitatiebutton en upload de volgende documenten:
- Uitgebreide CV
- Motivatiebrief
In de tweede ronde van de sollicitatieprocedure wordt u gevraagd een beknopt onderzoeksvoorstel te schrijven.
Je kunt je sollicitatie richten aan Prof.dr.ir. Marleen Hermans.
Promoveren aan de TU Delft vereist Engelse taalvaardigheid op een bepaald niveau om ervoor te zorgen dat de kandidaat goed kan communiceren en interageren, kan deelnemen aan Engelstalige doctoraalcursussen en wetenschappelijke artikelen en een eindscriptie kan schrijven. Kijk voor meer informatie in de
Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.
Let op:
- Solliciteren gaat eenvoudig online. Sollicitaties die per email en/of post worden verstuurd nemen we niet in behandeling.
- TU Delft voert in het kader van kennisveiligheid een risicobeoordeling uit bij het werven van personeel. Dit doen wij onder meer om ongewenste overdracht van gevoelige kennis en technologie te voorkomen. De beoordeling gebeurt op basis van informatie die door kandidaat zelf is aangeleverd, zoals de motivatiebrief en het cv. De beoordeling vindt plaats bij de laatst overgebleven kandidaten in het selectieproces. Wanneer de uitkomst van de risicobeoordeling negatief is, dan wordt de kandidaat daarover geïnformeerd. De verwerking van persoonsgegevens in het kader van deze risicobeoordeling vindt plaats op basis van de wettelijke grondslag van de AVG ‘uitvoering van de publieke taak van algemeen belang’. Meer informatie over deze beoordeling vind je op onze website over kennisveiligheid .

items.description_zh:
住房协会和市场各方共同努力，更快、更高效地使房屋更具可持续性。您调查他们如何管理和实现共同的可持续发展目标。
职位描述
使建筑环境更具可持续性需要住房协会和市场各方之间开展新形式的合作。各方越来越多地进行有计划的合作，以确保他们的住房所有权能够面向未来。这些合作可以加快翻修速度并提高居民的满意度。但是，如何确保在计划层面商定的可持续发展目标在各个项目的实施中也能实现？
作为建筑学院建筑公共调试系主任的博士，您将研究这个问题。您专注于长期合作计划中的管理和治理，并研究组织如何监控可持续目标并将其转化为具体结果。您可以使用住房协会和公司的案例研究以及行动研究，通过这些研究您可以直接贡献可应用于实践的知识。
您是一个忠诚的跨学科团队的一员，该团队对公共委托的创新形式进行研究。一个以协作、反思和社会相关性为核心的团队。在您的博士课程期间，您有很大的自由来决定您的研究方法，并且您在鼓舞人心的学术环境中工作，并有充足的个人发展空间。通过这种方式，您可以为更可持续的家园做出贡献，并了解建筑行业的组织如何更好地合作以产生社会影响。
职位要求
- 您已完成公共管理、组织科学、建筑、土木工程或相关领域的硕士学位。
- 您对治理、组织设计和协作问题具有明显的亲和力。
- 您对住房建设和可持续发展方面的公私合作伙伴关系感兴趣。
- 您可以独立建立和开展研究，着眼于社会相关性。
- 您的口头和书面沟通清晰。
- 你的荷兰语和英语写作和说得都很好。
代尔夫特理工大学
代尔夫特理工大学基础雄厚。作为举世闻名的荷兰水厂的建设者和生物技术的先驱，代尔夫特理工大学是一所集科学、工程和设计于一体的国际顶尖大学。代尔夫特理工大学代表着世界一流的教育、研究和创新，以应对能源、气候、交通、健康和数字社会领域的挑战。代尔夫特的几代工程师已被证明是商业和社会环境中富有进取心的问题解决者。
在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们自己的一员
核心价值观
和
我们积极参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们非常重视不同的观点和品质，因为我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同设计和开发对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平对待。
挑战。改变。影响！
建筑学院
建筑学院在全球教育和研究领域发挥着主导作用。教师成功背后的驱动力是其强大的研究实力以及学生和学术界的活力和创造力。这是一个充满活力的地方，有四千多人从清晨到深夜学习、工作、设计、进行研究以及收集和传播知识。我们的教师非常注重“以设计为导向的研究”，多年来一直受到认可和奖励，在世界排名中名列前茅。教职员工和学生致力于利用建筑设计、城市规划、建筑技术、社会科学、过程管理和地理信息科学等广泛学科来改善建筑环境。该学院与其他院系、大学、私人团体和公共部门密切合作，在荷兰和国际上拥有广泛的网络。
点击
这里
访问建筑学院网站。
就业条件
原则上，博士生的聘用合同期限为4年，但采用2份聘用合同的形式。初始合同为期 1.5 年，并在 15 个月内进行正式的进展/不进展评估。假设一切顺利且满足性能要求，随后将签订剩余 2.5 年的附加合同。
工资和第二就业条件符合荷兰大学集体劳动协议，从第一年到第四年，基于全职合同（38小时），每月毛额为3059欧元至3881欧元，另加8%的假期津贴和8.3%的年终奖金。

代尔夫特理工大学提供适应性强的薪酬方案、健康保险折扣和每月工作费用缴款。灵活的工作安排是可能的。

双轨制职业计划
愿意支持您的随行伴侣在荷兰找工作。

raw_payload.title: PhD Positie in Governance van duurzaamheid in woningrenovatieprogramma's
raw_payload.description:
Woningcorporaties en marktpartijen werken samen om woningen sneller en efficiënter te verduurzamen. Jij onderzoekt hoe zij hun gezamenlijke duurzame ambities kunnen sturen en waarmaken.

Functieomschrijving
De verduurzaming van de gebouwde omgeving vraagt om nieuwe vormen van samenwerking tussen woningcorporaties en marktpartijen. Steeds vaker werken partijen programmatisch samen om hun woningbezit toekomstbestendig te maken. Deze samenwerkingen leiden tot snellere renovaties en meer tevreden bewoners. Maar hoe zorg je dat de duurzaamheidsdoelen die op programmaniveau zijn afgesproken, ook in de uitvoering van afzonderlijke projecten worden bereikt?

Als PhD binnen de leerstoel Publiek Opdrachtgeverschap in de bouw aan de faculteit Bouwkunde onderzoek jij deze vraag. Je richt je op de sturing en governance binnen langdurige samenwerkingsprogramma’s, en onderzoekt hoe organisaties duurzame ambities kunnen bewaken en vertalen naar concrete resultaten. Daarbij gebruik je zowel casestudies bij woningcorporaties en bedrijven als actieonderzoek, waarmee je direct bijdraagt aan kennis die in de praktijk toepasbaar is.

Je maakt deel uit van een betrokken en interdisciplinair team dat onderzoek doet naar vernieuwende vormen van publiek opdrachtgeverschap. Een team waarin samenwerking, reflectie en maatschappelijke relevantie centraal staan. Binnen je promotietraject heb je veel vrijheid om je onderzoeksaanpak te bepalen en werk je in een inspirerende academische omgeving met veel ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Zo draag jij bij aan duurzamere woningen én aan kennis over hoe organisaties in de bouw beter kunnen samenwerken voor maatschappelijke impact.


Functie-eisen
  • Je hebt een afgeronde master in bestuurskunde, organisatiekunde, bouwkunde, civiele techniek of een gerelateerd vakgebied.
  • Je hebt aantoonbare affiniteit met governance, organisatie-inrichting en samenwerkingsvraagstukken.
  • Je bent geïnteresseerd in publiek-private samenwerking in de context van woningbouw en verduurzaming.
  • Je kunt zelfstandig onderzoek opzetten en uitvoeren met oog voor maatschappelijke relevantie.
  • Je communiceert helder, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
  • Je schrijft en spreekt goed Nederlands en Engels.

TU Delft
De Technische Universiteit Delft heeft een sterk fundament. Als bouwer van de wereldberoemde Nederlandse waterwerken en pionier in biotech is TU Delft een internationale topuniversiteit die wetenschap, engineering en design combineert. TU Delft staat voor onderwijs, onderzoek en innovatie van wereldklasse om uitdagingen op het gebied van energie, klimaat, mobiliteit, gezondheid en digitale maatschappij aan te gaan. Generaties Delftse ingenieurs hebben bewezen ondernemende probleemoplossers te zijn in bedrijfsleven en in sociale context.

Bij TU Delft omarmen we diversiteit als een van onze kernwaarden en zetten we ons actief in om een universiteit te zijn waar jij je thuis voelt en kunt floreren. We hechten veel waarde aan verschillende perspectieven en kwaliteiten, omdat wij geloven dat dit ons werk innovatiever, de TU Delft-gemeenschap levendiger en de wereld rechtvaardiger maakt. Samen bedenken en ontwikkelen we oplossingen die een positieve invloed hebben op wereldwijde schaal. Daarom nodigen we jou uit om te solliciteren. Je sollicitatie krijgt een eerlijke behandeling.

Challenge. Change. Impact!

Faculteit Bouwkunde
De faculteit Bouwkunde heeft wereldwijd een leidende rol in onderwijs en onderzoek. De drijvende kracht achter het succes van de faculteit is het robuuste onderzoeksprofiel in combinatie met de energie en creativiteit van de studenten en de academische gemeenschap. Het is een bruisende plek waar ruim vierduizend mensen van 's morgens vroeg tot 's avonds laat studeren, werken, ontwerpen, onderzoek doen en kennis vergaren en verspreiden. Onze faculteit heeft een sterke focus op ‘ontwerpgericht onderzoek' dat al enkele jaren wordt erkend en bekroond, met als resultaat een toppositie op de wereldranglijsten. Medewerkers en studenten werken aan de verbetering van de gebouwde omgeving met behulp van een breed scala aan disciplines, waaronder architectonisch ontwerp, stedenbouw, bouwtechnologie, sociale wetenschappen, procesmanagement en geo-informatiewetenschappen. De faculteit werkt nauw samen met andere faculteiten, universiteiten, private partijen en de publieke sector en heeft een uitgebreid netwerk, zowel in Nederland als internationaal.

Klik hier om naar de website van faculteit Bouwkunde te gaan.

Arbeidsvoorwaarden
Promovendi krijgen in principe een dienstverband van 4 jaar aangeboden, maar in de vorm van 2 arbeidscontracten. Een eerste contract van 1,5 jaar met een officiële go/no go voortgangsbeoordeling binnen 15 maanden. Gevolgd door een aanvullend contract voor de resterende 2,5 jaar, ervan uitgaande dat alles goed gaat en aan de prestatie-eisen wordt voldaan.

Salaris en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn conform de CAO Nederlandse Universiteitenen lopen op van €3059 - €3881 bruto per maand, vanaf het eerste tot en met het vierde jaar op basis van een fulltime contract (38 uur), plus 8% vakantietoeslag en een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,3%.

Als promovendus word je ingeschreven bij de TU Delft Graduate School. De TU Delft Graduate School biedt een inspirerende onderzoeksomgeving met een uitstekend team van begeleiders, wetenschappelijk personeel en een mentor. Het Doctoral Education Programme is gericht op het ontwikkelen van je overdraagbare, discipline-gerelateerde en onderzoeksvaardigheden.

De TU Delft biedt een aanpasbaar compensatiepakket, korting op de ziektekostenverzekering en een maandelijkse werkkostenbijdrage. Flexibele werkroosters zijn mogelijk.

Verhuis je naar Nederland voor deze baan? De TU Delft probeert er alles aan te doen om je verhuizing zo soepel mogelijk te laten verlopen! Coming to Delft Service, onderdeel van HR, biedt informatie via hun website om je te helpen bij het voorbereiden van de verhuizing. Daarnaast organiseert Coming to Delft Service evenementen om je (sociale) netwerk uit te breiden in Delft. Verder wordt er een Dual Career Programma aangeboden, om je meereizende partner te ondersteunen bij het zoeken naar een baan in Nederland.

Additionele informatie
Voor meer informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure, neem contact op met dr.ir. Ad Straub, associate professor Publiek Opdrachtgeverschap in de Bouw via a.straub@tudelft.nl.

Sollicitatieprocedure
Heb je interesse in deze vacature? Solliciteer dan uiterlijk 16 november 2025 via de sollicitatiebutton en upload de volgende documenten:
  • Uitgebreide CV
  • Motivatiebrief

In de tweede ronde van de sollicitatieprocedure wordt u gevraagd een beknopt onderzoeksvoorstel te schrijven.

Je kunt je sollicitatie richten aan Prof.dr.ir. Marleen Hermans.

Promoveren aan de TU Delft vereist Engelse taalvaardigheid op een bepaald niveau om ervoor te zorgen dat de kandidaat goed kan communiceren en interageren, kan deelnemen aan Engelstalige doctoraalcursussen en wetenschappelijke artikelen en een eindscriptie kan schrijven. Kijk voor meer informatie in de Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.

Let op:
  • Solliciteren gaat eenvoudig online. Sollicitaties die per email en/of post worden verstuurd nemen we niet in behandeling.
  • TU Delft voert in het kader van kennisveiligheid een risicobeoordeling uit bij het werven van personeel. Dit doen wij onder meer om ongewenste overdracht van gevoelige kennis en technologie te voorkomen. De beoordeling gebeurt op basis van informatie die door kandidaat zelf is aangeleverd, zoals de motivatiebrief en het cv. De beoordeling vindt plaats bij de laatst overgebleven kandidaten in het selectieproces. Wanneer de uitkomst van de risicobeoordeling negatief is, dan wordt de kandidaat daarover geïnformeerd. De verwerking van persoonsgegevens in het kader van deze risicobeoordeling vindt plaats op basis van de wettelijke grondslag van de AVG ‘uitvoering van de publieke taak van algemeen belang’. Meer informatie over deze beoordeling vind je op onze website over kennisveiligheid.
  • Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

items.title_en: PhD Access to Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Infrastructure and Quality of Life among Peri-Urban Communities in Bangladesh
items.title_zh: 孟加拉国城郊社区获得水、环境卫生和个人卫生 (WASH) 基础设施及生活质量博士
items.description_en:
Would you like to contribute to climate-resilient livelihood options for peri-urban populations in Bangladesh? Are you a motivated researcher in environmental engineering with a focus on WASH? And, are you fluent in Bengali? Then this PhD position as part of the interdisciplinary FLASH project might be for you.
The problems of livelihoods in peri-urban areas are complex and multifaceted, shaped by a combination of environmental change, socio-economic factors, and the actions of various societal actors evolving through informal processes. To better address these challenges in an integrated way, FLASH (Facilitating Livelihood through Advancing Smart Habitats in Peri-Urban Bangladesh) employs a “Living Lab” approach that ensures co-creation and collective management to answer an overarching scientific question: "How to create sustainable, climate-resilient livelihood options for peri-urban populations in Bangladesh?”.
The project is divided into six interlinked scientific work packages (WP): natural hazards affecting peri-urban livelihoods, inclusive economic opportunities for non-migration, housing and physical infrastructure, WASH services and public health, co-governance for just climate adaptation, and livelihood systems model. This PhD vacancy is linked with WP4 on water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services and public health. This is an interdisciplinary project embedded within a vibrant theme of climate, environment and health and contributes to the other work packages of the project.
FLASH is a NWO funded project led by Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET), Utrecht University (UU), Wageningen University and Research (WUR) and many other public-private organizations as contributing partners.
Your Job:
The PhD candidate will investigate the links between WASH infrastructure and public health and resilience of peri-urban communities of Khulna and Barisal in Bangladesh, particularly in the context of hydro-climatic hazards and man-made stressors. Your research will contribute to the broader understanding on how the availability, accessibility of WASH infrastructure impacts the overall quality of life among low-income peri-urban communities.
Your research should also contribute in selecting appropriate water and sanitation infrastructure that not only improves the overall livelihood conditions but facilitates resource recovery and safe reuse. You will use mixed-methods data collection fieldwork (quantitative and qualitative) related to health and WASH services followed by econometric and spatial analysis, and engaging with local communities and decision-makers.
Your PhD will be awarded from Wageningen University and you will become a member of the ‘Urban Systems Engineering (USE)’ research group at the department of ETE. You will be primarily supervised by Prof. Dr. Adriaan Mels (Promotor) and Dr.
Kamonashish Haldar
(Co-promotor & Daily Supervisor) with local supervision from
Dr. Farzana Misha
of BRAC JPGSPH, BRAC University.
items.description_zh:
您想为孟加拉国城郊人口提供适应气候变化的生计选择做出贡献吗？您是一位专注于 WASH 的环境工程研究人员吗？而且，您的孟加拉语流利吗？那么作为跨学科 FLASH 项目一部分的这个博士职位可能适合您。
城郊地区的生计问题复杂且多方面，是由环境变化、社会经济因素以及通过非正式进程演变的各种社会行为者的行动共同造成的。为了更好地以综合方式应对这些挑战，FLASH（通过推进孟加拉国城郊智能栖息地促进生计）采用了“生活实验室”方法，确保共同创造和集体管理，以回答一个首要的科学问题：“如何为孟加拉国城郊人口创造可持续的、具有气候适应能力的生计选择？”。
该项目分为六个相互关联的科学工作包（WP）：影响城郊生计的自然灾害、非移民的包容性经济机会、住房和物质基础设施、WASH 服务和公共卫生、气候适应的共同治理以及生计系统模型。该博士职位空缺与水、环境卫生和个人卫生 (WASH) 服务以及公共卫生 WP4 相关。这是一个跨学科项目，嵌入了充满活力的气候、环境和健康主题，并对该项目的其他工作包做出了贡献。
FLASH 是 NWO 资助的项目，由孟加拉国工程技术大学 (BUET)、乌得勒支大学 (UU)、瓦赫宁根大学和研究中心 (WUR) 以及许多其他公私组织作为贡献合作伙伴领导。
你的工作：
该博士生将研究 WASH 基础设施与公共卫生以及孟加拉国库尔纳和巴里萨尔城郊社区的复原力之间的联系，特别是在水文气候灾害和人为压力因素的背景下。您的研究将有助于更广泛地了解 WASH 基础设施的可用性和可达性如何影响低收入城郊社区的整体生活质量。
您的研究还应有助于选择适当的水和卫生基础设施，不仅改善整体生计条件，而且促进资源回收和安全再利用。您将使用与健康和 WASH 服务相关的混合方法数据收集现场工作（定量和定性），然后进行计量经济学和空间分析，并与当地社区和决策者互动。
您的博士学位将由瓦赫宁根大学授予，您将成为 ETE 系“城市系统工程 (USE)”研究小组的成员。您将主要受到 Adriaan Mels 教授（发起人）和 Dr. Adriaan Mels 博士的指导。
卡莫纳什什哈尔达尔
（联合发起人兼日常监督员）在当地的监督下
法扎纳·米沙博士
BRAC JPGSPH，BRAC 大学。

You will use mixed-methods data collection fieldwork (quantitative and qualitative) related to health and WASH services followed by econometric and spatial analysis, and engaging with local communities and decision-makers.

Your PhD will be awarded from Wageningen University and you will become a member of the ‘Urban Systems Engineering (USE)’ research group at the department of ETE. You will be primarily supervised by Prof. Dr. Adriaan Mels (Promotor) and Dr. Kamonashish Haldar (Co-promotor & Daily Supervisor) with local supervision from Dr. Farzana Misha of BRAC JPGSPH, BRAC University.

items.title_en: PhD ‘Governance of Complex Urban Transformations’
items.title_zh: 博士“复杂城市转型的治理”
items.description_en:
Are you passionate about understanding the transformation of cities over time? Do you want to find out which kind of governance arrangements drive or hinder such transformations? Then this PhD position ‘Governance of Complex Urban Transformations’ might be something for you.
Job description
The team Governance and Pluralism (G&P) of the Erasmus School for Social and Behavioral Sciences (ESSB) and the Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies (IHS) are looking for a PhD researcher with a keen interest in the governance of complex urban transformations. This is a 4-year project; regular conditions for a Dutch PhD apply. The position is part of the network Chair Governance of Complex Urban Transformation that is positioned at the intersection of the Institute for Housing and Urban Development Studies and Team Governance and Pluralism. This allows you to benefit from expertise in both groups.
Description of the overall project
Cities transform over long time. From the very first settlements in Mesopotamia that we now consider the birthplace of the city to the megapolises of Asia, Africa and Southern-America, the city has transformed time and again in response to social, political, economic and environmental pressures. Cities, by their very nature, don’t ‘do’ anything by themselves. It is the people living in them who shape and transform the social and built fabric of the urban. Cities evolve or transform over time as a result of a multitude of factors that include governance and planning. Governing urban transitions is very much about acting here and now in the face of an uncertain future, and hoping that targeted policy and planning help cities to move into new and better states. Therefore, this project focuses on three questions: (1) Under what combination of conditions do cities transform from one stage to the other? (2) In what ways does governance influence these urban transformations? (3) Under what combination of conditions are attainable futures more likely? Answers to those questions require comparative and longitudinal research. Given the profile of the Chair (see below), the focus will be on cities in the majority world.
Job description
The PhD researcher will design and implement the research independently and under guidance of the promotor and supervisor. This entails the set-up of the research, the selection of methods and theories, data collection and analysis. Given the nature of the question, the researcher is expected to cover multiple cities in multiple countries in the majority world. The longitudinal approach covering multiple decades likely calls for the digital processing of archival, newspaper and policy data. Year 1 will focus on refinement of the research project, selection of fitting theories, and articulation of the data collection and associated methods. Years 2 and 3 will be primarily focused on data collection; with year 4 focused on the finalization of the thesis. Ideally, you will graduate on the basis of an accumulative dissertation.
You will have the opportunity to attend courses at the Erasmus Graduate School for Social Sciences and the Humanities. You will be embedded in lively PhD Networks both at ESSB and IHS which helps you to find your way in academia.
items.description_zh:
您是否热衷于了解城市随时间的变化？您想知道哪种治理安排推动或阻碍了这种转变吗？那么“复杂城市转型治理”这个博士职位可能适合您。
职位描述
伊拉斯谟社会与行为科学学院 (ESSB) 和住房与城市发展研究所 (IHS) 的治理与多元化 (G&P) 团队正在寻找一位对复杂城市转型治理有浓厚兴趣的博士研究员。这是一个为期4年的项目；荷兰博士学位的常规条件适用。该职位是复杂城市转型主席治理网络的一部分，该网络位于住房和城市发展研究所以及团队治理和多元化的交叉点。这使您能够从两个群体的专业知识中受益。
项目整体描述
城市会随着时间的推移而发生变化。从美索不达米亚的第一个定居点（我们现在认为是城市的诞生地）到亚洲、非洲和南美洲的大都市，这座城市为了应对社会、政治、经济和环境压力而一次又一次地发生转变。就其本质而言，城市本身不会“做”任何事情。生活在其中的人们塑造和改变了城市的社会和建筑结构。由于治理和规划等多种因素的影响，城市随着时间的推移而发展或转变。治理城市转型很大程度上在于面对不确定的未来，此时此地采取行动，并希望有针对性的政策和规划帮助城市进入新的、更好的状态。因此，本项目主要关注三个问题：（1）城市在什么条件组合下从一个阶段转向另一阶段？ （2）治理以何种方式影响这些城市转型？ (3) 在什么条件组合下更有可能实现未来？这些问题的答案需要比较和纵向研究。鉴于主席的简介（见下文），重点将放在大多数世界的城市。
职位描述
博士研究员将在发起人和导师的指导下独立设计和实施研究。这需要研究的建立、方法和理论的选择、数据收集和分析。鉴于问题的性质，研究人员预计将覆盖世界上大多数国家的多个城市。涵盖数十年的纵向方法可能需要对档案、报纸和政策数据进行数字处理。第一年将侧重于研究项目的细化、拟合理论的选择以及数据收集和相关方法的阐明。第 2 年和第 3 年将主要侧重于数据收集；第四年的重点是论文的定稿。理想情况下，您将在累积论文的基础上毕业。
您将有机会参加伊拉斯谟社会科学和人文研究生院的课程。您将融入 ESSB 和 IHS 活跃的博士网络，这有助于您在学术界找到自己的出路。

items.title_en: PhD Position Development of a Low-Voltage Multi-Beam SEM for High-Throughput Imaging
items.title_zh: 博士职位开发用于高通量成像的低压多光束 SEM
items.description_en:
PhD Development of a Low-Voltage Multi-Beam SEM for High-Throughput Imaging | TU Delft
Job description
Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) plays a central role in today’s nanoscale imaging across both science and industry. Yet, despite its exceptional spatial resolution, the limited throughput of conventional single-beam SEMs continues to restrict their use in large-area and high-volume applications.
As a PhD candidate at TU Delft, working in close collaboration with our industrial partner Delmic and academic partner AMOLF, you will develop a proof-of-concept prototype of a low-voltage multi-beam SEM that combines high-throughput imaging with integrated cathodoluminescence (CL) detection enabling large-area imaging of biological samples.
This four-year research programme will proceed in three main phases. In the initial phase, you will develop and optimize physical and numerical models describing the electron optics of the complete probe-forming column, including the multi-beam generation unit, imaging lenses, scanning system, and signal detection within a multi-beam framework. For this purpose, you will use commercial simulation software tools such as EOD and GPT, while also developing custom Python-based simulation scripts. TU Delft will support your research with access to the DelftBlue supercomputer for large-scale and intensive modelling. In the second phase, you will work / help our technicians on the design and fabrication of electron-optical components, which depending on the final design, may be realized using MEMS technology, conventional precision machining, or a combination of both. The final phase will focus on testing and validating the performance of the prototype, comparing experimental and simulated results to refine both the design and the underlying models. As part of your role, you will publish your findings in scientific journals, present at leading international conferences, and contribute to the supervision of BSc and MSc students through tutorials, exercises, and laboratory work.
You will join the Microscopy Instrumentation and Technique (MInT) group within the Department of Imaging Physics, a multidisciplinary team of researchers specializing in electron and ion optics instrumentation, MEMS technology, signal detection, and computational imaging. We foster a welcoming, collaborative, and supportive environment where knowledge exchange and teamwork are strongly encouraged.
Together, we share a drive to conduct fundamental research that leads to next-generation instruments, combining our expertise in physics, electronics, and software technology. You will receive extensive hands-on training and advanced courses in electron optics, MEMS, SEMs, and detection systems, as well as personalized coaching to help you build a strong career in research.
TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.
At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core
values
and we actively
engage
to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.
Challenge. Change. Impact!
Faculty Applied Sciences
With more than 1,100 employees, including 150 pioneering principal investigators, as well as a population of about 3,600 passionate students, the Faculty of Applied Sciences is an inspiring scientific ecosystem. Focusing on key enabling technologies, such as quantum- and nanotechnology, photonics, biotechnology, synthetic biology and materials for energy storage and conversion, our faculty aims to provide solutions to important problems of the 21st century. To that end, we educate innovative students in broad Bachelor's and specialist Master's programmes with a strong research component. Our scientists conduct ground-breaking fundamental and applied research in the fields of Life and Health Science & Technology, Nanoscience, Chemical Engineering, Radiation Science & Technology, and Engineering Physics. We are also training the next generation of high school teachers.
Click
here
to go to the website of the Faculty of Applied Sciences.
Conditions of employment
Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.
Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities , increasing from €3059 - €3881 gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.
As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills.
The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.
Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit,
Coming to Delft Service
, offers information on their website to help you prepare your relocation. In addition, Coming to Delft Service organises events to help you settle in the Netherlands, and expand your (social) network in Delft. A
Dual Career Programme
is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands.
Additional information
For more information about this vacancy, please contact Dr. Ali Gheidari (
a.m.gheidari@tudelft.nl
).
30 November 2025
via the application button and upload the following documents:
- Motivation letter.
- Detailed CV.
- Copies of your BSc and MSc degrees and transcripts.
You can address your application to Dr. Ali Gheidari.
Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the
Graduate Schools Admission Requirements
.

- You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
- As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.

items.description_zh:
用于高通量成像的低压多光束 SEM 的博士开发 |代尔夫特理工大学
职位描述
扫描电子显微镜 (SEM) 在当今科学和工业领域的纳米级成像中发挥着核心作用。然而，尽管其具有出色的空间分辨率，但传统单束 SEM 的有限吞吐量继续限制其在大面积和大批量应用中的使用。
作为代尔夫特理工大学的博士生，您将与我们的工业合作伙伴 Delmic 和学术合作伙伴 AMOLF 密切合作，开发低压多光束 SEM 的概念验证原型，该原型将高通量成像与集成阴极发光 (CL) 检测相结合，从而实现生物样品的大面积成像。
这个为期四年的研究计划将分三个主要阶段进行。在初始阶段，您将开发和优化描述整个探针形成柱的电子光学的物理和数值模型，包括多光束生成单元、成像透镜、扫描系统和多光束框架内的信号检测。为此，您将使用 EOD 和 GPT 等商业模拟软件工具，同时还开发基于 Python 的自定义模拟脚本。代尔夫特理工大学将通过使用 DelftBlue 超级计算机进行大规模和密集建模来支持您的研究。在第二阶段，您将帮助我们的技术人员设计和制造电子光学元件，根据最终设计，可以使用 MEMS 技术、传统精密加工或两者的组合来实现。最后阶段将重点测试和验证原型的性能，比较实验和模拟结果，以完善设计和基础模型。作为您职责的一部分，您将在科学期刊上发表您的发现，出席领先的国际会议，并通过教程、练习和实验室工作为理学学士和理学硕士学生的监督做出贡献。
您将加入成像物理系的显微镜仪器和技术 (MInT) 小组，这是一个由专门研究电子和离子光学仪器、MEMS 技术、信号检测和计算成像的多学科研究人员组成的团队。我们营造一个热情、协作和支持的环境，大力鼓励知识交流和团队合作。
我们共同致力于开展基础研究，结合我们在物理、电子和软件技术方面的专业知识，开发下一代仪器。您将接受电子光学、MEMS、SEM 和检测系统方面的广泛实践培训和高级课程，以及个性化指导，帮助您在研究领域建立强大的职业生涯。
TU Delft（代尔夫特理工大学）
代尔夫特理工大学有着坚实的基础。作为举世闻名的荷兰水厂的创建者和生物技术的先驱，代尔夫特理工大学是一所集科学、工程和设计于一体的顶尖国际大学。它在教育、研究和创新方面提供世界一流的成果，以应对能源、气候、流动性、健康和数字社会领域的挑战。几代人以来，我们的工程师已被证明是商业和社会环境中的企业家问题解决者。
在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们的核心之一
价值观
并且我们积极地
参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们重视不同的观点和品质。我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同想象、发明和创造利用技术对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平的考虑。
挑战。改变。影响！
应用科学学院
应用科学学院拥有 1,100 多名员工，其中包括 150 名开拓性首席研究员，以及约 3,600 名充满热情的学生，是一个鼓舞人心的科学生态系统。我们的教师专注于关键的使能技术，例如量子和纳米技术、光子学、生物技术、合成生物学以及能量存储和转换材料，旨在为 21 世纪的重要问题提供解决方案。为此，我们在广泛的学士和专业硕士课程中培养具有创新精神的学生，并具有强大的研究内容。我们的科学家在生命与健康科学与技术、纳米科学、化学工程、辐射科学与技术以及工程物理等领域进行突破性的基础和应用研究。我们还在培训下一代高中教师。
点击
这里
访问应用科学学院的网站。
雇佣条件
博士生聘用期原则上为4年，但采用2份聘用合同的形式。最初的 1.5 年合同，并在 15 个月内进行正式的进展/不进展评估。如果一切顺利且满足性能要求，接下来将签订剩余 2.5 年的附加合同。
工资和福利符合荷兰大学集体劳动协议，从第一年到第四年，基于全职合同（38小时），每月毛额从3059欧元增加到3881欧元，另加8%的假期津贴和8.3%的年终奖金。
作为一名博士候选人，您将被代尔夫特理工大学研究生院录取。代尔夫特理工大学研究生院提供了一个鼓舞人心的研究环境，拥有一支优秀的导师、学术人员和导师团队。博士教育计划旨在培养您的可转移、学科相关和研究技能。
代尔夫特理工大学提供可定制的薪酬方案、健康保险折扣以及每月的工作成本缴款。可以安排灵活的工作时间。
您需要搬到荷兰来做这份工作吗？代尔夫特理工大学致力于让您的搬迁尽可能顺利！人力资源单位，
来到代尔夫特服务
，在其网站上提供信息以帮助您准备搬迁。此外，“来到代尔夫特服务”还组织活动来帮助您在荷兰定居，并扩展您在代尔夫特的（社交）网络。一个
双轨制职业计划
可以为您的随行伴侣在荷兰寻找工作提供支持。
附加信息
有关此职位空缺的更多信息，请联系 Ali Gheidari 博士（
a.m.gheidari@tudelft.nl
）。
2025 年 11 月 30 日
通过申请按钮并上传以下文件：
- 动机信。
- 详细的简历。
- 您的学士和硕士学位以及成绩单副本。
您可以向 Ali Gheidari 博士提出申请。
在代尔夫特理工大学攻读博士学位需要一定水平的英语水平，以确保候选人能够良好地沟通和互动、参加英语授课的博士教育课程、撰写科学文章和期末论文。欲了解更多详情，请查看
研究生院入学要求
。

items.requirements_en:
Job requirements
You are a highly motivated researcher with a strong interest in electron optics, instrumentation development, and computational modelling, eager to bridge simulation and experiment to realize next-generation electron microscopy systems. You enjoy working at the interface of fundamental research and industrial innovation, collaborating with both academic and industrial partners to achieve tangible results. Embracing the opportunity to work with leading industrial partners, you know how to collaborate and achieve meaningful results geared to the development of pragmatic applications. You also put your curiosity to good use: you don’t take anomalies for granted and take the initiative to dig deeper and spar with experts. Harnessing your communication skills, you convince colleagues at TU Delft and Delmic of your approach, models and programs. And you enjoy interacting with and coaching talented bachelor and master students, while expanding your own knowledge and competencies.
You also have:
- An MSc degree in Applied Physics, Electrical Engineering or a closely related field.
- Demonstrable skills in numerical modeling, simulation, and data analysis.
- A solid understanding of Physics, Optics, Electron Optics and microscopy systems.
- A proactive and curious mindset, with the ability to explore complex problems independently and collaboratively.
- A good command of spoken and written English, as you’ll be working in an internationally diverse community. You will also write scientific articles and your dissertation in English and participate in English-taught courses.
- An enthusiasm for coaching bachelor and master students, and for presenting your work in scientific articles and international conferences.

raw_payload.title: PhD Position Development of a Low-Voltage Multi-Beam SEM for High-Throughput Imaging
raw_payload.description:
PhD Development of a Low-Voltage Multi-Beam SEM for High-Throughput Imaging | TU Delft

Job description
Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) plays a central role in today’s nanoscale imaging across both science and industry. Yet, despite its exceptional spatial resolution, the limited throughput of conventional single-beam SEMs continues to restrict their use in large-area and high-volume applications.

As a PhD candidate at TU Delft, working in close collaboration with our industrial partner Delmic and academic partner AMOLF, you will develop a proof-of-concept prototype of a low-voltage multi-beam SEM that combines high-throughput imaging with integrated cathodoluminescence (CL) detection enabling large-area imaging of biological samples.

This four-year research programme will proceed in three main phases. In the initial phase, you will develop and optimize physical and numerical models describing the electron optics of the complete probe-forming column, including the multi-beam generation unit, imaging lenses, scanning system, and signal detection within a multi-beam framework. For this purpose, you will use commercial simulation software tools such as EOD and GPT, while also developing custom Python-based simulation scripts. TU Delft will support your research with access to the DelftBlue supercomputer for large-scale and intensive modelling. In the second phase, you will work / help our technicians on the design and fabrication of electron-optical components, which depending on the final design, may be realized using MEMS technology, conventional precision machining, or a combination of both. The final phase will focus on testing and validating the performance of the prototype, comparing experimental and simulated results to refine both the design and the underlying models. As part of your role, you will publish your findings in scientific journals, present at leading international conferences, and contribute to the supervision of BSc and MSc students through tutorials, exercises, and laboratory work.

You will join the Microscopy Instrumentation and Technique (MInT) group within the Department of Imaging Physics, a multidisciplinary team of researchers specializing in electron and ion optics instrumentation, MEMS technology, signal detection, and computational imaging. We foster a welcoming, collaborative, and supportive environment where knowledge exchange and teamwork are strongly encouraged.

Together, we share a drive to conduct fundamental research that leads to next-generation instruments, combining our expertise in physics, electronics, and software technology. You will receive extensive hands-on training and advanced courses in electron optics, MEMS, SEMs, and detection systems, as well as personalized coaching to help you build a strong career in research.

Job requirements
You are a highly motivated researcher with a strong interest in electron optics, instrumentation development, and computational modelling, eager to bridge simulation and experiment to realize next-generation electron microscopy systems. You enjoy working at the interface of fundamental research and industrial innovation, collaborating with both academic and industrial partners to achieve tangible results. Embracing the opportunity to work with leading industrial partners, you know how to collaborate and achieve meaningful results geared to the development of pragmatic applications. You also put your curiosity to good use: you don’t take anomalies for granted and take the initiative to dig deeper and spar with experts. Harnessing your communication skills, you convince colleagues at TU Delft and Delmic of your approach, models and programs. And you enjoy interacting with and coaching talented bachelor and master students, while expanding your own knowledge and competencies.

You also have:
  • An MSc degree in Applied Physics, Electrical Engineering or a closely related field.
  • Demonstrable skills in numerical modeling, simulation, and data analysis.
  • A solid understanding of Physics, Optics, Electron Optics and microscopy systems.
  • A proactive and curious mindset, with the ability to explore complex problems independently and collaboratively.
  • A good command of spoken and written English, as you’ll be working in an internationally diverse community. You will also write scientific articles and your dissertation in English and participate in English-taught courses.
  • An enthusiasm for coaching bachelor and master students, and for presenting your work in scientific articles and international conferences.

TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.

At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.

Challenge. Change. Impact!

Faculty Applied Sciences
With more than 1,100 employees, including 150 pioneering principal investigators, as well as a population of about 3,600 passionate students, the Faculty of Applied Sciences is an inspiring scientific ecosystem. Focusing on key enabling technologies, such as quantum- and nanotechnology, photonics, biotechnology, synthetic biology and materials for energy storage and conversion, our faculty aims to provide solutions to important problems of the 21st century. To that end, we educate innovative students in broad Bachelor's and specialist Master's programmes with a strong research component. Our scientists conduct ground-breaking fundamental and applied research in the fields of Life and Health Science & Technology, Nanoscience, Chemical Engineering, Radiation Science & Technology, and Engineering Physics. We are also training the next generation of high school teachers.

Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Applied Sciences.


Conditions of employment
Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.

Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities , increasing from €3059 - €3881 gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.

As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills.

The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.

Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit, Coming to Delft Service, offers information on their website to help you prepare your relocation. In addition, Coming to Delft Service organises events to help you settle in the Netherlands, and expand your (social) network in Delft. A Dual Career Programme is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands.

Additional information
For more information about this vacancy, please contact Dr. Ali Gheidari (a.m.gheidari@tudelft.nl).

Application procedure
Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than 30 November 2025 via the application button and upload the following documents:
  • Motivation letter.
  • Detailed CV.
  • Copies of your BSc and MSc degrees and transcripts.

You can address your application to Dr. Ali Gheidari.

Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.

Please note:
  • You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
  • As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.
  • Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.

items.title_en: Promovendi als tijdelijke onderzoeksassistent beoordelingssystematiek
items.title_zh: 博士生临时助理研究员考核制度
items.description_en:
NWO is dé nationale wetenschapsfinancier. Als tijdelijke onderzoeker (m/v/x) heb je een belangrijke rol in het beoordelingsproces waarmee NWO de beste onderzoeksvoorstellen selecteert om te financieren. Binnen het domein Sociale en Geesteswetenschappen (SGW) zijn we op zoek naar iemand die graag een bijdrage levert aan onderzoek naar onze beoordelingssystematiek. Spreekt je dat aan, solliciteer dan nu.
Met het Research on Research programma zet NWO samen met ZonMw en SIA op programmatische wijze onderzoek uit naar het wetenschapssysteem, in het bijzonder naar de eigen rol als financier in dat systeem. Het project ‘Beoordelingssystematiek’ onderzoekt verschillende aspecten van beoordelingsprocedures binnen NWO. Een onderdeel hiervan is het onderzoeken van de beoordelingsstappen en de uitvoering hiervan. Als onderzoeksassistent werk je voor dit onderdeel met een team beleidsmedewerkers aan het literatuuronderzoek, dataverzameling en analyse, het opzetten van vragenlijstonderzoek en/of het voeren van gesprekken met experts.
Daarnaast assisteer je zo nodig in de beoordelingsrondes van SGW bij verschillende werkzaamheden. In een team van beleidsmedewerkers help je bijvoorbeeld bij het vinden van de juiste externe beoordelaars voor onderzoeksvoorstellen en het begeleiden van interviews met kandidaten.
items.description_zh:
NWO 是国家科学资助者。作为临时研究员 (m/f/x)，您在 NWO 选择最佳研究提案资助的评估过程中发挥着重要作用。在社会科学和人文学科 (SSH) 领域，我们正在寻找愿意为我们的评估系统研究做出贡献的人。如果这对您有吸引力，请立即申请。
通过“研究研究”计划，NWO 与 ZonMw 和 SIA 一起对科学系统进行计划性研究，特别是其自身作为该系统中的金融家的角色。 “评估系统”项目调查了 NWO 内评估程序的各个方面。其中一部分是检查评估步骤及其实施。作为研究助理，您将与政策官员团队合作完成该部分的文献研究、数据收集和分析、建立问卷研究和/或与专家进行访谈。
此外，如有必要，您还将协助 SGW 的各种活动评估。例如，在政策官员团队中，您帮助为研究提案找到合适的外部评估员并监督对候选人的面试。

items.title_en: PhD position on rapidly pulsed radio-frequency plasmas for gas conversion
items.title_zh: 用于气体转化的快速脉冲射频等离子体的博士职位
items.description_en:
Are you interested in plasma physics? Do you want to help demonstrate the usefulness of radio-frequency driven plasmas for industrial processes? We are looking for a motivated PhD student to investigate rapidly pulsed radio-frequency plasmas used for gas conversion.
Background
Plasma processing systems are often powered by 13.56 MHz radiofrequency (RF) waveforms. However, advances have been held back by i) lack of precise control of the RF signal and ii) the low energy efficiency of RF generators, which prevents the utilization of RF-driven plasmas in energy sensitive applications like CO2 conversion or ammonia synthesis.
However, recent advances in power electronics have led to large improvements in the power efficiency of RF generators and the possibility to operate without impedance matching, allowing them to maintain this high efficiency even under rapidly changing load conditions, such as during pulsed operation. This opens up new operating regimes that have previously been inaccessible and will be explored in this project.
Your project
Within this PhD project, you will investigate an RF-driven plasma using an advanced power generator to enable rapid pulsing of the discharge, fast active control and high efficiency. You will explore the influence of the electric parameters on the plasma chemistry using two reference systems: 1) atomic oxygen production in an O2 plasma and 2) NOx production in a N2-O2 plasma.
For this, you will set up a dedicated experiment and use state-of-the-art equipment and measurement methods including Langmuir probes and optical diagnostics such as absorption spectroscopy to answer research questions like:
- What is the influence of the electrical parameters (pulse frequency, pulse length, coupling, etc.) on the production of relevant chemical species?
- Does pulsing enable cold plasma operation at elevated pressures?
- Can we accelerate the transition from the capacitive coupling mode to the inductive mode in ICP (inductively coupled plasma) discharges?
You will join the
plasma & materials processing group
(PMP) in the
Applied Physics and Science Education department
of TU/e. Within PMP, you will work as part of an international team of passionate, dedicated people working on topics like new materials for the semiconductor industry and for photovoltaics; on plasma chemistry and catalysis; as well as on advanced plasma and surface diagnostics. The group offers well-equipped labs, excellent technical support and an enjoyable and sociable working environment.
items.description_zh:
您对等离子体物理学感兴趣吗？您想帮助展示射频驱动等离子体在工业过程中的有用性吗？我们正在寻找一位积极主动的博士生来研究用于气体转化的快速脉冲射频等离子体。
背景
等离子体处理系统通常由 13.56 MHz 射频 (RF) 波形供电。然而，由于 i) 缺乏对射频信号的精确控制，以及 ii) 射频发生器的低能效，这阻碍了射频驱动等离子体在二氧化碳转化或氨合成等能量敏感应用中的利用，这阻碍了射频驱动等离子体的进步。
然而，电力电子技术的最新进展极大地提高了射频发生器的功率效率，并且可以在没有阻抗匹配的情况下运行，从而使它们即使在快速变化的负载条件下（例如在脉冲运行期间）也能保持这种高效率。这开辟了以前无法实现的新操作机制，并将在该项目中进行探索。
你的项目
在这个博士项目中，您将研究使用先进发电机的射频驱动等离子体，以实现快速放电脉冲、快速主动控制和高效率。您将使用两个参考系统探索电参数对等离子体化学的影响：1) O2 等离子体中的原子氧生成和 2) N2-O2 等离子体中的 NOx 生成。
为此，您将建立一个专门的实验，并使用最先进的设备和测量方法，包括朗缪尔探针和吸收光谱等光学诊断来回答以下研究问题：
- 电气参数（脉冲频率、脉冲长度、耦合等）对相关化学物质的生产有何影响？
- 脉冲是否能够在高压下实现冷等离子体操作？
- 我们能否加速ICP（电感耦合等离子体）放电中从电容耦合模式到电感模式的转变？
您将加入
等离子及材料加工组
（PMP）在
应用物理与科学教育系
TU/e。在 PMP 中，您将作为国际团队的一员工作，该团队由热情、敬业的人员组成，致力于半导体行业和光伏新材料等主题；等离子体化学和催化；以及先进的等离子体和表面诊断。该集团提供设备齐全的实验室、卓越的技术支持以及愉快而友善的工作环境。
