items.title_en: PhD Position: Ion transport and synthesis of two-dimensional nanopores and nanoporous membranes
items.title_zh: 博士职位：二维纳米孔和纳米多孔膜的离子传输与合成
items.description_en:
The faculty of Science and the Schneider group within the Leiden Institute of Chemistry are looking for a PhD candidate to join us in the Laboratory of 2D materials.
“Ion transport and synthesis of two dimensional nanopores and nanoporous membranes”
Disciplines: ion transport chemistry and physics, nanopores, energy devices, fuel cells, osmotic energy, membrane chemistry and physics, organic chemistry
About the Project 2DPolymembrane
Current separation technology is crucial for many aspects of human life and accounts for ~15% of the world’s energy consumption. Additionally, in the development of next-generation power solutions based on fuel cells and ion batteries, the membrane is an essential component that directly determines device efficiency. While the particle flow through separation columns is directional at the atomistic scale, undirected Brownian motion dominates in state-of-the-art membranes. 2D membranes have the potential to overcome this intrinsic deficiency and shift the paradigm of particle transport from disordered Brownian motion to unidirectional flow. In the project we will develop 2D polymer heterostructure membranes (2DHMs) combined with functionalized graphene. They offer ultimate thinness (leading to shortest diffusion lengths), precision pore geometry/size (resulting in high size-selectivity, even for hydrogen isotopes), and high functionality (fostering chemical/charge selectivity and ionic gating), making them ideal membrane materials to realize selective and unidirectional ion transport. We will combine theory and prediction, chemical design, and on-water/liquid surface synthesis, as well as in-situ ion transport investigations to develop robust 2DHMs. We will synthesize 2DHMs in the form of horizontal and vertical heterostructures, for which reliable structure property correlations will be established. We will take advantage of lattice vibrations, nuclear quantum, and electrochemical effects, and consequently reformulate classical diffusion theory to consider these game changers. As a result, we will achieve innovative 2DHMs for selective proton and ion transport with high permeance, laying the foundations for the next-generation membrane technologies. 2DPolymembrane will unlock the unique opportunities of 2DHMs for innovative energy device integrations (proton/aqueous metal batteries, fuel cells, and reverse osmotic power generators), where the merits of ultrathin precision 2DHMs will result in the highest selectivity and highest particle flow, and thus a fundamental device performance beyond the state-of-art.
The PhD students will be supervised by Grégory Schneider (Leiden Institute of Chemistry), and work in close collaboration with the teams at the Max Planck Institute of Microstructure Physics (Prof. Xinliang Feng) and at the Dresden University of Technology (Prof. Thomas Heine).
About the ERC Synergy Grant Poly2DMembrane
See:
European grants for research on ultrathin membranes and the biological clock in bacteria - Leiden University
Separation processes are essential in our daily lives, from drug development and purification to cleaning wastewater. These processes, however, use a lot of energy due to the thicknesses of the membranes, together with the random movement of particles. The 2DPolyMembrane project is working to change that paradigm. By developing special 2D membranes that allow particles to flow in a single direction, this project could significantly improve the efficiency of separation technologies.
About the University
Leiden University is one of Europe’s leading international research universities.
Thanks to its committed and inspired staff and students, the university enjoys a leading role in academic research and education. Leiden also scores very well every year in prominent rankings. This means that, to maintain our position, the bar is set very high. Regardless of the work you do at our university, you are always encouraged to broaden your horizons, develop your talents and reach your full potential.
About the Faculty and Institute
The Faculty of Science at Leiden University is a world-class faculty where staff and students work together in a dynamic international environment. It is a faculty where personal and academic development are top priorities. Our people are committed to expand fundamental knowledge by curiosity and to look beyond the borders of their own discipline; their aim is to benefit science, and to contribute to addressing the major societal challenges of the future.
The research carried out at the Faculty of Science is very diverse, ranging from mathematics, information science, astronomy, physics, chemistry and bio-pharmaceutical sciences to biology and environmental sciences. The research activities are organized in eight institutes. These institutes offer eight bachelors’ and twelve master’s programmes. The faculty has grown strongly in recent years and now has more than 2,300 staff and over 5,000 students. We are located at the heart of Leiden’s Bio Science Park, one of Europe’s biggest science parks, where university and business life come together.
The research is run by the Leiden Institute of Chemistry, with its long-standing traditions of excellence in research. Apart from state-of-the-art synthesis, physical chemistry, preparation and measurement facilities, unconventional nanofabrication equipment and experimental setups to measure ion transport will be designed supported by excellent mechanical and electronic workshops. We foster an international and collaborative atmosphere and have close ties to other institutes housed within our Faculty of Science and with many research groups within the Netherlands, and many prominent labs abroad.
Your Profile
The candidate should be highly motivated to pursue an interdisciplinary PhD focused on the innovation and application of graphene-based 2D membranes, particularly their ion-sieving properties. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic about developing and fabricating devices that utilize 2D membranes for applications such as fuel cells, electrolyzers, reverse osmosis energy harvesting, and ion extraction, contributing to the translation of scientific advances into real-world technologies. The project will integrate expertise across ion transport physics, physical chemistry, membrane instrumentation, nanofabrication, chemical functionalization of graphene, spectroscopy, reverse osmosis and electrodialysis, fuel cell development, and theoretical modeling. The candidate should hold a Master degree in one of these topics. You will work in a highly collaborative environment as part of a inter-national team of PhD, postdoctoral researchers, MSc, and professional staff. Our lab supports diversity, access, and inclusion in all its forms. We strive to create a safe environment that supports personal and professional growth, well-being, scientific integrity, and stewardship. We collaborate widely with local and international labs, and are strongly driven to translate our research into societal impacts through working together with industry.
Applications are invited from outstanding graduates holding an MSc degree in Physical Chemistry, Transport Experimental Physics, Ion Flow Theory, Applied Physics, Soft Matter and Condensed Matter Physics, Nanoscience, Organic Chemistry or related degree.
Candidates should have
- Prior experience in experimental work, and preferably have co-authored one or more publications; High motivation for research, and have an interest in theory; Talent to manage their time and in reporting progresses with a high level of independence; Excellent command of written and spoken English; A strong teamwork mentality.

- A strong teamwork mentality.
We Offer
The position will be for a maximum of 4 years, and the candidate is expected to complete a PhD thesis at the end of this period. A contribution to classroom teaching (maximum 10% of the time) will be part of the responsibilities of the candidate, as well as supervision of BSc and MSc research projects that contribute to the goals of this PhD project.
We offer a stimulating and interactive research environment, free use of all state-of-the-art facilities, a competitive salary.
- We offer a full-time 1 year term position for one year initially. After a positive evaluation of the progress of the thesis, personal capabilities and compatibility the appointment will be extended by a further three years. Salary range from €3059 - €3881 gross per month, based on a full-time appointment (38 hours) (PhD student). Leiden University offers an attractive benefits package with additional holiday (8%) and end-of-year bonuses (8.3 %), training and career development and sabbatical leave. Our individual choices model gives you some freedom to assemble your own set of terms and conditions. Candidates from outside the Netherlands may be eligible for a substantial tax break. Promoting an inclusive community is central to Leiden University’s values and vision. Leiden University aims to be an inclusive community in which all students and staff members feel valued, respected, and have the freedom to develop to their full potential. Diversity in experiences and perspectives enriches our teaching and strengthens our research. High-quality education and research mean inclusive education and research.

items.description_zh:
莱顿化学研究所的理学院和施耐德小组正在寻找一名博士候选人加入我们的二维材料实验室。
“二维纳米孔和纳米多孔膜的离子传输与合成”
学科：离子传输化学与物理、纳米孔、能源器件、燃料电池、渗透能、膜化学与物理、有机化学
关于 2D 聚合物膜项目
当前的分离技术对于人类生活的许多方面至关重要，约占世界能源消耗的 15%。此外，在基于燃料电池和离子电池的下一代电源解决方案的开发中，膜是直接决定设备效率的重要组成部分。虽然通过分离柱的颗粒流在原子尺度上是定向的，但在最先进的膜中，无向布朗运动占主导地位。二维膜有可能克服这种内在缺陷，并将粒子传输的范式从无序布朗运动转变为单向流动。在该项目中，我们将开发与功能化石墨烯相结合的二维聚合物异质结构膜（2DHM）。它们具有极致的厚度（导致最短的扩散长度）、精确的孔径几何形状/尺寸（即使对于氢同位素也具有高尺寸选择性）和高功能性（促进化学/电荷选择性和离子门控），使其成为实现选择性和单向离子传输的理想膜材料。我们将结合理论和预测、化学设计、水上/液体表面合成以及原位离子输运研究来开发强大的 2DHM。我们将以水平和垂直异质结构的形式合成2DHM，并为其建立可靠的结构特性关联。我们将利用晶格振动、核量子和电化学效应，从而重新表述经典扩散理论来考虑这些游戏规则改变者。因此，我们将实现具有高渗透性的选择性质子和离子传输的创新 2DHM，为下一代膜技术奠定基础。 2DPolymembrane 将为创新能源设备集成（质子/水金属电池、燃料电池和反渗透发电机）释放 2DHM 的独特机会，其中超薄精密 2DHM 的优点将带来最高的选择性和最高的颗粒流量，从而实现超越最先进技术的基本设备性能。
博士生将在格雷戈里·施奈德（莱顿化学研究所）的指导下，并与马克斯·普朗克微结构物理研究所（冯新良教授）和德累斯顿工业大学（托马斯·海涅教授）的团队密切合作。
关于 ERC Synergy Grant Poly2DMembrane
参见：
欧洲资助细菌超薄膜和生物钟研究 - 莱顿大学
从药物开发和纯化到清洁废水，分离过程在我们的日常生活中至关重要。然而，由于膜的厚度以及颗粒的随机运动，这些过程需要消耗大量能量。 2DPolyMembrane 项目正在努力改变这种模式。通过开发允许颗粒沿单一方向流动的特殊二维膜，该项目可以显着提高分离技术的效率。
关于大学
莱顿大学是欧洲领先的国际研究型大学之一。
由于其敬业且富有灵感的教职员工和学生，该大学在学术研究和教育方面享有领先地位。莱顿大学每年在著名的排名中也取得了很好的成绩。这意味着，为了维持我们的地位，我们的门槛非常高。无论您在我们大学从事什么工作，我们总是鼓励您拓宽视野，发展您的才能并充分发挥您的潜力。
关于学院和研究所
莱顿大学理学院是世界一流的学院，教职员工和学生在充满活力的国际环境中共同工作。在该学院，个人和学术发展是重中之重。我们的员工致力于通过好奇心扩展基础知识，并超越自己学科的界限；他们的目标是造福科学，并为解决未来的重大社会挑战做出贡献。
理学院开展的研究非常多样化，从数学、信息科学、天文学、物理、化学和生物制药科学到生物学和环境科学。研究活动由八个研究所组织。这些学院提供八个学士课程和十二个硕士课程。近年来，该学院的师资队伍发展强劲，目前拥有 2,300 多名教职员工和 5,000 多名学生。我们位于莱顿生物科学园的中心，这是欧洲最大的科学园之一，大学和商业生活在这里融为一体。
该研究由莱顿化学研究所负责，该研究所具有悠久的卓越研究传统。除了最先进的合成、物理化学、制备和测量设施外，还将在优秀的机械和电子车间的支持下设计非常规纳米制造设备和测量离子输运的实验装置。我们营造了一种国际化的合作氛围，并与理学院内的其他研究所、荷兰境内的许多研究小组以及国外的许多著名实验室有着密切的联系。
您的个人资料

raw_payload.title: PhD Position: Ion transport and synthesis of two-dimensional nanopores and nanoporous membranes
raw_payload.description:
The faculty of Science and the Schneider group within the Leiden Institute of Chemistry are looking for a PhD candidate to join us in the Laboratory of 2D materials.

“Ion transport and synthesis of two dimensional nanopores and nanoporous membranes”
Disciplines: ion transport chemistry and physics, nanopores, energy devices, fuel cells, osmotic energy, membrane chemistry and physics, organic chemistry

About the Project 2DPolymembrane
Current separation technology is crucial for many aspects of human life and accounts for ~15% of the world’s energy consumption. Additionally, in the development of next-generation power solutions based on fuel cells and ion batteries, the membrane is an essential component that directly determines device efficiency. While the particle flow through separation columns is directional at the atomistic scale, undirected Brownian motion dominates in state-of-the-art membranes. 2D membranes have the potential to overcome this intrinsic deficiency and shift the paradigm of particle transport from disordered Brownian motion to unidirectional flow. In the project we will develop 2D polymer heterostructure membranes (2DHMs) combined with functionalized graphene. They offer ultimate thinness (leading to shortest diffusion lengths), precision pore geometry/size (resulting in high size-selectivity, even for hydrogen isotopes), and high functionality (fostering chemical/charge selectivity and ionic gating), making them ideal membrane materials to realize selective and unidirectional ion transport. We will combine theory and prediction, chemical design, and on-water/liquid surface synthesis, as well as in-situ ion transport investigations to develop robust 2DHMs. We will synthesize 2DHMs in the form of horizontal and vertical heterostructures, for which reliable structure property correlations will be established. We will take advantage of lattice vibrations, nuclear quantum, and electrochemical effects, and consequently reformulate classical diffusion theory to consider these game changers. As a result, we will achieve innovative 2DHMs for selective proton and ion transport with high permeance, laying the foundations for the next-generation membrane technologies. 2DPolymembrane will unlock the unique opportunities of 2DHMs for innovative energy device integrations (proton/aqueous metal batteries, fuel cells, and reverse osmotic power generators), where the merits of ultrathin precision 2DHMs will result in the highest selectivity and highest particle flow, and thus a fundamental device performance beyond the state-of-art.

The PhD students will be supervised by Grégory Schneider (Leiden Institute of Chemistry), and work in close collaboration with the teams at the Max Planck Institute of Microstructure Physics (Prof. Xinliang Feng) and at the Dresden University of Technology (Prof. Thomas Heine).

About the ERC Synergy Grant Poly2DMembrane
See: European grants for research on ultrathin membranes and the biological clock in bacteria - Leiden University

Separation processes are essential in our daily lives, from drug development and purification to cleaning wastewater. These processes, however, use a lot of energy due to the thicknesses of the membranes, together with the random movement of particles. The 2DPolyMembrane project is working to change that paradigm. By developing special 2D membranes that allow particles to flow in a single direction, this project could significantly improve the efficiency of separation technologies.

About the University
Leiden University is one of Europe’s leading international research universities.
Thanks to its committed and inspired staff and students, the university enjoys a leading role in academic research and education. Leiden also scores very well every year in prominent rankings. This means that, to maintain our position, the bar is set very high. Regardless of the work you do at our university, you are always encouraged to broaden your horizons, develop your talents and reach your full potential.

About the Faculty and Institute
The Faculty of Science at Leiden University is a world-class faculty where staff and students work together in a dynamic international environment. It is a faculty where personal and academic development are top priorities. Our people are committed to expand fundamental knowledge by curiosity and to look beyond the borders of their own discipline; their aim is to benefit science, and to contribute to addressing the major societal challenges of the future.

The research carried out at the Faculty of Science is very diverse, ranging from mathematics, information science, astronomy, physics, chemistry and bio-pharmaceutical sciences to biology and environmental sciences. The research activities are organized in eight institutes. These institutes offer eight bachelors’ and twelve master’s programmes. The faculty has grown strongly in recent years and now has more than 2,300 staff and over 5,000 students. We are located at the heart of Leiden’s Bio Science Park, one of Europe’s biggest science parks, where university and business life come together.

The research is run by the Leiden Institute of Chemistry, with its long-standing traditions of excellence in research. Apart from state-of-the-art synthesis, physical chemistry, preparation and measurement facilities, unconventional nanofabrication equipment and experimental setups to measure ion transport will be designed supported by excellent mechanical and electronic workshops. We foster an international and collaborative atmosphere and have close ties to other institutes housed within our Faculty of Science and with many research groups within the Netherlands, and many prominent labs abroad.

Your Profile
The candidate should be highly motivated to pursue an interdisciplinary PhD focused on the innovation and application of graphene-based 2D membranes, particularly their ion-sieving properties. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic about developing and fabricating devices that utilize 2D membranes for applications such as fuel cells, electrolyzers, reverse osmosis energy harvesting, and ion extraction, contributing to the translation of scientific advances into real-world technologies. The project will integrate expertise across ion transport physics, physical chemistry, membrane instrumentation, nanofabrication, chemical functionalization of graphene, spectroscopy, reverse osmosis and electrodialysis, fuel cell development, and theoretical modeling. The candidate should hold a Master degree in one of these topics. You will work in a highly collaborative environment as part of a inter-national team of PhD, postdoctoral researchers, MSc, and professional staff. Our lab supports diversity, access, and inclusion in all its forms. We strive to create a safe environment that supports personal and professional growth, well-being, scientific integrity, and stewardship. We collaborate widely with local and international labs, and are strongly driven to translate our research into societal impacts through working together with industry.

Applications are invited from outstanding graduates holding an MSc degree in Physical Chemistry, Transport Experimental Physics, Ion Flow Theory, Applied Physics, Soft Matter and Condensed Matter Physics, Nanoscience, Organic Chemistry or related degree.

Candidates should have
    • Prior experience in experimental work, and preferably have co-authored one or more publications;
    • High motivation for research, and have an interest in theory;
    • Talent to manage their time and in reporting progresses with a high level of independence;
    • Excellent command of written and spoken English;
    • A strong teamwork mentality.

We Offer
The position will be for a maximum of 4 years, and the candidate is expected to complete a PhD thesis at the end of this period. A contribution to classroom teaching (maximum 10% of the time) will be part of the responsibilities of the candidate, as well as supervision of BSc and MSc research projects that contribute to the goals of this PhD project.

We offer a stimulating and interactive research environment, free use of all state-of-the-art facilities, a competitive salary.
    • We offer a full-time 1 year term position for one year initially. After a positive evaluation of the progress of the thesis, personal capabilities and compatibility the appointment will be extended by a further three years. Salary range from €3059 - €3881 gross per month, based on a full-time appointment (38 hours) (PhD student).
    • Leiden University offers an attractive benefits package with additional holiday (8%) and end-of-year bonuses (8.3 %), training and career development and sabbatical leave. Our individual choices model gives you some freedom to assemble your own set of terms and conditions. Candidates from outside the Netherlands may be eligible for a substantial tax break.
    • All our PhD students are embedded in the Leiden University Graduate School of Science www.graduateschools.leidenuniv.nl. Our graduate school offers several PhD training courses at three levels: professional courses, skills training and personal effectiveness. In addition, advanced courses to deepen scientific knowledge are offered by the research school.

For more information about employment conditions, see https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/working-at/job-application-procedure-and-employment-conditions

D&I
Promoting an inclusive community is central to Leiden University’s values and vision. Leiden University aims to be an inclusive community in which all students and staff members feel valued, respected, and have the freedom to develop to their full potential. Diversity in experiences and perspectives enriches our teaching and strengthens our research. High-quality education and research mean inclusive education and research.

Want to Apply?
Are you enthusiastic about this vacancy? We are looking forward to getting to know you. Please submit your application online using the blue button below. Please ensure that you upload the following additional documents:
  • Applications (written in English) and including a Cover Letter indicating motivation for the project
  • Curriculum vitae
  • Copies of transcripts of degrees obtained
  • Contact details of two references

Applications should be submitted as pdf files.

You can apply until 01/05/2026.

To help us get to know each other better, we follow a number of steps in the application procedure. For more information, see https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/working-at/job-application-procedure-and-employment-conditions

items.description_en:
The Mathematical Institute is looking for a PhD candidate to join the ERC project Enumerative and Arithmetic Geometry of Logarithmic Curves, under the supervision of David Holmes.
What you will do
Applications are invited for a 4-year PhD position at the Mathematical Institute of the University of Leiden, as part of the ERC project Enumerative and Arithmetic Geometry of Logarithmic Curves.
Moduli spaces of curves and abelian varieties play a central role in algebraic and arithmetic geometry, and can be studied from a variety of perspectives (modular curves, Shimura varieties, moduli spaces of flat structures, …). This project brings together a number of these approaches with applications to problems in enumerative geometry (specifically log Gromov-Witten theory; counting curves with tangency conditions) and in arithmetic geometry (understanding rational points on abelian surfaces).
There are a number of promising directions for a PhD candidate within this project; exactly what you will be working on depends on your background and interests, as well as the progress which has already been made when you join the project.
You will be joining an active and growing group around enumerative and log geometry, within a larger group in Leiden specialising in algebra, geometry and number theory. We run a lot of local reading groups, as well as taking part in national and international algebraic geometry seminars. There are many opportunities for collaboration, and our students generally attend plenty of national and international schools and workshops.
Where you will work
The Mathematical Institute (MI) is one of the eight institutes within the Faculty of Science and has a strong international orientation. The institute's mission is to push the boundaries of scientific knowledge by developing and applying high-quality mathematics while offering a wide range of mathematical programs in a friendly and intellectually stimulating environment. We believe that mathematics is a fundamental part of human knowledge, and we take pride in our role as guardians of this rich scientific discipline. We are dedicated to expanding the frontiers of mathematical knowledge and applying our expertise to solve challenges in other sciences, society, and industry. Additionally, we actively promote mathematical literacy through various outreach activities.
The Mathematical Institute focuses on four key research themes:
- Algebra, Geometry, and Number Theory;
- Analysis and Dynamical Systems;
- Probability, Operations Research, and Dynamics;
- Statistics.
There is extensive collaboration between these themes. For more information about the Mathematical Institute, see
https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/science/mathematics
.
What you bring
- Master’s degree in mathematics, including a solid background in at least one of algebraic geometry and number theory;
- Written and oral proficiency in English;
What we offer
Our goal is to work together to create a transparent and inclusive work environment in which everyone feels welcome and appreciated. Our organisation is always evolving and we need your ideas for improvement and innovation to take us further. We want to devote attention to your personal development.
You can count on an enjoyable job within the socially relevant world of education and research. The University's challenging and international work environment is located just steps away from Leiden’s lively city centre or the bustling city centre of The Hague. We also want to work with you to devote attention to your health and vitality, for example with the fun activities we organise through Healthy University.
We also offer:
- An employment contract for the duration of one year with a view to permanent employment. This contract falls under the CLA of Dutch Universities;
- A salary between €3059 - €3881 gross per month, based on a full-time appointment (38 hours) (PhD student);
- A holiday allowance (8%), an end-of-year bonus (8,3%), and an attractive pension scheme at ABP;
- Full reimbursement of public transport commuting costs for home-to-work travel;
- Flexible working hours: as a standard, you are entitled to a minimum of 29 leave days on the basis of a full-time working week of 38 hours; you can also save for extra leave, for example by working 40 hours a week, and in this way accrue an extra 96 leave hours, or exchange 96 leave hours for a 36-hour week.
- Lots of options when it comes to secondary employment conditions. Within our terms of employment individual choices model, you can think of exchanging leave days and/or salary for benefits such as an advantageous sports subscription and bicycle scheme;
- A home-working allowance (day and internet allowance) and attention for good workplaces. The University will also provide you with a laptop.
For more information about employment conditions, see
https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/working-at/job-application-procedure-and-employment-conditions
What we find important
Promoting an inclusive community is central to Leiden University’s values and vision. Leiden University aims to be an inclusive community in which all students and staff members feel valued and respected, and are able to develop to their full potential. Diversity in experiences and perspectives enriches our teaching and strengthens our research. High-quality education and research means inclusive education and research.
Want to apply or find out more?
If you want to apply straight away, click the application button.
Enquiries about the position can be made to Prof.dr. David Holmes, at
holmesdst@math.leidenuniv.nl
.
You can apply until 4 January 2026.
To help us get to know each other better, we follow a number of steps in the application procedure. For more information, see

数学研究所正在寻找一名博士候选人加入 ERC 项目《对数曲线的枚举与算术几何》，由 David Holmes 指导。
你会做什么
作为 ERC 项目“对数曲线的枚举与算术几何”的一部分，欢迎申请莱顿大学数学研究所的 4 年制博士学位。
曲线和阿贝尔簇的模空间在代数和算术几何中起着核心作用，可以从多种角度进行研究（模曲线、志村簇、平面结构的模空间……）。该项目汇集了许多这些方法，并应用于计数几何（特别是对数 Gromov-Witten 理论；计算具有相切条件的曲线）和算术几何（理解交换曲面上的有理点）中的问题。
该项目为博士候选人提供了许多有前途的方向；您将从事的具体工作取决于您的背景和兴趣，以及您加入该项目时已经取得的进展。
您将加入一个围绕枚举和对数几何的活跃且不断发展的小组，该小组位于莱顿，专门从事代数、几何和数论。我们经营许多本地阅读小组，并参加国内和国际代数几何研讨会。有很多合作机会，我们的学生通常会参加许多国内和国际学校和研讨会。
你将在哪里工作
数学研究所（MI）是理学院内的八个研究所之一，具有很强的国际化定位。该研究所的使命是通过开发和应用高质量的数学来突破科学知识的界限，同时在友好和智力刺激的环境中提供广泛的数学课程。我们相信数学是人类知识的基本组成部分，我们为自己作为这一丰富科学学科的守护者的角色感到自豪。我们致力于拓展数学知识的前沿，并运用我们的专业知识来解决其他科学、社会和行业的挑战。此外，我们还通过各种外展活动积极提高数学素养。
数学研究所专注于四个关键研究主题：
- 代数、几何和数论；
- 分析和动力系统；
- 概率、运筹学和动力学；
- 统计数据。
这些主题之间存在广泛的合作。有关数学研究所的更多信息，请参阅
https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/science/mathematics
。
你带来什么
- 数学硕士学位，包括至少代数几何和数论之一的扎实背景；
- 英语书面和口语能力；
我们提供什么
我们的目标是共同努力创造一个透明和包容的工作环境，让每个人都感到受欢迎和赞赏。我们的组织一直在不断发展，我们需要您的改进和创新想法来带领我们走得更远。我们希望关注您的个人发展。
您可以在与社会相关的教育和研究领域找到一份令人愉快的工作。该大学具有挑战性和国际化的工作环境，距离莱顿热闹的市中心或繁华的海牙市中心仅几步之遥。我们还希望与您合作，关注您的健康和活力，例如我们通过健康大学组织的有趣活动。
我们还提供：
- 为期一年的雇佣合同，旨在永久雇佣。本合同属于荷兰大学的 CLA；
- 基于全日制预约（38小时）（博士生），每月工资总额在3059欧元至3881欧元之间；
- ABP 的假期津贴 (8%)、年终奖金 (8.3%) 和有吸引力的养老金计划；
- 全额报销从家到工作地点的公共交通通勤费用；

raw_payload.title: PhD on moduli of curves and abelian varieties
raw_payload.description:
The Mathematical Institute is looking for a PhD candidate to join the ERC project Enumerative and Arithmetic Geometry of Logarithmic Curves, under the supervision of David Holmes.

What you will do
Applications are invited for a 4-year PhD position at the Mathematical Institute of the University of Leiden, as part of the ERC project Enumerative and Arithmetic Geometry of Logarithmic Curves.

Moduli spaces of curves and abelian varieties play a central role in algebraic and arithmetic geometry, and can be studied from a variety of perspectives (modular curves, Shimura varieties, moduli spaces of flat structures, …). This project brings together a number of these approaches with applications to problems in enumerative geometry (specifically log Gromov-Witten theory; counting curves with tangency conditions) and in arithmetic geometry (understanding rational points on abelian surfaces).

There are a number of promising directions for a PhD candidate within this project; exactly what you will be working on depends on your background and interests, as well as the progress which has already been made when you join the project.

You will be joining an active and growing group around enumerative and log geometry, within a larger group in Leiden specialising in algebra, geometry and number theory. We run a lot of local reading groups, as well as taking part in national and international algebraic geometry seminars. There are many opportunities for collaboration, and our students generally attend plenty of national and international schools and workshops.

Where you will work
The Mathematical Institute (MI) is one of the eight institutes within the Faculty of Science and has a strong international orientation. The institute's mission is to push the boundaries of scientific knowledge by developing and applying high-quality mathematics while offering a wide range of mathematical programs in a friendly and intellectually stimulating environment. We believe that mathematics is a fundamental part of human knowledge, and we take pride in our role as guardians of this rich scientific discipline. We are dedicated to expanding the frontiers of mathematical knowledge and applying our expertise to solve challenges in other sciences, society, and industry. Additionally, we actively promote mathematical literacy through various outreach activities.

The Mathematical Institute focuses on four key research themes:
  • Algebra, Geometry, and Number Theory;
  • Analysis and Dynamical Systems;
  • Probability, Operations Research, and Dynamics;
  • Statistics.

There is extensive collaboration between these themes. For more information about the Mathematical Institute, see https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/science/mathematics.

What you bring
  • Master’s degree in mathematics, including a solid background in at least one of algebraic geometry and number theory;
  • Written and oral proficiency in English;

What we offer
Our goal is to work together to create a transparent and inclusive work environment in which everyone feels welcome and appreciated. Our organisation is always evolving and we need your ideas for improvement and innovation to take us further. We want to devote attention to your personal development.

You can count on an enjoyable job within the socially relevant world of education and research. The University's challenging and international work environment is located just steps away from Leiden’s lively city centre or the bustling city centre of The Hague. We also want to work with you to devote attention to your health and vitality, for example with the fun activities we organise through Healthy University.

We also offer:
  • An employment contract for the duration of one year with a view to permanent employment. This contract falls under the CLA of Dutch Universities;
  • A salary between €3059 - €3881 gross per month, based on a full-time appointment (38 hours) (PhD student);
  • A holiday allowance (8%), an end-of-year bonus (8,3%), and an attractive pension scheme at ABP;
  • Full reimbursement of public transport commuting costs for home-to-work travel;
  • Flexible working hours: as a standard, you are entitled to a minimum of 29 leave days on the basis of a full-time working week of 38 hours; you can also save for extra leave, for example by working 40 hours a week, and in this way accrue an extra 96 leave hours, or exchange 96 leave hours for a 36-hour week.
  • Lots of options when it comes to secondary employment conditions. Within our terms of employment individual choices model, you can think of exchanging leave days and/or salary for benefits such as an advantageous sports subscription and bicycle scheme;
  • A home-working allowance (day and internet allowance) and attention for good workplaces. The University will also provide you with a laptop.

For more information about employment conditions, see https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/working-at/job-application-procedure-and-employment-conditions

What we find important
Promoting an inclusive community is central to Leiden University’s values and vision. Leiden University aims to be an inclusive community in which all students and staff members feel valued and respected, and are able to develop to their full potential. Diversity in experiences and perspectives enriches our teaching and strengthens our research. High-quality education and research means inclusive education and research.

Want to apply or find out more?
If you want to apply straight away, click the application button.

Enquiries about the position can be made to Prof.dr. David Holmes, at holmesdst@math.leidenuniv.nl.
You can apply until 4 January 2026.

To help us get to know each other better, we follow a number of steps in the application procedure. For more information, see https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/working-at/job-application-procedure-and-employment-conditions

To apply for this vacancy, please ensure that you include with your application the following documents:
  • CV
  • The transcripts of your Master’s studies to date
  • A completed copy of the application form (you will need LaTeX to complete the form; if you do not have it installed, you can access it for free).
  • A copy of (a draft of) your Master’s thesis (optional)
  • A letter of motivation (preferably at most 1 page)

    Acquisition in response to this vacancy is not appreciated. If you nevertheless choose to send us CVs, no rights can be derived from this.

items.title_en: Promovendus - Infectieziekten als casus voor data gedreven verbetering in de huisartsenpraktijk
items.title_zh: 博士候选人 - 传染病作为全科实践中数据驱动改进的案例研究
items.description_en:
Welkom bij de Universiteit Maastricht!
Ben jij een gepassioneerde onderzoeker met een hart voor innovatie en AI? Wil je bijdragen aan het ontwikkelen en evalueren van een innovatie in de huisartsenzorg? De afdeling Huisartsgeneeskunde van de Universiteit Maastricht zoekt een promovendus om praktijkgericht onderzoek te verrichten.
Promovendus - Infectieziekten als casus voor data gedreven verbetering in de huisartsenpraktijk
- Ons doel: De huisartsenzorg verbeteren met behulp van kunstmatige intelligentie, voor betere diagnostiek, datakwaliteit en patiëntenzorg.
Ons doel:
- Jouw collega’s: Huisartsen, onderzoekers en patiënten die samen werken aan de huisartsenzorg van de toekomst.
Jouw collega’s:
Huisartsen verzamelen dagelijks grote hoeveelheden waardevolle patiëntgegevens, deels gestructureerd en gestandaardiseerd, maar een substantieel deel bestaat uit vrije tekst uit consultverslagen. Deze ongestructureerde data wordt momenteel nog maar beperkt benut. Dankzij de opkomst van AI, en met name krachtige taalmodellen zoals BERT en GPT, ontstaan er nieuwe kansen om deze informatie effectief om te zetten in praktische ondersteuning bij diagnostiek, prognose en datakwaliteit. Dit onderzoeksproject richt zich daarbij op infectieziekten, zoals urineweginfectie en longontsteking - aandoeningen die tot de meest voorkomende klachten in de huisartspraktijk behoren.
Binnen dit project onderzoek je hoe AI een rol kan spelen in het verbeteren van de huisartsenzorg bij infectieziekten. Je werkt aan het ontwikkelen en valideren van AI-modellen voor diagnostiek en risicovoorspelling, en onderzoekt hoe deze technologie kan bijdragen aan betere registratie en datakwaliteit. Tegelijkertijd breng je in kaart hoe huisartsen en patiënten aankijken tegen het gebruik van AI in de dagelijkse praktijk. Je maakt gebruik van rijke, bestaande huisartsendata en werkt samen met meerdere academische netwerken verspreid over Nederland, samen goed voor gegevens van maar liefst 1,5 miljoen patiënten.
Vanaf 2025 is de vakgroep Huisartsgeneeskunde bovendien gestart met het inrichten van een academische werkplaats huisartsenzorg. Het doel van deze werkplaats is het ontwikkelen van nieuwe kennis en het gebruik daarvan in de praktijk te bevorderen, via een betere samen- en wisselwerking tussen huisartsenorganisaties en universiteit. De vakgroep is daarin actief vanuit twee fysieke ‘hubs’: Maastricht en Eindhoven. Deze dynamische omgeving biedt daarmee extra kansen jezelf tijdens dit promotietraject te ontwikkelen, en werken is vanuit beide locaties mogelijk.
Door praktijkgericht onderzoek te combineren met technologische innovatie, draag je bij aan de veilige en verantwoorde inzet van AI in de eerstelijnszorg. Dit project biedt dan ook een unieke kans om medische inhoud te combineren met technologische innovatie. Je werkt in een maatschappelijk relevant domein, met directe impact op de dagelijkse zorg. Samen met zorgverleners, patiënten en onderzoekers bouw je aan de huisartsenzorg van de toekomst.
Wat ga je doen?
- Het ontwikkelen en valideren van AI-modellen op basis van gestructureerde en ongestructureerde huisartsdata
- Het uitvoeren van kwalitatief onderzoek naar de perspectieven van huisartsen en patiënten op het gebruik van AI
- Het samenwerken met onderzoekers, data scientists, zorgprofessionals en netwerkpartners in een multidisciplinaire setting
- Het vertalen van onderzoeksresultaten naar praktische aanbevelingen voor zorg, beleid en onderwijs
- Het schrijven van wetenschappelijke artikelen en rapportages over de bevindingen
Ben jij klaar om koers te zetten voor de komende jaren? Dan ontmoeten we je graag.
Wat jij meebrengt
Het gaat ons niet om vinkjes, maar om jouw motivatie, leergierigheid en aanpak. Herken jij jezelf hierin?
- Een afgeronde universitaire masteropleiding biomedische technologie, biomedische wetenschappen, (technische) geneeskunde, gezondheidswetenschappen, of gelijke strekking;
- Interesse in innovaties in de huisartspraktijk, big data en AI/LLM. Ervaring met deze technologieën is een pré.
- Affiniteit met wetenschappelijk onderzoek, zowel kwalitatief als kwantitatief;
- Goede organisatorische en communicatieve vaardigheden, in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
- Een zelfstandige, nauwkeurige werkhouding én plezier in samenwerken met een interdisciplinair team.
- Ervaring met wetenschappelijk schrijven is een pré.
Wat je van ons mag verwachten
Bij de Universiteit Maastricht werk je in een internationale, open en betrokken omgeving. We bieden:
- Een jaarcontract, bij wederzijdse tevredenheid wordt het contract verlengd met 3 jaar.
- Een bruto salaris tussen €3.059 en €3.881 bruto per maand (bij een fulltime dienstverband van 38 uur per week), exclusief 8% vakantiegeld en een 8,3% eindejaarsuitkering.
- 29 vakantiedagen (op basis van fulltime), vier extra vrije dagen, en de mogelijkheid om 12 extra dagen op te bouwen via compensatie-uren.
- Flexibele werktijden, een thuiswerkvergoeding en hybride werken.
- Vrijheid en ruimte om je werk zelfstandig in te richten en je eigen ideeën te ontwikkelen.
- Een hechte community van collega’s waarmee je nauw samenwerkt.
- Een goede pensioenregeling via het ABP, bedrijfsfitness en toegang tot een uitgebreid sportaanbod.
- Een inspirerende werkomgeving in het hart van Europa.
Over de Faculty of Health, Medicine and Life Sciences (FHML)
FHML werkt aan gezondheid in de breedste zin van het woord: van molecuul tot mens, en van gezondheidszorg tot preventie. We leiden zorgprofessionals en onderzoekers op binnen innovatieve onderwijsprogramma’s, en doen baanbrekend onderzoek op het gebied van gezondheid en welzijn. Als onderdeel van het Maastricht UMC+ (MUMC+) vormt onze internationale en interdisciplinaire gemeenschap een unieke samenwerking tussen universiteit en academisch ziekenhuis, waar onderwijs, onderzoek en zorg samenkomen.
CAPHRI
Onze vakgroep is onderdeel van onderzoeksinstituut CAPHRI, dat zich inzet voor betere gezondheid door innovatief, praktijkgericht en maatschappelijk relevant onderzoek. CAPHRI verbindt wetenschap en samenleving via participatief onderzoek binnen de publieke en eerstelijnszorg en persoonsgerichte langdurige zorg. De vakgroep huisartsgeneeskunde heeft wetenschappelijke speerpunten: Huisarts & Diagnostiek, Huisarts & Digitale Zorg en Samen beslissen & interprofessioneel samenwerken. We verrichten onderzoek dat Bruikbare Wetenschap voor de praktijk van de huisarts oplevert. CAPHRI biedt een inspirerende academische werkomgeving en een sterk PhD-programma voor ambitieuze onderzoekers van over de hele wereld.
Nieuwsgierig geworden?
Wil je meer weten over deze functie of over werken bij onze universiteit? Neem contact op met dr. ir. Ralph Leijenaar via
rth.leijenaar@maastrichtuniversity.nl
of dr. Eefje de Bont via
eefje.debont@maastrichtuniversity.nl
Je kunt ook direct solliciteren via de onderstaande knop.
De eerste selectiegesprekken vinden plaats op
dinsdag 2 december 2025
tussen 09.00 en 12.00 uur. Een eventueel tweede gesprek zal plaatsvinden op
dinsdag 9 december 2025
tussen 09:00 en 12:00 uur.
We hopen je snel te leren kennen!
Over de Universiteit Maastricht
Aan de Universiteit Maastricht zoeken we samen naar antwoorden waarmee we de wereld vooruithelpen. Dat doen we samen met 23.300 studenten en 5.400 medewerkers, verspreid over 5 steden in de regio, 6 faculteiten en ruim 70 onderzoeksinstituten in de Euregio. Hier krijg je de ruimte om grenzen te verleggen en nieuwe kansen te ontdekken; voor jezelf en voor de wereld om je heen. Want echte antwoorden vinden we samen.
De vacature staat open voor interne- en externe kandidaten. Bij gelijke geschiktheid hebben interne kandidaten voorrang.
Universiteit Maastricht zet zich in voor het bevorderen en behouden van een diverse en inclusieve gemeenschap. Wij geloven dat diversiteit in onze medewerkers- en studentenpopulatie bijdraagt aan de kwaliteit van onderzoek en onderwijs aan de UM. Dit willen we mogelijk maken door middel van inclusief beleid en innovatieve projecten in samenwerking met studenten en medewerkers. We moedigen je aan om voor deze functie te solliciteren.
items.description_zh:
欢迎来到马斯特里赫特大学！
您是一位热衷于创新和人工智能的研究人员吗？您想为全科医生护理创新的开发和评估做出贡献吗？马斯特里赫特大学普通医学系正在寻找一名博士候选人来进行以实践为导向的研究。
博士候选人 - 传染病作为全科实践中数据驱动改进的案例研究
- 我们的目标：利用人工智能改善全科医生护理，以实现更好的诊断、数据质量和患者护理。
我们的目标：
- 您的同事：全科医生、研究人员和患者，他们共同致力于未来的全科医生护理。
您的同事：
全科医生每天都会收集大量有价值的患者数据，其中一些数据是结构化和标准化的，但很大一部分由咨询报告中的免费文本组成。这种非结构化数据目前仅在有限范围内使用。由于人工智能的兴起，特别是 BERT 和 GPT 等强大语言模型的兴起，出现了新的机会，可以有效地将这些信息转化为对诊断、预后和数据质量的实际支持。该研究项目重点关注泌尿道感染和肺炎等传染病，这些都是全科医学中最常见的疾病。
在这个项目中，您将研究人工智能如何在改善传染病全科医生护理方面发挥作用。您致力于开发和验证用于诊断和风险预测的人工智能模型，并研究该技术如何有助于更好的注册和数据质量。同时，您还需要了解全科医生和患者如何看待人工智能在日常实践中的使用。您可以使用丰富的现有 GP 数据，并与遍布荷兰的多个学术网络合作，共同统计来自不少于 150 万患者的数据。
从2025年起，全科医学部还将开始设立全科医学护理学术研讨会。本次研讨会的目的是通过全科医生组织和大学之间更好的合作和互动，开发新知识并促进其在实践中的应用。该部门在两个物理“中心”活跃：马斯特里赫特和埃因霍温。因此，这种充满活力的环境为您在攻读博士学位期间提供了额外的发展机会，并且可以在两个地点工作。
通过将面向实践的研究与技术创新相结合，您可以为初级保健中安全、负责任地使用人工智能做出贡献。因此，该项目提供了将医疗内容与技术创新相结合的独特机会。您在与社会相关的领域工作，对日常护理有直接影响。您与医疗保健提供者、患者和研究人员一起构建未来的全科医生护理。
你会怎样做？
- 基于结构化和非结构化 GP 数据开发和验证 AI 模型
- 对全科医生和患者对人工智能使用的看法进行定性研究
- 在多学科环境中与研究人员、数据科学家、医疗保健专业人员和网络合作伙伴合作
- 将研究成果转化为护理、政策和教育的实际建议
- 撰写有关研究结果的科学文章和报告
您准备好为未来几年设定方向了吗？那么我们很乐意见到您。
你带来什么
我们关心的不是勾选框，而是您的动机、学习和接近的渴望。在此你认识自己吗？
- 已完成生物医学技术、生物医学科学、（技术）医学、健康科学或类似学科的大学硕士学位；
- 对全科实践、大数据和人工智能/法学硕士的创新感兴趣。使用这些技术的经验是一个优势。
- 热衷于定性和定量的科学研究；
- 良好的荷兰语和英语组织和沟通能力；
- 独立、准确的工作态度以及与跨学科团队合作的乐趣。
- 有科学写作经验者优先。
您对我们有何期望
在马斯特里赫特大学，您在国际化、开放和忠诚的环境中工作。我们提供：
- 年度合同，如果双方满意，合同可延长 3 年。
- 每月总工资在 3,059 欧元至 3,881 欧元之间（每周 38 小时的全职工作），不包括 8% 的假期工资和 8.3% 的年终奖金。
- 29 天假期（基于全日制），另外 4 天休假，并且可以选择通过补偿时间累积 12 天额外假期。
- 灵活的工作时间、家庭工作津贴和混合工作。
- 独立组织工作并发展自己的想法的自由和空间。
- 与您密切合作的紧密同事社区。
- 通过总部基地、公司健身和广泛的体育活动提供良好的养老金计划。
- 位于欧洲中心的鼓舞人心的工作环境。
关于健康、医学和生命科学学院 (FHML)
FHML 致力于最广泛意义上的健康：从分子到人，从医疗保健到预防。我们通过创新教育计划培训医疗保健专业人员和研究人员，并在健康和福祉领域开展开创性研究。作为马斯特里赫特 UMC+ (MUMC+) 的一部分，我们的国际跨学科社区在大学和学术医院之间形成了独特的合作，将教育、研究和护理融为一体。
卡弗里
我们部门是 CAPHRI 研究所的一部分，该研究所致力于通过创新、面向实践和社会相关的研究来改善健康。 CAPHRI 通过公共和初级保健以及以人为本的长期护理领域的参与性研究将科学与社会联系起来。全科医学系拥有科学先锋：全科医生和诊断、全科医生和数字护理以及共享决策和跨专业协作。我们开展的研究为全科医生实践提供了可用的科学依据。 CAPHRI 为来自世界各地雄心勃勃的研究人员提供鼓舞人心的学术工作环境和强大的博士课程。
好奇的？
您想更多地了解这个职位或在我们大学工作吗？联系 ir 博士。拉尔夫·莱杰纳尔来自
rth.leijenaar@maastrichtuniversity.nl
或 Eefje de Bont 博士通过
eefje.debont@maastrichtuniversity.nl
您也可以通过下面的按钮直接申请。
第一次选拔面试将于
2025 年 12 月 2 日 星期二
上午 9 点至中午 12 点之间可能的第二次对话将在
2025 年 12 月 9 日 星期二
上午 9:00 至中午 12:00 之间。
我们希望尽快认识您！
关于马斯特里赫特大学
在马斯特里赫特大学，我们共同寻找有助于世界前进的答案。我们与 23,300 名学生和 5,400 名员工一起完成这项工作，分布在该地区的 5 个城市、欧洲的 6 个学院和 70 多个研究机构。在这里，你将拥有突破界限、发现新机遇的空间；为了你自己和你周围的世界。因为我们一起寻找真正的答案。
该职位空缺向内部和外部候选人开放。在同等适合性的情况下，内部候选人优先。
马斯特里赫特大学致力于促进和维持一个多元化和包容性的社区。我们相信，员工和学生群体的多样性有助于提高密歇根大学的研究和教育质量。我们希望通过与学生和员工合作的包容性政策和创新项目来实现这一目标。我们鼓励您申请此职位。

raw_payload.title: Promovendus - Infectieziekten als casus voor data gedreven verbetering in de huisartsenpraktijk
raw_payload.description:
Welkom bij de Universiteit Maastricht!
Ben jij een gepassioneerde onderzoeker met een hart voor innovatie en AI? Wil je bijdragen aan het ontwikkelen en evalueren van een innovatie in de huisartsenzorg? De afdeling Huisartsgeneeskunde van de Universiteit Maastricht zoekt een promovendus om praktijkgericht onderzoek te verrichten.

Promovendus - Infectieziekten als casus voor data gedreven verbetering in de huisartsenpraktijk
  • Ons doel: De huisartsenzorg verbeteren met behulp van kunstmatige intelligentie, voor betere diagnostiek, datakwaliteit en patiëntenzorg.
  • Jouw collega’s: Huisartsen, onderzoekers en patiënten die samen werken aan de huisartsenzorg van de toekomst.

Huisartsen verzamelen dagelijks grote hoeveelheden waardevolle patiëntgegevens, deels gestructureerd en gestandaardiseerd, maar een substantieel deel bestaat uit vrije tekst uit consultverslagen. Deze ongestructureerde data wordt momenteel nog maar beperkt benut. Dankzij de opkomst van AI, en met name krachtige taalmodellen zoals BERT en GPT, ontstaan er nieuwe kansen om deze informatie effectief om te zetten in praktische ondersteuning bij diagnostiek, prognose en datakwaliteit. Dit onderzoeksproject richt zich daarbij op infectieziekten, zoals urineweginfectie en longontsteking - aandoeningen die tot de meest voorkomende klachten in de huisartspraktijk behoren.

Binnen dit project onderzoek je hoe AI een rol kan spelen in het verbeteren van de huisartsenzorg bij infectieziekten. Je werkt aan het ontwikkelen en valideren van AI-modellen voor diagnostiek en risicovoorspelling, en onderzoekt hoe deze technologie kan bijdragen aan betere registratie en datakwaliteit. Tegelijkertijd breng je in kaart hoe huisartsen en patiënten aankijken tegen het gebruik van AI in de dagelijkse praktijk. Je maakt gebruik van rijke, bestaande huisartsendata en werkt samen met meerdere academische netwerken verspreid over Nederland, samen goed voor gegevens van maar liefst 1,5 miljoen patiënten.

Vanaf 2025 is de vakgroep Huisartsgeneeskunde bovendien gestart met het inrichten van een academische werkplaats huisartsenzorg. Het doel van deze werkplaats is het ontwikkelen van nieuwe kennis en het gebruik daarvan in de praktijk te bevorderen, via een betere samen- en wisselwerking tussen huisartsenorganisaties en universiteit. De vakgroep is daarin actief vanuit twee fysieke ‘hubs’: Maastricht en Eindhoven. Deze dynamische omgeving biedt daarmee extra kansen jezelf tijdens dit promotietraject te ontwikkelen, en werken is vanuit beide locaties mogelijk.

Door praktijkgericht onderzoek te combineren met technologische innovatie, draag je bij aan de veilige en verantwoorde inzet van AI in de eerstelijnszorg. Dit project biedt dan ook een unieke kans om medische inhoud te combineren met technologische innovatie. Je werkt in een maatschappelijk relevant domein, met directe impact op de dagelijkse zorg. Samen met zorgverleners, patiënten en onderzoekers bouw je aan de huisartsenzorg van de toekomst.

Wat ga je doen?
  • Het ontwikkelen en valideren van AI-modellen op basis van gestructureerde en ongestructureerde huisartsdata
  • Het uitvoeren van kwalitatief onderzoek naar de perspectieven van huisartsen en patiënten op het gebruik van AI
  • Het samenwerken met onderzoekers, data scientists, zorgprofessionals en netwerkpartners in een multidisciplinaire setting
  • Het vertalen van onderzoeksresultaten naar praktische aanbevelingen voor zorg, beleid en onderwijs
  • Het schrijven van wetenschappelijke artikelen en rapportages over de bevindingen

Ben jij klaar om koers te zetten voor de komende jaren? Dan ontmoeten we je graag.

Wat jij meebrengt
Het gaat ons niet om vinkjes, maar om jouw motivatie, leergierigheid en aanpak. Herken jij jezelf hierin?
  • Een afgeronde universitaire masteropleiding biomedische technologie, biomedische wetenschappen, (technische) geneeskunde, gezondheidswetenschappen, of gelijke strekking;
  • Interesse in innovaties in de huisartspraktijk, big data en AI/LLM. Ervaring met deze technologieën is een pré.
  • Affiniteit met wetenschappelijk onderzoek, zowel kwalitatief als kwantitatief;
  • Goede organisatorische en communicatieve vaardigheden, in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een zelfstandige, nauwkeurige werkhouding én plezier in samenwerken met een interdisciplinair team.
  • Ervaring met wetenschappelijk schrijven is een pré.

Wat je van ons mag verwachten
Bij de Universiteit Maastricht werk je in een internationale, open en betrokken omgeving. We bieden:
  • Een jaarcontract, bij wederzijdse tevredenheid wordt het contract verlengd met 3 jaar.
  • Een bruto salaris tussen €3.059 en €3.881 bruto per maand (bij een fulltime dienstverband van 38 uur per week), exclusief 8% vakantiegeld en een 8,3% eindejaarsuitkering.
  • 29 vakantiedagen (op basis van fulltime), vier extra vrije dagen, en de mogelijkheid om 12 extra dagen op te bouwen via compensatie-uren.
  • Flexibele werktijden, een thuiswerkvergoeding en hybride werken.
  • Vrijheid en ruimte om je werk zelfstandig in te richten en je eigen ideeën te ontwikkelen.
  • Een hechte community van collega’s waarmee je nauw samenwerkt.
  • Een goede pensioenregeling via het ABP, bedrijfsfitness en toegang tot een uitgebreid sportaanbod.
  • Een inspirerende werkomgeving in het hart van Europa.

Over de Faculty of Health, Medicine and Life Sciences (FHML)
FHML werkt aan gezondheid in de breedste zin van het woord: van molecuul tot mens, en van gezondheidszorg tot preventie. We leiden zorgprofessionals en onderzoekers op binnen innovatieve onderwijsprogramma’s, en doen baanbrekend onderzoek op het gebied van gezondheid en welzijn. Als onderdeel van het Maastricht UMC+ (MUMC+) vormt onze internationale en interdisciplinaire gemeenschap een unieke samenwerking tussen universiteit en academisch ziekenhuis, waar onderwijs, onderzoek en zorg samenkomen.

CAPHRI
Onze vakgroep is onderdeel van onderzoeksinstituut CAPHRI, dat zich inzet voor betere gezondheid door innovatief, praktijkgericht en maatschappelijk relevant onderzoek. CAPHRI verbindt wetenschap en samenleving via participatief onderzoek binnen de publieke en eerstelijnszorg en persoonsgerichte langdurige zorg. De vakgroep huisartsgeneeskunde heeft wetenschappelijke speerpunten: Huisarts & Diagnostiek, Huisarts & Digitale Zorg en Samen beslissen & interprofessioneel samenwerken. We verrichten onderzoek dat Bruikbare Wetenschap voor de praktijk van de huisarts oplevert. CAPHRI biedt een inspirerende academische werkomgeving en een sterk PhD-programma voor ambitieuze onderzoekers van over de hele wereld.

Nieuwsgierig geworden?
Wil je meer weten over deze functie of over werken bij onze universiteit? Neem contact op met dr. ir. Ralph Leijenaar via rth.leijenaar@maastrichtuniversity.nl of dr. Eefje de Bont via eefje.debont@maastrichtuniversity.nl Je kunt ook direct solliciteren via de onderstaande knop.

De eerste selectiegesprekken vinden plaats op dinsdag 2 december 2025 tussen 09.00 en 12.00 uur. Een eventueel tweede gesprek zal plaatsvinden op dinsdag 9 december 2025 tussen 09:00 en 12:00 uur.

We hopen je snel te leren kennen!

Over de Universiteit Maastricht
Aan de Universiteit Maastricht zoeken we samen naar antwoorden waarmee we de wereld vooruithelpen. Dat doen we samen met 23.300 studenten en 5.400 medewerkers, verspreid over 5 steden in de regio, 6 faculteiten en ruim 70 onderzoeksinstituten in de Euregio. Hier krijg je de ruimte om grenzen te verleggen en nieuwe kansen te ontdekken; voor jezelf en voor de wereld om je heen. Want echte antwoorden vinden we samen.

De vacature staat open voor interne- en externe kandidaten. Bij gelijke geschiktheid hebben interne kandidaten voorrang.

Universiteit Maastricht zet zich in voor het bevorderen en behouden van een diverse en inclusieve gemeenschap. Wij geloven dat diversiteit in onze medewerkers- en studentenpopulatie bijdraagt aan de kwaliteit van onderzoek en onderwijs aan de UM. Dit willen we mogelijk maken door middel van inclusief beleid en innovatieve projecten in samenwerking met studenten en medewerkers. We moedigen je aan om voor deze functie te solliciteren.

items.description_en:
The Brain Connectivity and Connectomics team at the Department of Complex Trait Genetics at the Center for Neurogenomics and Cognitive Research (CNCR), Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (
www.cncr.nl
), invites applications for
2
PhD positions
in the study of
human brain evolution and the origins of human cognitive brain functions
. This project focuses on understanding human brain evolution and how evolutionary procesess have shaped the organization of
human cognitive brain networks
and their cognitive functions and vulnerability to mental conditions. By applying neuroimaging, genetics and
network neuroscience
analyses
to
MRI data from multiple species
, the project aims to study the
evolutionary basis of human cognition
—including
language, working memory, theory-of-mind
, and the specialized brain networks supporting these processes. One candidate will focus on the genetics side of the research question, the other candidate will focus on the neuroimaging and network neuroscience part.
Working in a team, the joint aim of the project is to gain insight into the comparative effects of human brain connectome organization and the integration of this data with recent functional and structural connectome properties and recent evolutionary genetic discoveries, utilizing large-scale bioinformatic databases and resources.
Background: The human brain is a highly complex network of interconnected regions—the
connectome
. Over the past decade, advances in
network neuroscience
and
connectomics
have allowed researchers to map and study the organization of brain networks, revealing how connectivity underpins cognition and behavior. The emerging field of
comparative connectomics
seeks to understand how these brain networks overlap and differ across species, providing insights into the
evolutionary origins of brain function
and the neural basis of cognitive functions such as language, working memory, and theory-of-mind. Key questions include how brain systems have evolved across species, which connections are uniquely developed in humans, and how these patterns relate to evolutionary changes in genetic and molecular mechanisms.
In this project, you will investigate these questions by analyzing large-scale MRI from multiple species, making specific species-comparisons (for example chimpanzees vs humans) and applying and developing state-of-the-art methods in network analysis, connectomics, and computational neuroscience. You will collaborate within a motivated, multidisciplinary team of PhD students and postdocs with expertise in biology bioinformatics, AI, genetics, neuroimaging, computational neuroscience, psychology, and statistics, together contributing to a deeper understanding of the basis of human brain connectivity and brain function.

Our goal
- perform connectome analysis on neuroimaging data\integrate connectome findings across multiple speices
- work on developing new statistical methods to compare networks across conditions
- apply bioinformatic tools for integrating results from different biological resources
- think critically
- work with highly motivated and enthusiastic team members
- actively take part in discussions and have frequent contact with CNCR neuroimaging, genetics and neuroscience labs
- authoring and co-authoring manuscripts submitted to high quality journals
- support (10% of time) to teaching

在本项目中，您将通过分析多个物种的大规模 MRI、进行特定物种比较（例如黑猩猩与人类）以及应用和开发网络分析、连接组学和计算神经科学领域最先进的方法来研究这些问题。您将与一个积极进取的多学科团队合作，该团队由博士生和博士后组成，他们拥有生物学生物信息学、人工智能、遗传学、神经影像学、计算神经科学、心理学和统计学方面的专业知识，共同致力于更深入地了解人脑连接和大脑功能的基础。

我们的目标

items.title_en: Fully funded PhD position on “Colloidal plasmonic Metasurfaces for Single-Molecule Fluorescence Biosensing”
items.title_zh: “用于单分子荧光生物传感的胶体等离子体超表面”的全额资助博士职位
items.description_en:
The Molecular Plasmonics group at the Eindhoven University of Technology has a PhD position in the field of metasurfaces for single-molecule biosensing. This project aims to develop a new generation of single-molecule sensors that exploit collective and localized resonances in metasurfaces to boost the sensitivity of plasmonic biosensors.
Introduction
Current workhorse techniques to detect and study single biomolecules rely on fluorescence microscopy. Recent advances in Zijlstra’s group used metallic nanoparticles to enhance the fluorescence intensity (link). This approach has given access for the first time to previously inaccessible microsecond dynamics (link). Further boosting the enhancement will require entirely novel designs that exhibit multiple resonances provided by e.g. plasmonic metasurfaces (link).
About this position
In this position you will leverage novel dielectric and plasmonic metasurface designs for single-molecule fluorescence sensing. You will perform colloidal assembly of plasmonic metasurfaces, functionalize them with biomolecules such as DNA, and then experimentally quantify the fluorescence enhancement mechanisms using single-molecule spectroscopy and super-resolution microscopy. This will allow you to answer questions like: how do we design a plasmonic metasurface to achieve record-breaking fluorescence brightness? How do we probe these enhancement factors using single-molecule experiments? How can we exploit these novel platforms for the next generation of single-molecule biosensors?
The project will be supervised by Prof. Zijlstra (Molecular Plasmonics group) and co-supervised by Prof. Gomez Rivas (Surface Photonics group). You will closely collaborate with a team of PhD students across the two groups that work on metasurfaces for fluorescence manipulation.
About the groups
Both groups are part of the department of Applied Physics and Science Education. The molecular plasmonics group develops plasmonic and nanophotonic biosensors with single-molecule sensitivity. The nanoscale field confinement in resonant (e.g. plasmonic) nanoparticles is exploited to detect and study single molecules in real-time. The team is multidisciplinary and hosts physicists, chemists, and biomedical engineers that collaborate in a close-knit team. The lab hosts a range of state-of-the-art single-molecule microscopes in optical laboratories, as well as wet-chemical labs for sample preparation. The group is part of a bigger research cluster focusing on optical sensing.
The surface photonics group investigates light-matter interaction in a broad range of frequencies, from the visible to the THz. This interaction is enhanced by resonant structures, such as metallic or dielectric nanoparticles and metasurfaces. The group is part of the research cluster "Photonics and Semiconductor Nanophysics".
items.description_zh:
埃因霍温理工大学的分子等离子体小组在单分子生物传感超表面领域拥有博士学位。该项目旨在开发新一代单分子传感器，利用超表面中的集体和局部共振来提高等离子体生物传感器的灵敏度。
简介
目前检测和研究单个生物分子的主要技术依赖于荧光显微镜。 Zijlstra 团队的最新进展是使用金属纳米颗粒来增强荧光强度（链接）。这种方法首次提供了以前无法访问的微秒动态（链接）。进一步增强增强将需要全新的设计，这些设计表现出多种共振，例如由等离子体超表面（链接）。
关于这个职位
在这个职位上，您将利用新颖的介电和等离子体超表面设计进行单分子荧光传感。您将进行等离子体超表面的胶体组装，用 DNA 等生物分子对其进行功能化，然后使用单分子光谱和超分辨率显微镜通过实验量化荧光增强机制。这将使您能够回答以下问题：我们如何设计等离子体超表面以实现破纪录的荧光亮度？我们如何使用单分子实验来探测这些增强因子？我们如何利用这些新颖的平台来开发下一代单分子生物传感器？
该项目将由Zijlstra教授（分子等离子体组）监督，并由Gomez Rivas教授（表面光子组）共同监督。您将与两个小组的博士生团队密切合作，研究用于荧光操纵的超表面。
关于团体
这两个小组都是应用物理和科学教育系的一部分。分子等离子体小组开发具有单分子灵敏度的等离子体和纳米光子生物传感器。利用共振（例如等离子体）纳米颗粒中的纳米级场限制来实时检测和研究单分子。该团队是多学科的，由物理学家、化学家和生物医学工程师组成，他们在一个紧密的团队中合作。该实验室在光学实验室以及用于样品制备的湿化学实验室中拥有一系列最先进的单分子显微镜。该小组是专注于光学传感的更大研究集群的一部分。
表面光子学小组研究从可见光到太赫兹的广泛频率范围内的光与物质的相互作用。这种相互作用通过共振结构（例如金属或介电纳米颗粒和超表面）得到增强。该小组是“光子学和半导体纳米物理学”研究集群的一部分。

The nanoscale field confinement in resonant (e.g. plasmonic) nanoparticles is exploited to detect and study single molecules in real-time. The team is multidisciplinary and hosts physicists, chemists, and biomedical engineers that collaborate in a close-knit team. The lab hosts a range of state-of-the-art single-molecule microscopes in optical laboratories, as well as wet-chemical labs for sample preparation. The group is part of a bigger research cluster focusing on optical sensing.

The surface photonics group investigates light-matter interaction in a broad range of frequencies, from the visible to the THz. This interaction is enhanced by resonant structures, such as metallic or dielectric nanoparticles and metasurfaces. The group is part of the research cluster "Photonics and Semiconductor Nanophysics".

items.description_en:
To heat our houses and offices with a lower carbon footprint, efficient and low-cost heat storage solutions such as organic phase change materials (PCM) hold great promise. To design efficient and low-cost PCM composites the RecyWax+ project combines multi-physics modelling approaches and physical experimentation of the thermal properties of the PCM composite. Throughout, theory is validated by synthesis and assembly of concrete PCMs. RecyWax+ offers a PhD position for molecular-dynamics simulations of novel PCM systems for thermal storage.
Recywax+
is supported within the Dutch Research Council
NWO OTP programme
, and is led by profs.
Alexey Lyulin
,
Heiner Friedrich
and
Henk Huinink
(all TU/e) and prof.
Bernard Geurts
(U Twente). The project explores how waste products can be turned into a sustainable battery for thermal storage. The idea is to combine waxes obtained through pyrolysis of plastic waste streams, with ultra-conductive graphene networks, i.e., nanometer sized carbon platelets that transport heat at tremendous conductivity. This creates a compact and efficient system for thermal energy storage, exploiting phase transition to store thermal energy in terms of an increased temperature, as well as a reversible change of phase from solid to liquid. Think of it as a heat battery that charges and discharges similarly to a regular battery, but with heat instead of electricity.
Recywax+
aims to develop the next generation of PCM composites extracted from upcycled polymer pyrolysis waste streams and thermally conductive fillers. In this PhD project we adopt a molecular modelling approach with which we address the following steps/questions:
- Characterize the molecular structure and molecular distribution of suitable polymer pyrolysis waste streams to aid modelling of filler-matrix interfaces;
- Modeling (using Gromacs and LAMMPS software packages and MARTINI-like upscaling) the filler-matrix interfaces to optimize thermal transport, e.g., by functionalization of the nanofiller surface;
- Simulate and advise on the ideal filler-filler contacts and filler-matrix interface structure; this interface should be such that the fillers are finely dispersed in the matrix, yet still enabling good filler-filler contacts;
- Connect sub-micron, atomistic properties of the interface to macroscopic network scales, predict thermal conductivity, and develop practical strategies to drastically increase thermal conductivity;

NWO OTP 计划
，并由教授领导。
阿列克谢·柳林
,
海纳·弗里德里希
和
亨克·惠因克
（所有 TU/e）和教授。
伯纳德·格尔茨
（乌特温特）。该项目探索如何将废物转化为可持续的蓄热电池。这个想法是将通过塑料废物流热解获得的蜡与超导石墨烯网络（即以巨大的电导率传输热量的纳米尺寸的碳片）结合起来。这创造了一个紧凑而高效的热能存储系统，利用相变以升高的温度以及从固体到液体的可逆相变来存储热能。将其视为热电池，其充电和放电与普通电池类似，但使用热量而不是电力。
再生蜡+
旨在开发从升级回收的聚合物热解废物流和导热填料中提取的下一代 PCM 复合材料。在这个博士项目中，我们采用分子建模方法来解决以下步骤/问题：
- 表征合适的聚合物热解废物流的分子结构和分子分布，以帮助对填料-基体界面进行建模；
- 对填料-基体界面进行建模（使用 Gromacs 和 LAMMPS 软件包以及类似 MARTINI 的升级）以优化热传输，例如通过纳米填料表面的功能化；
- 对理想的填料-填料接触和填料-基体界面结构进行模拟并提出建议；该界面应使填料精细地分散在基体中，同时仍能实现良好的填料-填料接触；
- 将界面的亚微米原子特性与宏观网络尺度联系起来，预测导热率，并制定实用策略以大幅提高导热率；

Hoe kunnen pensioenfondsen beter naar hun klanten communiceren dat ze duurzaam investeren? De meeste deelnemers willen dat hun pensioenfonds een groot deel van hun geld duurzaam belegt, maar niet iedereen deelt die wens. In de meeste consumenten situaties kun je naar een ander merk overstappen als je niet de waarden deelt die het bedrijf uitdraagt, maar in de Nederlandse pensioensector zijn veel mensen verbonden aan hun pensioenfonds. De vraag is dus hoe pensioenfondsen hun investeringsbeleid (in bijvoorbeeld duurzaamheid, defensie, of sociale huisvesting) kunnen delen met hun deelnemers die in grote mate variëren in voorkeuren. Dit project is deel van een groter NWO project over de rol van de pensioensector in de transitie naar een duurzamere samenleving, dat is toegekend aan Netspar.

Het proefschrift is het product van de creativiteit en het initiatief van de kandidaat, vormgegeven onder begeleiding van de (co)promotoren prof.dr.ing. N. van de Ven, dr. Jenna Barrett, en dr. Saskia ter Ellen (VU Amsterdam) in samenwerking met Netspar. Naast een focus op het schrijven van de wetenschappelijke papers over dit onderwerp zul je ook papers schrijven die gericht zijn op het vertalen van de bevindingen naar de pensioensector zelf. Het project is daarom bij uitstek geschikt voor iemand die wil promoveren op een onderwerp met zowel wetenschappelijke als maatschappelijke relevantie.

In deze tijd schrijf je een proefschrift, dat doorgaans uit 3 papers bestaat. De uitvoering van het onderzoek omvat doorgaans het conceptualiseren van de onderzoeksvragen en ideeën, het verzamelen van gegevens, kwantitatieve analyse van de gegevens, en het schrijven en presenteren van academische artikelen. Het doel is om over de projecten te publiceren in hoogwaardige academische tijdschriften. Na succesvolle afronding van je cursussen en je onderzoek, blijkend uit een ingediend en goedgekeurd proefschrift en de daaropvolgende verdediging, ontvang je het doctoraat van Tilburg University. 

Je wordt ingeschreven als promovendus in het toonaangevende PhD-programma van CentER, waar je uitgebreide theoretische en methodologische training zult ontvangen door verschillende PhD-cursussen te volgen (ongeveer 36 Europese studiepunten, hetgeen overeenkomt met 6 volledige cursussen). De training kan in overleg met de begeleiders worden aangepast aan de eerdere opleidingsresultaten van de PhD-kandidaat (afhankelijk van vooropleiding kan het ook minder cursussen worden). Het uiteindelijke programma wordt samengesteld door het begeleidingsteam in samenspraak met de Graduate Program Coordinator van het departement. 

Er is ook een budget beschikbaar voor het volgen van PhD-cursussen buiten CentER, werkbezoeken en (internationale) conferenties. Verder wordt ongeveer 80% van de tijd wordt besteed aan het PhD-onderzoek en 20% aan het verwerven van academische vaardigheden door het geven van cursussen en het begeleiden van master- en bachelorscripties binnen de afdeling.

Would you love to apply Data Science to Military Corrosion Technology? Join us on our journey to ensure Safe Operation of Military Systems.
Job description
Join the Corrosion Technology and Electrochemistry (CTE) group, part of the Department of Materials Science and Engineering at the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering, in close collaboration with the Netherlands Defence Academy. The CTE group is a dynamic team of researchers, including PhD candidates, postdocs, and faculty members. Our group focuses on understanding and mitigating corrosion processes, and on the development of electrocatalysts and electrochemical sensors through the synthesis of materials and the use of advanced electrochemical methods and surface analysis techniques. We aim to deepen the fundamental knowledge of electrochemistry and surface science and translate this into practical, sustainable solutions for energy and materials applications.
Increasingly strict performance requirements for components lead to new material combinations and potential corrosion problems. The most dangerous of these are highly localized. Localized corrosion under a coating is however typically difficult to detect visually. Electrochemical Noise (EN) can detect this at an early stage and is not limited by geometric characteristics. Moreover, EN measures passively and continuously, making it very suitable for permanent monitoring or as an accelerated testing method. The effectiveness of EN depends on effective data analysis. Until now, specific EN fingerprints of localized corrosion are determined manually. This is a tedious procedure that requires considerable expert knowledge. Artificial intelligence or machine learning (AI/ML) models can offer a solution here.
This project aims to determine to what extent AI/ML models based on electrochemical sensor data are able to identify and quantify local forms of corrosion. We are looking for a skilled PhD researcher to investigate these models, together with the Netherlands Defence Academy. Your work as a PhD researcher involves the following:
- Determining the required discrimination ability for classification and quantification of corrosion phenomena, e.g. differences and similarities in data between crevice- and different forms of pitting corrosion.
- Investigating which types of AI/ML models can meet these requirements.
- (Further) developing suitable AI/ML models.
- Investigating which requirements the training data for the AI/ML models must meet, including type, quantity, and number of corrosion classes.
- Performing laboratory experiments to validate the corrosion classification and -quantification for representative forms of corrosion that typically cause problems in military systems.
- Further validation on field data from actual military systems.
TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.
At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core
values
and we actively
engage
to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.
Challenge. Change. Impact!
Faculty Mechanical Engineering
From chip to ship. From machine to human being. From idea to solution. Driven by a deep-rooted desire to understand our environment and discover its underlying mechanisms, research and education at the ME faculty focusses on fundamental understanding, design, production including application and product improvement, materials, processes and (mechanical) systems.
ME is a dynamic and innovative faculty with high-tech lab facilities and international reach. It’s a large faculty but also versatile, so we can often make unique connections by combining different disciplines. This is reflected in ME’s outstanding, state-of-the-art education, which trains students to become responsible and socially engaged engineers and scientists. We translate our knowledge and insights into solutions to societal issues, contributing to a sustainable society and to the development of prosperity and well-being. That is what unites us in pioneering research, inspiring education and (inter)national cooperation.

videos

Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.
Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, increasing from €3059 - €3881 gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.

您想将数据科学应用于军事腐蚀技术吗？与我们一起踏上确保军事系统安全运行的旅程。
职位描述
加入腐蚀技术和电化学 (CTE) 小组，该小组是机械工程学院材料科学与工程系的一部分，与荷兰国防学院密切合作。 CTE 小组是一个充满活力的研究人员团队，包括博士生、博士后和教职人员。我们的团队专注于了解和减轻腐蚀过程，并通过材料合成和使用先进的电化学方法和表面分析技术来开发电催化剂和电化学传感器。我们的目标是加深电化学和表面科学的基础知识，并将其转化为能源和材料应用的实用、可持续的解决方案。
对部件日益严格的性能要求导致新的材料组合和潜在的腐蚀问题。其中最危险的是高度局部化的。然而，涂层下的局部腐蚀通常很难用肉眼检测到。电化学噪声 (EN) 可以在早期阶段检测到这一点，并且不受几何特征的限制。此外，EN 测量是被动且连续的，非常适合永久监测或作为加速测试方法。 EN 的有效性取决于有效的数据分析。到目前为止，局部腐蚀的特定 EN 指纹都是手动确定的。这是一个繁琐的过程，需要大量的专业知识。人工智能或机器学习 (AI/ML) 模型可以在这里提供解决方案。
该项目旨在确定基于电化学传感器数据的 AI/ML 模型能够在多大程度上识别和量化局部腐蚀形式。我们正在寻找一位熟练的博士研究员与荷兰国防学院一起研究这些模型。作为博士研究员，您的工作涉及以下内容：
- 确定腐蚀现象分类和量化所需的辨别能力，例如腐蚀现象。缝隙腐蚀和不同形式的点蚀之间数据的差异和相似之处。
- 研究哪些类型的 AI/ML 模型可以满足这些要求。
-（进一步）开发合适的人工智能/机器学习模型。
- 研究 AI/ML 模型的训练数据必须满足哪些要求，包括腐蚀类别的类型、数量和数量。
- 进行实验室实验来验证腐蚀分类和对通常在军事系统中引起问题的代表性腐蚀形式进行量化。
- 对来自实际军事系统的现场数据进行进一步验证。
TU Delft（代尔夫特理工大学）
代尔夫特理工大学有着坚实的基础。作为举世闻名的荷兰水厂的创建者和生物技术的先驱，代尔夫特理工大学是一所集科学、工程和设计于一体的顶尖国际大学。它在教育、研究和创新方面提供世界一流的成果，以应对能源、气候、流动性、健康和数字社会领域的挑战。几代人以来，我们的工程师已被证明是商业和社会环境中的企业家问题解决者。
在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们的核心之一
价值观
并且我们积极地
参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们重视不同的观点和品质。我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同想象、发明和创造利用技术对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平的考虑。
挑战。改变。影响！
机械工程学院
从芯片到船舶。从机器到人。从想法到解决方案。在了解我们的环境并发现其潜在机制的根深蒂固的愿望的推动下，ME 教师的研究和教育侧重于基础理解、设计、生产，包括应用和产品改进、材料、工艺和（机械）系统。
ME 是一支充满活力和创新精神的教师队伍，拥有高科技实验室设施和国际影响力。它的师资力量雄厚，但也多才多艺，因此我们经常可以通过结合不同学科来建立独特的联系。这体现在 ME 杰出、最先进的教育中，它培养学生成为负责任的、积极参与社会的工程师和科学家。我们将知识和见解转化为社会问题的解决方案，为可持续发展的社会以及繁荣和福祉的发展做出贡献。这就是我们在开拓性研究、启发性教育和（国际）国家合作方面团结起来的原因。
点击
这里
前往机械工程学院网站。您想体验在我们学院工作吗？这些
视频
将向您介绍我们的一些研究人员及其工作。
雇佣条件
博士生聘用期原则上为4年，但采用2份聘用合同的形式。最初的 1.5 年合同，并在 15 个月内进行正式的进展/不进展评估。如果一切顺利且满足性能要求，接下来将签订剩余 2.5 年的附加合同。
工资和福利符合荷兰大学集体劳动协议，从第一年到第四年，基于全职合同（38小时），每月毛额从3059欧元增加到3881欧元，另加8%的假期津贴和8.3%的年终奖金。

来到代尔夫特服务
，在其网站上提供信息以帮助您准备搬迁。此外，“来到代尔夫特服务”还组织活动来帮助您在荷兰定居，并扩展您在代尔夫特的（社交）网络。一个
双轨制职业计划
可以为您的随行伴侣在荷兰寻找工作提供支持。
附加信息
有关此职位空缺的更多信息，请联系 Axel Homborg 博士（
A.M.Homborg@tudelft.nl
）和/或 Arjan Mol 博士教授（
J.M.C.Mol@tudelft.nl
）。
2026 年 1 月 4 日
通过申请按钮并上传以下文件：
- 您的详细简历。
- 你的求职信、两封推荐信和你的英文硕士论文摘要。
您可以向 Axel Homborg 博士和/或 Arjan Mol 博士教授提出申请。

Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit, Coming to Delft Service, offers information on their website to help you prepare your relocation. In addition, Coming to Delft Service organises events to help you settle in the Netherlands, and expand your (social) network in Delft. A Dual Career Programme is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands.

Additional information
For more information about this vacancy, please contact Dr. Axel Homborg (A.M.Homborg@tudelft.nl) and/or Prof. Dr. Arjan Mol (J.M.C.Mol@tudelft.nl).

Application procedure
Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than 4 January 2026 via the application button and upload the following documents:
  • Your detailed CV.
  • Your cover (motivation) letter, two references and the abstract of your MSc thesis in English.

You can address your application to Dr. Axel Homborg and/or Prof. Dr. Arjan Mol.
Applications sent by email will be ignored.

Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.

Please note:
  • You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
  • As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.
  • Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.
