raw_payload.description:
*Four-year fully funded projects with possible extension and state-of-the-art facilities*

Erasmus Research Institute of Management (ERIM) is the joint research institute of Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University (RSM) and the Erasmus School of Economics (ESE). Each year, ERIM initiates new and internationally oriented PhD research projects focusing on pioneering and innovative research in the fields of management and business research. For more information about ERIM please visit www.erim.eur.nl.

The applications process for the Fulltime PhD programme that starts in September 2026 is now open. The applications deadline is 15 January 2026. 

Contribute scientifically to marketing.  

The PhD programme in Marketing focuses on both managerial and consumer decision-making processes in marketing. The programme’s mission is to contribute to the body of knowledge of marketing in a way that has academic rigour, leads to new scientific insights, and has practical relevance. The three broad themes of the Marketing programme are: consumer behaviour, marketing management and strategy, and marketing modelling.

RSM currently offers the following PhD project within its MKT research programme at ERIM:

·         PhD in Consumer Behavior

·         PhD in Quantitative Marketing

·         PhD in Fair Machine Learning in Marketing

Other fully funded PhD research projects offered by RSM are Business Processes, Logistics and Information Systems (LIS), Organisation (ORG), Finance & Accounting (F&A), and Strategy & Entrepreneurship (S&E). For a list and detailed description of all current For a list and detailed description of all current RSM PhD Vacancies, please visit the RSM website.  

More information about the Full-time PhD in Business and Management programme can be found on the RSM website.

Note: In December, the Marketing Department offers a PhD Virtual Open House Day. If you are interested in their PhD program and consider applying, we invite you to join on December 9 from 9.30 am to 11.00 am CET OR on December 11 from 8.00 pm to 9.30 pm CET. In these info sessions they provide you with lots of information on their PhD program, department, and school. You will also get to know some of their faculty members and current PhD students, hear them talk about their research, and have the chance to ask questions.

items.title_en: PhD interventieradiologie
items.title_zh: 介入放射学博士
items.description_zh:
在阿姆斯特丹 UMC 的介入放射科内，我们研究针对各种类型癌症的创新、非侵入性治疗方法。我们有3名介入肿瘤学领域的博士生，每人都有自己的研究路径。
- 博士轨迹 1：第一个博士轨迹侧重于改善结直肠肝转移患者的热消融治疗。该研究的目的不仅在于优化这种治疗方法，还在于扩大适应症。
博士轨迹1：
- 博士轨迹2：第二个博士轨迹侧重于微波消融（MWA）热消融和所谓不可逆电穿孔（IRE）非热消融的应用以及与免疫疗法联合治疗结直肠肝转移患者的效果。
博士轨迹2：
- 博士轨迹3：第三个博士轨迹侧重于使用注射近距离放射治疗、导管控制光动力疗法和脉冲电场等对胰腺癌患者进行局部治疗，以及与免疫疗法相结合的效果。
博士轨迹3：
您将在一个充满活力的研究人员和临床医生团队中工作。您可以使用我们的前瞻性 AmCORE 注册表进行科学和临床研究。目前正在进行各种临床试验和新的（国际）国家试验的申请。作为研究协调员，您有责任启动和协调这些新研究。
您的职责包括：
- 分析数据并回答前瞻性数据库中的各种研究问题；
- 准备临床试验的研究计划、申请表和方案；
- 参与多学科会诊，选择合适的患者进行研究；
- 开展门诊工作，将患者纳入其中；
- 监督临床试验的设计和实施，包括监测和报告；
- 从各种外部注册研究中收集数据。
我们的研究小组目前正在进行几个项目，包括 COLLISION IMPACT 的应用，该项目研究热消融作为肝转移标准护理的实施情况。 COLLISION-XL 侧重于通过 MWA、SBRT 或切除术对较大肝转移进行局部治疗，而 COLLISION RELAPSE 着眼于对肝转移进行重复局部治疗之前化疗的效果。 INJECTABL-II 研究肝转移灶消融后局部免疫治疗的效果，COLDFIRE-III 比较 IRE 和 SBRT 对中央结直肠肝转移灶的治疗效果。 PANCOSIL专注于局部晚期胰腺癌的P32注射，PANFIRE-3则研究IRE与免疫治疗相结合治疗转移性胰腺癌。导管引导光动力疗法（VasoBLATE）专注于胰腺癌的血管内消融。最后，HARMONY 研究了机器人手术和经皮消融治疗结直肠肝转移瘤的同步性能。简而言之，我们的研究小组与外科、放射治疗和肿瘤学等其他学科密切合作。

raw_payload.title: PhD interventieradiologie
raw_payload.description:
Binnen de afdeling interventieradiologie van Amsterdam UMC onderzoeken wij innovatieve, niet-invasieve behandelingsmethoden voor diverse soorten kanker. We hebben plek voor drie PhD-kandidaten op het gebied van deze interventionele oncologie, elk met een eigen onderzoekstraject.
  • PhD-traject 1: Het eerste PhD-traject richt zich op het verbeteren van thermale ablaties bij de behandeling van patiënten met colorectale levermetastasen. Het onderzoek beoogt niet alleen de optimalisatie van deze behandelmethode, maar ook het uitbreiden van de indicaties.
  • PhD-traject 2: Het tweede PhD-traject richt zich op de toepassing van thermale ablatie middels microwave ablatie (MWA) en niet-thermale ablatie middels zogenaamde irreversibele electroporatie (IRE) en het effect van de combinatie met immuuntherapie, bij de behandeling van patiënten met colorectale levermetastasen.
  • PhD-traject 3: Het derde PhD-traject richt zich op de lokale behandeling van patiënten met pancreascarcinoom met onder andere injecteerbare brachytherapie, kathetergestuurde photodynamische therapie en pulsed electrical fields en het effect van de combinatie met immuuntherapie.

Je zult werken binnen een dynamisch team van onderzoekers en clinici. Je voert zowel wetenschappelijk als klinisch onderzoek uit, waarbij je gebruikmaakt van onze prospectieve AmCORE-registry. Er lopen verschillende klinische trials en aanvragen voor nieuwe (inter)nationale trials. Als studiecoördinator zal het jouw verantwoordelijkheid zijn om deze nieuwe studies op te starten en te coördineren.

Je werkzaamheden omvatten het:
  • analyseren van data en het beantwoorden van verschillende onderzoeksvragen vanuit een prospectieve database;
  • opstellen van onderzoeksvoorstellen, aanvraagformulieren en protocollen voor klinische onderzoeken;
  • deelnemen aan multidisciplinair overleg voor het selecteren van geschikte patiënten voor studies;
  • uitvoeren van poliklinische werkzaamheden ter inclusie van patiënten;
  • begeleiden van de opzet en uitvoering van klinische trials, inclusief monitoring en rapportage;
  • verzamelen van data uit verschillende externe registratiestudies.

Binnen onze onderzoeksgroep lopen momenteel verschillende projecten, waaronder een aanvraag voor de COLLISION IMPACT, die de implementatie van thermale ablatie als standaard zorg voor levermetastasen onderzoekt. De COLLISION-XL richt zich op lokale behandeling van grotere levermetastasen door middel van MWA, SBRT of resectie, terwijl COLLISION RELAPSE kijkt naar het effect van chemotherapie vóór herhaalde lokale behandeling van levermetastasen. INJECTABL-II onderzoekt de het effect van lokale immuuntherapie na ablatie van levermetastasen en COLDFIRE-III vergelijkt IRE en SBRT voor centrale colorectale levermetastasen. PANCOSIL richt zich op de injectie van P32 bij lokaal gevorderd pancreascarcinoom, en de PANFIRE-3 onderzoekt de combinatie van IRE en immuuntherapie bij gemetastaseerd pancreascarcinoom. Kathetergestuurde photodynamische therapie (VasoBLATE) richt zich op endovasculaire ablatie van pancreascarcinomen. Ten slotte onderzoekt de HARMONY de gelijktijdige uitvoering van robotchirurgie en percutane ablaties voor colorectale levermetastasen. Kortom, onze onderzoeksgroep werkt nauw samen met andere disciplines zoals chirurgie, radiotherapie en oncologie.

items.title_en: PhD Position Systemic Physical Risk for Governments and Collateral Fiscal Damage
items.title_zh: 博士职位政府的系统性实体风险和附带财政损害
items.description_en:
Join our ERC SPHINX Team to model how climate risks ripple through housing markets. Help uncover when homes become stranded assets and fuel systemic impacts. Help shaping climate resilient policies!
Job description
This 4-year fully funded PhD position is part of the ERC Consolidator project “Systemic physical climate risk in complex adaptive economies” (SPHINX). The SPHINX-research program is made possible thanks to a 2-million-euro grant from the European Research Council.
Background:
Globally, climate change already manifests via physical risks – damages from floods, storms, wildfires, heatwaves, droughts, and sea-level rise. Concerns are rising that these risks may become systemic, when local damages to one element cannot be contained and adversely affect the entire socio-economic system. Usually, physical climate risk assessments overlay hazard probability, exposure and vulnerability. These future damage estimates linearly extrapolate historic data, assuming that markets efficiently capitalize full information about climate risks and adjust gradually, economic actors have perfect future insight, and socio-economic systems will react to and price unprecedented climate-induced hazards as they did in the past. This approach is criticized for underestimating the true costs of climate change (e.g., at just 1-3% of GDP loss even under severe scenarios), impeding climate action. In contrast, analysis of systemic risks embraces complex interactions among elements/agents, adjusting expectations, mechanisms of contagion dynamics, feedbacks, and non-linear tipping. The SPHINX research program aims to fundamentally advance simulation methods and consolidate novel data to understand how systemic physical climate risks emerge in the socio-economic system, and to explore strategies to curtail their spiraling costs. The project focuses on Europe, with a detailed analysis of three selected case-study regions. Methodologically, SPHINX embraces five pillars, ranging from data collection to agent-based and computable general equilibrium modeling, led by five team members. The first three pillars concern the development of computational agent-based models to explore three different channels of risk propagation with a focus on the triggers of systemic risks. The current PhD position aims to advance assessments of physical climate risks for governments, including the emergence of moral hazard and inequality in the allocation of climate adaptation funding, as well as collateral damage to their budgets.
Job description:
The successful candidate will work within the SPHINX research team to explore how governments balance economic development objectives with adaptation to accelerating physical climate risks, as households-voters decide where to live given their preferences for public adaptation. To explore the emergence of moral hazard and fiscal strain for governments under shifting climate risks, the candidate will develop an agent-based model grounded in the Tiebout theory and supported by data, including data on public preferences for allocating adaptation funds. During this 4-year-long project, the PhD student will build on the latest progress in economic research on changes in governmental debt and collateral fiscal damages, and instances of moral hazard and loss of creditworthiness for governments facing escalating climate risks. Connecting the mutually dependent decisions of governments to provide and fund public adaptation, and the location choices of diverse private actors in an agent-based model will be essential here. This modeling effort will benefit from the behavioral data on expectations elicited via tailored household and firm surveys (carried out by another team member) and other spatial and physical climate risk data. The goal of this agent-based modeling is to identify conditions under which risk contagion causes regional decline, and the roots of changing inequality based on how local governments decide on the level of public adaptation provision contingent on both households’ preferences for it and the availability of sufficient tax-based governmental budgets to afford it.
TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.

We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.

The Faculty of TPM provides an important contribution to solving complex technical-social issues, such as energy transition, mobility, digitalisation, water management and (cyber) security. TPM does this with its excellent education and research at the intersection of technology, society and policy. We combine insights from both engineering and social sciences as well as the humanities. TPM develops robust models and designs, is internationally oriented and has an extensive network of knowledge institutions, companies, social organisations and governments.

items.description_zh:
加入我们的 ERC SPHINX 团队，模拟气候风险如何影响房地产市场。帮助发现房屋何时成为搁浅资产并加剧系统性影响。帮助制定适应气候变化的政策！
职位描述
这个为期 4 年的全额资助博士职位是 ERC Consolidator 项目“复杂适应性经济中的系统性物理气候风险”(SPHINX) 的一部分。 SPHINX 研究计划的实现得益于欧洲研究委员会 200 万欧元的资助。
背景：
在全球范围内，气候变化已经通过物理风险显现出来——洪水、风暴、野火、热浪、干旱和海平面上升造成的损害。人们越来越担心，当某一要素的局部损害无法得到遏制并对整个社会经济体系产生不利影响时，这些风险可能会变得系统性。通常，物理气候风险评估涵盖灾害概率、暴露度和脆弱性。这些未来损害估计线性推断历史数据，假设市场有效地利用有关气候风险的完整信息并逐步调整，经济参与者具有完美的未来洞察力，社会经济系统将像过去一样对前所未有的气候引发的灾害做出反应并定价。这种方法受到批评，因为它低估了气候变化的真实成本（例如，即使在严峻的情况下，GDP 损失也仅为 1-3%），阻碍了气候行动。相比之下，系统性风险的分析包括要素/因素之间复杂的相互作用、调整预期、传染动力学机制、反馈和非线性提示。 SPHINX研究计划旨在从根本上推进模拟方法并整合新数据，以了解系统性物理气候风险如何在社会经济系统中出现，并探索遏制其不断上升的成本的策略。该项目重点关注欧洲，对三个选定的案例研究地区进行了详细分析。从方法上讲，SPHINX 拥有五个支柱，从数据收集到基于代理和可计算的一般均衡建模，由五名团队成员领导。前三个支柱涉及基于计算代理的模型的开发，以探索风险传播的三种不同渠道，重点关注系统性风险的触发因素。目前的博士职位旨在推进对政府实际气候风险的评估，包括气候适应资金分配中道德风险和不平等的出现，以及对其预算的附带损害。
职位描述：
成功的候选人将在 SPHINX 研究团队中工作，探索政府如何在经济发展目标与适应加速的自然气候风险之间取得平衡，因为家庭选民根据他们对公共适应的偏好来决定居住在哪里。为了探讨气候变化风险下政府出现的道德风险和财政压力，候选人将开发一个基于蒂博特理论并由数据支持的基于代理的模型，包括公众分配适应资金偏好的数据。在这个为期四年的项目中，博士生将利用经济研究的最新进展，研究政府债务和附带财政损失的变化，以及面临不断升级的气候风险的政府的道德风险和信用丧失的实例。在基于代理的模型中，将政府相互依赖的提供和资助公共适应的决策与不同私人参与者的位置选择联系起来至关重要。这项建模工作将受益于通过定制的家庭和公司调查（由另一名团队成员进行）得出的预期行为数据以及其他空间和物理气候风险数据。这种基于主体的模型的目标是确定风险传染导致区域衰退的条件，以及不平等变化的根源，具体取决于地方政府如何根据家庭的偏好以及是否有足够的基于税收的政府预算来决定公共适应措施的水平。
TU Delft（代尔夫特理工大学）
代尔夫特理工大学有着坚实的基础。作为举世闻名的荷兰水厂的创建者和生物技术的先驱，代尔夫特理工大学是一所集科学、工程和设计于一体的顶尖国际大学。它在教育、研究和创新方面提供世界一流的成果，以应对能源、气候、流动性、健康和数字社会领域的挑战。几代人以来，我们的工程师已被证明是商业和社会环境中的企业家问题解决者。
在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们的核心之一
价值观
并且我们积极地
参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们重视不同的观点和品质。我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同想象、发明和创造利用技术对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平的考虑。
挑战。改变。影响
技术、政策与管理学院
TPM 学院为解决能源转型、流动性、数字化、水管理和（网络）安全等复杂的技术社会问题做出了重要贡献。 TPM 凭借其在技术、社会和政策交叉领域的出色教育和研究做到了这一点。我们结合了工程、社会科学以及人文学科的见解。 TPM 开发稳健的模型和设计，面向国际，并拥有广泛的知识机构、公司、社会组织和政府网络。

raw_payload.title: PhD Position Systemic Physical Risk for Governments and Collateral Fiscal Damage
raw_payload.description:
Join our ERC SPHINX Team to model how climate risks ripple through housing markets. Help uncover when homes become stranded assets and fuel systemic impacts. Help shaping climate resilient policies!

Job description
This 4-year fully funded PhD position is part of the ERC Consolidator project “Systemic physical climate risk in complex adaptive economies” (SPHINX). The SPHINX-research program is made possible thanks to a 2-million-euro grant from the European Research Council.

Background:

Globally, climate change already manifests via physical risks – damages from floods, storms, wildfires, heatwaves, droughts, and sea-level rise. Concerns are rising that these risks may become systemic, when local damages to one element cannot be contained and adversely affect the entire socio-economic system. Usually, physical climate risk assessments overlay hazard probability, exposure and vulnerability. These future damage estimates linearly extrapolate historic data, assuming that markets efficiently capitalize full information about climate risks and adjust gradually, economic actors have perfect future insight, and socio-economic systems will react to and price unprecedented climate-induced hazards as they did in the past. This approach is criticized for underestimating the true costs of climate change (e.g., at just 1-3% of GDP loss even under severe scenarios), impeding climate action. In contrast, analysis of systemic risks embraces complex interactions among elements/agents, adjusting expectations, mechanisms of contagion dynamics, feedbacks, and non-linear tipping. The SPHINX research program aims to fundamentally advance simulation methods and consolidate novel data to understand how systemic physical climate risks emerge in the socio-economic system, and to explore strategies to curtail their spiraling costs. The project focuses on Europe, with a detailed analysis of three selected case-study regions. Methodologically, SPHINX embraces five pillars, ranging from data collection to agent-based and computable general equilibrium modeling, led by five team members. The first three pillars concern the development of computational agent-based models to explore three different channels of risk propagation with a focus on the triggers of systemic risks. The current PhD position aims to advance assessments of physical climate risks for governments, including the emergence of moral hazard and inequality in the allocation of climate adaptation funding, as well as collateral damage to their budgets.

Job description:

The successful candidate will work within the SPHINX research team to explore how governments balance economic development objectives with adaptation to accelerating physical climate risks, as households-voters decide where to live given their preferences for public adaptation. To explore the emergence of moral hazard and fiscal strain for governments under shifting climate risks, the candidate will develop an agent-based model grounded in the Tiebout theory and supported by data, including data on public preferences for allocating adaptation funds. During this 4-year-long project, the PhD student will build on the latest progress in economic research on changes in governmental debt and collateral fiscal damages, and instances of moral hazard and loss of creditworthiness for governments facing escalating climate risks. Connecting the mutually dependent decisions of governments to provide and fund public adaptation, and the location choices of diverse private actors in an agent-based model will be essential here. This modeling effort will benefit from the behavioral data on expectations elicited via tailored household and firm surveys (carried out by another team member) and other spatial and physical climate risk data. The goal of this agent-based modeling is to identify conditions under which risk contagion causes regional decline, and the roots of changing inequality based on how local governments decide on the level of public adaptation provision contingent on both households’ preferences for it and the availability of sufficient tax-based governmental budgets to afford it.

Job requirements
A candidate should ideally have:
  • MSc in Environmental Economics, Spatial Economics, Computational Science, Geography, Environmental Studies, or Engineering & Policy Analysis;
  • Knowledge of a programming language (Python, Julia, etc) and training in any of the simulation methods;
  • Experience with (statistical) data analysis;
  • Previous experience with agent-based modeling or any type of spatial modeling is beneficial;
  • Ability to work with spatial data/GIS is an asset;
  • Domain knowledge in the field of coupled social-environmental systems, climate change or global environmental change in general is an advantage;
  • Solid problem-solving skills and capacity to take the initiative;
  • fluent written and spoken English. For more details, please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements: https://www.tudelft.nl/onderwijs/opleidingen/phd/admission. Dutch is not obligatory; TU Delft offers opportunities to learn the language if desired

TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)
Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.

At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.

Challenge. Change. Impact

Faculty Technology, Policy & Management
The Faculty of TPM provides an important contribution to solving complex technical-social issues, such as energy transition, mobility, digitalisation, water management and (cyber) security. TPM does this with its excellent education and research at the intersection of technology, society and policy. We combine insights from both engineering and social sciences as well as the humanities. TPM develops robust models and designs, is internationally oriented and has an extensive network of knowledge institutions, companies, social organisations and governments.

Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Technology, Policy and Management.

Conditions of employment
Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.

Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, increasing from €3059 - €3881 gross per month, from the first year to the fourth year based on a fulltime contract (38 hours), plus 8% holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%.

As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills.

The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.

Will you need to relocate to the Netherlands for this job? TU Delft is committed to make your move as smooth as possible! The HR unit, Coming to Delft Service, offers information on their website to help you prepare your relocation. In addition, Coming to Delft Service organises events to help you settle in the Netherlands, and expand your (social) network in Delft. A Dual Career Programme is available, to support your accompanying partner with their job search in the Netherlands.

Additional information
For more information about this position, please contact: Prof Dr. T.Filatova, e-mail: t.filatova@tudelft.nl, web: https://www.sc3.center/.

Application procedure
Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply no later than 23 November 2025 via the application button and upload the following documents:
  • Your motivation letter.
  • Your CV.
  • A list of publications or software outputs (if applicable).
  • The contact details of 2 referees.

You can address your application to Prof Dr. T.Filatova.

Please only use the online system to apply; applications sent by email will not be considered.

Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.

Please note:
  • You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
  • As part of knowledge security, TU Delft conducts a risk assessment during the recruitment of personnel. We do this, among other things, to prevent the unwanted transfer of sensitive knowledge and technology. The assessment is based on information provided by the candidates themselves, such as their motivation letter and CV, and takes place at the final stages of the selection process. When the outcome of the assessment is negative, the candidate will be informed. The processing of personal data in the context of the risk assessment is carried out on the legal basis of the GDPR: performing a public task in the public interest. You can find more information about this assessment on our website about knowledge security.
  • Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.

items.title_en: PhD Toekomstbestendige Organisatie van Zorgzame Buurten
items.title_zh: 博士 面向未来的关怀社区组织
items.description_en:
Heb jij een master in de sociale wetenschappen afgerond? En wil jij bijdragen aan de organisatie van zorgzame buurten zodat de zorg toekomstbestendig wordt? En zou je graag willen promoveren op een plek waar actuele zorgvraagstukken, wetenschappelijk onderzoek en een internationaal kennisnetwerk samenkomen? Bij de vakgroep Healthcare Governance (HCG) van Erasmus School of Health Policy & Management (ESHPM) zijn wij op zoek naar een gemotiveerde en enthousiaste promovendus die etnografisch actieonderzoek wil doen naar samenwerking tussen verschillende publieke organisaties, tech bedrijven, mantelzorgers en ouderen met als gemeenschappelijke uitdaging: hoe maken we samenredzame buurten van de toekomst met behulp van nieuwe zorgrelaties tussen professionals, ouderen en familie, met oog voor waarden en met passende inzet van technologie?
Projectbeschrijving
De Nederlandse gezondheidszorg staat voor grote uitdagingen door de snel vergrijzende bevolking. Deze demografische verschuiving zorgt voor een toenemende zorgvraag en druk op professionele zorgverlening. Om de druk op deze formele zorg te verlichten, pleit de Nederlandse overheid voor een maatschappelijke transitie van ‘ouderenzorg’ naar ‘zorg voor ouderen’. Hierin worden ouderen gestimuleerd om zo lang mogelijk thuis te wonen en zorg in hun eigen omgeving te ontvangen, ondersteund door een actievere rol voor mantelzorgers. Hoewel de noodzaak van deze transitie door veel partijen wordt erkend, brengt deze ook grote uitdagingen met zich mee. Veel mantelzorgers staan namelijk nu al voor enorme lasten, vaak in combinatie met werk en andere verplichtingen.
In hun zoektocht naar oplossingen brengen politici, beleidsmakers en zorgorganisaties twee verschillende richtingen naar voren. De eerste richting is het versterken van
samenredzaamheid
. Het centrale idee achter samenredzaamheid is het faciliteren van thuis wonen door middel van nieuwe (informele) zorgnetwerken, waarin zorgverlening als een collectieve inspanning wordt gezien, die is gebaseerd op ondersteuning binnen gemeenschappen. De tweede richting is
technologische innovatie
als middel om zelfredzaamheid te bevorderen. Technologie en digitalisering worden gezien als cruciale instrumenten om de ouderenzorg duurzaam te houden, taken te automatiseren die traditioneel door formele zorgverleners worden uitgevoerd en ziekenhuisbezoeken te verminderen.
Hoewel samenredzaamheid en technologische innovatie beide gericht zijn op het aanpakken van dezelfde crisis, worden ze grotendeels los van elkaar nagestreefd. In de ontwikkeling van technologie is daardoor vaak weinig oog voor de rol van (informele) zorggemeenschappen, terwijl beleids- en buurtinitiatieven op het terrein van samenredzaamheid vaak weinig aandacht hebben voor mogelijke manieren waarop technologie dit soort initiatieven zou kunnen ondersteunen. Een belangrijke reden hiervoor is dat deze twee oplossingsrichtingen lijken te vertrekken vanuit verschillende onderliggende
waarden
. Zo richt veel technologie zich op efficiëntie en optimalisatie van processen, terwijl initiatieven op het terrein van samenredzaamheid juist relationele verbondenheid hoog in het vaandel hebben staan. Het gevolg is dat veel technologische innovaties op weerstand stuiten, beperkte acceptatie en moeizame inbedding in informele praktijken van zorgverlening, terwijl initiatieven gericht op samenredzaamheid technologische oplossingen niet benutten. Kortom: technologische innovaties passen vaak niet vanzelf in de sociale praktijken van informele netwerken terwijl omgekeerd deze initiatieven de meerwaarde van technologie niet zondermeer zien of omarmen.
Wat ga je doen?
Als promovendus voer je etnografisch actieonderzoek uit naar een complex en actueel publiek vraagstuk dat in heel Nederland speelt: hoe kunnen verschillende organisaties samenwerken aan een duurzame organisatie van samenredzame buurten waarbij de inzet van technologie goed aansluit bij waarden van ouderen die langer thuis wonen? Partijen die aan je onderzoek meewerken zijn o.a. ouderenorganisaties, verzekeraars, mantelzorgorganisaties, welzijnsinstanties en gemeenten. Zij geven ieder een eigen invulling aan samenredzaamheid en de inzet van technologie thuis. En zij hebben vaak verschillende waarden en belangen die soms botsen in de samenwerking. Deze waardencomplexiteit is het centrale uitgangspunt van het onderzoek en ligt ten grondslag aan de centrale onderzoeksvraag: welke verschillende waarden prioriteren actoren in de samenwerking rondom samenredzame buurten & de inzet van technologie (zoals thuismonitoring maar ook burenapps voor onderling contact)?
Je brengt niet alleen in kaart welke waardencomplexiteit en conflicten er onderling spelen, maar je doet ook zelf actieonderzoek. Je koppelt relevante inzichten terug aan organisaties, je geeft advies en organiseert workshops. Je onderzoek vertaalt zich zo naar directe maatschappelijke impact. Je draagt bij aan vragen als: hoe kunnen we het beste omgaan met waardenconflicten in de samenwerking? Welke organisatorische randvoorwaarden zijn nodig voor zorgzame buurten van de toekomst? Wat vraagt dit van het zorgsysteem? Je onderzoek heeft daarmee een etnografisch, actiegerichte focus, waarbij samen leren en experimenteren met verschillende organisaties centraal staat.
Je werkt mee aan het door NWO gefinancierde project
CARE VISiON (Collaborative Approaches to Reimagining Elder Care: Values-driven Innovations in Samenredzaamheid for Older adults in the Netherlands)
en maakt deel uit van een geïntegreerd team bestaande uit vier promovendi en twee postdocs. Je empirisch onderzoek levert kritische input voor de ontwikkeling van een interdisciplinair conceptueel kader en een transdisciplinaire visie en tools voor productieve waardenafstemming.
Je gaat werken in de sectie Healthcare Governance van de Erasmus School of Health Policy & Management (ESHPM), een actieve groep van (PhD-)onderzoekers die vanuit verschillende disciplines empirisch onderzoek uitvoeren naar sturings- en beleidsvraagstukken in de zorg. Daarnaast is er een nauwe samenwerking met de Erasmus School of Social & Behavioral Sciences, in het bijzonder de Erasmus Social Design Hub, met veel expertise op het gebied van ontwerpgericht sociaal-wetenschappelijk onderzoek rond maatschappelijke vraagstukken.
Begeleiding
Het begeleidingsteam bestaat uit dr. Lieke Oldenhof (Healthcare Governance, ESHPM), dr. Rik Wehrens (Healthcare Governance, ESHPM) en prof. Arwin van Buuren (ESSB).

。共同依赖背后的中心思想是通过新的（非正式）护理网络促进家庭生活，其中护理提供被视为基于社区内支持的集体努力。第二个方向是
技术创新
作为促进自力更生的手段。技术和数字化被视为保持老年人护理可持续、自动化传统上由正式护理人员执行的任务以及减少医院就诊的重要工具。
尽管相互依赖和技术创新都旨在解决同一危机，但它们在很大程度上是分开追求的。因此，技术的发展往往很少关注（非正式）护理社区的作用，而相互依赖领域的政策和社区举措往往很少关注技术支持此类举措的可能方式。造成这种情况的一个重要原因是，这两种解决方案似乎是从不同的底层原理出发的
价值观
。例如，许多技术注重流程的效率和优化，而相互依赖领域的举措则非常重视关系连接。结果是，许多技术创新在嵌入非正式护理提供实践方面遇到阻力、接受度有限和困难，而旨在相互依赖的举措并未利用技术解决方案。简而言之：技术创新往往不会自动融入非正式网络的社会实践，相反，这些举措也不会自动看到或接受技术的附加值。
你会怎样做？
作为一名博士候选人，您对荷兰各地发生的一个复杂且当前的公共问题进行人种学行动研究：不同的组织如何共同努力建立一个可持续的合作社区组织，使技术的使用与在家居住时间较长的老年人的价值观相契合？参与您的研究的各方包括老年人组织、保险公司、非正式护理组织、福利当局和市政当局。他们每个人对相互依赖和国内技术的使用都有自己的解释。而且他们往往有不同的价值观和利益，有时在合作中会发生冲突。这种价值复杂性是研究的核心起点，也是中心研究问题的基础：参与者在围绕协作社区和技术使用（例如家庭监控以及用于相互联系的邻居应用程序）的协作中优先考虑哪些不同的价值观？
您不仅要弄清楚正在发挥作用的价值复杂性和冲突，而且还要自己进行行动研究。您向组织提供相关见解、提供建议并组织研讨会。因此，您的研究会转化为直接的社会影响。您提出了以下问题：我们如何才能最好地处理合作中的价值冲突？关爱未来社区需要哪些组织先决条件？这对医疗保健系统有何要求？因此，您的研究具有人种学、以行动为导向的重点，其中与不同组织一起学习和实验是核心。
您参与 NWO 资助的项目
CARE VISION（重新构想老年人护理的协作方法：荷兰老年人合作中价值驱动的创新）
是由四名博士生和两名博士后组成的综合团队的一部分。您的实证研究为跨学科概念框架和跨学科愿景以及生产价值协调工具的发展提供了关键的投入。
您将在伊拉斯谟健康政策与管理学院 (ESHPM) 的医疗保健治理部门工作，该部门是一个活跃的（博士）研究人员小组，他们对医疗保健的管理和政策问题进行不同学科的实证研究。此外，还与伊拉斯谟社会与行为科学学院密切合作，特别是伊拉斯谟社会设计中心，在以设计为导向的社会问题社会科学研究领域拥有丰富的专业知识。
指导
指导团队由 Lieke Oldenhof 博士（医疗保健治理，ESHPM）、Rik Wehrens 博士（医疗保健治理，ESHPM）和 Arwin van Buuren 教授（ESSB）组成。

raw_payload.title: PhD Toekomstbestendige Organisatie van Zorgzame Buurten
raw_payload.description:
Heb jij een master in de sociale wetenschappen afgerond? En wil jij bijdragen aan de organisatie van zorgzame buurten zodat de zorg toekomstbestendig wordt? En zou je graag willen promoveren op een plek waar actuele zorgvraagstukken, wetenschappelijk onderzoek en een internationaal kennisnetwerk samenkomen? Bij de vakgroep Healthcare Governance (HCG) van Erasmus School of Health Policy & Management (ESHPM) zijn wij op zoek naar een gemotiveerde en enthousiaste promovendus die etnografisch actieonderzoek wil doen naar samenwerking tussen verschillende publieke organisaties, tech bedrijven, mantelzorgers en ouderen met als gemeenschappelijke uitdaging: hoe maken we samenredzame buurten van de toekomst met behulp van nieuwe zorgrelaties tussen professionals, ouderen en familie, met oog voor waarden en met passende inzet van technologie?

Projectbeschrijving
De Nederlandse gezondheidszorg staat voor grote uitdagingen door de snel vergrijzende bevolking. Deze demografische verschuiving zorgt voor een toenemende zorgvraag en druk op professionele zorgverlening. Om de druk op deze formele zorg te verlichten, pleit de Nederlandse overheid voor een maatschappelijke transitie van ‘ouderenzorg’ naar ‘zorg voor ouderen’. Hierin worden ouderen gestimuleerd om zo lang mogelijk thuis te wonen en zorg in hun eigen omgeving te ontvangen, ondersteund door een actievere rol voor mantelzorgers. Hoewel de noodzaak van deze transitie door veel partijen wordt erkend, brengt deze ook grote uitdagingen met zich mee. Veel mantelzorgers staan namelijk nu al voor enorme lasten, vaak in combinatie met werk en andere verplichtingen.

In hun zoektocht naar oplossingen brengen politici, beleidsmakers en zorgorganisaties twee verschillende richtingen naar voren. De eerste richting is het versterken van samenredzaamheid. Het centrale idee achter samenredzaamheid is het faciliteren van thuis wonen door middel van nieuwe (informele) zorgnetwerken, waarin zorgverlening als een collectieve inspanning wordt gezien, die is gebaseerd op ondersteuning binnen gemeenschappen. De tweede richting is technologische innovatie als middel om zelfredzaamheid te bevorderen. Technologie en digitalisering worden gezien als cruciale instrumenten om de ouderenzorg duurzaam te houden, taken te automatiseren die traditioneel door formele zorgverleners worden uitgevoerd en ziekenhuisbezoeken te verminderen.

Hoewel samenredzaamheid en technologische innovatie beide gericht zijn op het aanpakken van dezelfde crisis, worden ze grotendeels los van elkaar nagestreefd. In de ontwikkeling van technologie is daardoor vaak weinig oog voor de rol van (informele) zorggemeenschappen, terwijl beleids- en buurtinitiatieven op het terrein van samenredzaamheid vaak weinig aandacht hebben voor mogelijke manieren waarop technologie dit soort initiatieven zou kunnen ondersteunen. Een belangrijke reden hiervoor is dat deze twee oplossingsrichtingen lijken te vertrekken vanuit verschillende onderliggende waarden. Zo richt veel technologie zich op efficiëntie en optimalisatie van processen, terwijl initiatieven op het terrein van samenredzaamheid juist relationele verbondenheid hoog in het vaandel hebben staan. Het gevolg is dat veel technologische innovaties op weerstand stuiten, beperkte acceptatie en moeizame inbedding in informele praktijken van zorgverlening, terwijl initiatieven gericht op samenredzaamheid technologische oplossingen niet benutten. Kortom: technologische innovaties passen vaak niet vanzelf in de sociale praktijken van informele netwerken terwijl omgekeerd deze initiatieven de meerwaarde van technologie niet zondermeer zien of omarmen.

Wat ga je doen?
Als promovendus voer je etnografisch actieonderzoek uit naar een complex en actueel publiek vraagstuk dat in heel Nederland speelt: hoe kunnen verschillende organisaties samenwerken aan een duurzame organisatie van samenredzame buurten waarbij de inzet van technologie goed aansluit bij waarden van ouderen die langer thuis wonen? Partijen die aan je onderzoek meewerken zijn o.a. ouderenorganisaties, verzekeraars, mantelzorgorganisaties, welzijnsinstanties en gemeenten. Zij geven ieder een eigen invulling aan samenredzaamheid en de inzet van technologie thuis. En zij hebben vaak verschillende waarden en belangen die soms botsen in de samenwerking. Deze waardencomplexiteit is het centrale uitgangspunt van het onderzoek en ligt ten grondslag aan de centrale onderzoeksvraag: welke verschillende waarden prioriteren actoren in de samenwerking rondom samenredzame buurten & de inzet van technologie (zoals thuismonitoring maar ook burenapps voor onderling contact)?

Je brengt niet alleen in kaart welke waardencomplexiteit en conflicten er onderling spelen, maar je doet ook zelf actieonderzoek. Je koppelt relevante inzichten terug aan organisaties, je geeft advies en organiseert workshops. Je onderzoek vertaalt zich zo naar directe maatschappelijke impact. Je draagt bij aan vragen als: hoe kunnen we het beste omgaan met waardenconflicten in de samenwerking? Welke organisatorische randvoorwaarden zijn nodig voor zorgzame buurten van de toekomst? Wat vraagt dit van het zorgsysteem? Je onderzoek heeft daarmee een etnografisch, actiegerichte focus, waarbij samen leren en experimenteren met verschillende organisaties centraal staat.

Je werkt mee aan het door NWO gefinancierde project CARE VISiON (Collaborative Approaches to Reimagining Elder Care: Values-driven Innovations in Samenredzaamheid for Older adults in the Netherlands) en maakt deel uit van een geïntegreerd team bestaande uit vier promovendi en twee postdocs. Je empirisch onderzoek levert kritische input voor de ontwikkeling van een interdisciplinair conceptueel kader en een transdisciplinaire visie en tools voor productieve waardenafstemming.

Je gaat werken in de sectie Healthcare Governance van de Erasmus School of Health Policy & Management (ESHPM), een actieve groep van (PhD-)onderzoekers die vanuit verschillende disciplines empirisch onderzoek uitvoeren naar sturings- en beleidsvraagstukken in de zorg. Daarnaast is er een nauwe samenwerking met de Erasmus School of Social & Behavioral Sciences, in het bijzonder de Erasmus Social Design Hub, met veel expertise op het gebied van ontwerpgericht sociaal-wetenschappelijk onderzoek rond maatschappelijke vraagstukken.

Begeleiding
Het begeleidingsteam bestaat uit dr. Lieke Oldenhof (Healthcare Governance, ESHPM), dr. Rik Wehrens (Healthcare Governance, ESHPM) en prof. Arwin van Buuren (ESSB).

items.title_en: PhD candidate 'Digital Biomarkers for Atypical Parkinsonism based on Continuous, Real-world Monitoring'
items.title_zh: 博士生“基于连续、真实世界监测的非典型帕金森病数字生物标志物”
items.description_en:
Do you have what it takes to combine AI and clinical research? Are you motivated to contribute to the development of new therapies for people living with atypical parkinsonism? We are looking for a talented and versatile PhD student to develop digital biomarkers from continuous, real-world sensor data.
Progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP) is a form of atypical parkinsonism characterized by its highly progressive and thereby extremely debilitating nature for affected patients and their families. Novel therapies are being developed to halt the underlying neurodegeneration. However, testing their efficacy is hampered by the lack of objective and sensitive outcome measures.
At the Center of Expertise for Parkinson and Movement Disorders, we have conducted a unique PSP cohort study with long-term, continuous collection of wearable sensor data in daily life. Working together with AI experts, you will develop models to extract insights into the progression of key PSP symptoms, based on high-frequency movement and heart-rate signals. Through collaboration with clinical experts, you will integrate clinical knowledge and combine the developed digital biomarkers with clinical and biomarker data. In addition, you will work towards concrete applications by providing sensitive outcomes for clinical trials aiming to halt the underlying neurodegeneration. Together, by enabling reliable, real-life monitoring of PSP, this PhD project has the potential to significantly advance our understanding of PSP progression, and to transform the way we assess patients in clinical trials and care.
Your everyday interactions will be with fellow PhD students from
the AI for Parkinson Lab
, a multidisciplinary research group focused on AI-based, real-life monitoring of parkinson signs. The lab is part of the internationally recognized Radboudumc Center of Expertise for Parkinson & Movement Disorders. Your PhD project will be supervised by Dr. Luc Evers and Prof. Bas Bloem. In addition, you will have the opportunity to gain valuable experience with our industry partners, for example pharmaceutical companies interested in integrating new digital outcomes into clinical trials.
You will:
- design and conduct scientific research in a stimulating, interdisciplinary environment.
- develop and validate machine learning models to extract digital biomarkers for atypical parkinsonism from real-world wearable sensor data.
- interpret findings in close collaboration with clinical and AI experts.
- work towards concrete applications in clinical trials aiming to halt the underlying neurodegeneration.
- present results at scientific conferences and in peer-reviewed publications.
- make the developed tools available for the community in line with open science principles.
- contribute to knowledge transfer by supervising student internships.
- follow relevant courses at the Radboudumc, Radboud University and Donders Graduate School.
- finalize the project with a PhD thesis.
items.description_zh:
您有能力将人工智能与临床研究结合起来吗？您是否有动力为非典型帕金森病患者开发新疗法做出贡献？我们正在寻找一位才华横溢、多才多艺的博士生，以根据连续的真实传感器数据开发数字生物标记。
进行性核上性麻痹 (PSP) 是非典型帕金森病的一种形式，其特点是高度进行性，因此对受影响的患者及其家人来说极其虚弱。正在开发新的疗法来阻止潜在的神经变性。然而，由于缺乏客观和敏感的结果衡量标准，测试其功效受到阻碍。
在帕金森和运动障碍专业中心，我们进行了一项独特的 PSP 队列研究，长期、连续地收集日常生活中的可穿戴传感器数据。您将与 AI 专家合作，开发模型，根据高频运动和心率信号深入了解关键 PSP 症状的进展。通过与临床专家合作，您将整合临床知识，并将开发的数字生物标志物与临床和生物标志物数据相结合。此外，您将通过为旨在阻止潜在神经退行性变的临床试验提供敏感结果来致力于具体应用。总之，通过对 PSP 进行可靠、真实的监测，这个博士项目有可能显着增进我们对 PSP 进展的理解，并改变我们在临床试验和护理中评估患者的方式。
您的日常互动将是与来自以下国家的博士生进行互动：
帕金森实验室的人工智能
是一个多学科研究小组，专注于基于人工智能的帕金森症状现实生活监测。该实验室是国际公认的拉德布杜姆帕金森和运动障碍专业中心的一部分。您的博士项目将由 Luc Evers 博士和 Bas Bloem 教授指导。此外，您将有机会与我们的行业合作伙伴一起获得宝贵的经验，例如有兴趣将新的数字结果整合到临床试验中的制药公司。
您将：
- 在刺激的跨学科环境中设计和开展科学研究。
- 开发和验证机器学习模型，从现实世界的可穿戴传感器数据中提取非典型帕金森病的数字生物标记。
- 与临床和人工智能专家密切合作解释研究结果。
- 致力于临床试验中的具体应用，旨在阻止潜在的神经变性。
- 在科学会议和同行评审出版物中展示结果。
- 根据开放科学原则，向社区提供开发的工具。
- 通过监督学生实习来促进知识转移。
- 学习 Radboudumc、Radboud University 和 Donders 研究生院的相关课程。
- 通过博士论文完成该项目。

items.title_en: PhD in Reconfigurable & Spatial Accelerators for heterogeneous ICT systems
items.title_zh: 异构 ICT 系统可重构和空间加速器博士
items.description_en:
Our research team invites applications for a fully-funded PhD position at the intersection of
reconfigurable computing, accelerators
, and
simulation tools.
This position aims to investigate strategies for programming, modeling, and integrating reconfigurable/spatial architectures, such as FPGAs and ML accelerators, within heterogeneous ICT ecosystems.
Reconfigurable and Spatial hardware, such as FPGAs, CGRAs, and many Machine Learning accelerators, offer significant opportunities for improving performance and energy efficiency compared to traditional CPUs/GPUs. Yet, porting and optimizing code for these architectures remains a key challenge. This project will explore how reconfigurable/spatial computing devices can be integrated into
large-scale heterogeneous infrastructures
, which include CPUs, GPUs, DPUs, and others. The research will focus on productive tools for easier development of spatial accelerator-friendly applications and on addressing the complexity of the
modeling and simulation tools
.
Your responsibilities
As a PhD student, you will develop and lead original research within the broad theme of reconfigurable and spatial computing. Your work will combine theoretical investigation, software design and development, and experimental validation. Specifically, you will:
- Identify and characterize kernels and application domains that benefit from reconfigurable/spatial devices, build microbenchmarks and performance/energy models.
- Investigate what techniques and abstractions are most effective for designing and optimizing applications for Spatial Devices (HW/SW co-design).
- Develop and extend simulation or modeling frameworks to support systematic exploration of mapping and scheduling strategies across CPUs, GPUs, DPUs, and reconfigurable/spatial devices.
- Demonstrate seamless deployment of hybrid workflows in large‑scale, heterogeneous infrastructures.
As part of this position, you will be encouraged and supported to define and drive your own research directions within the project scope, publish and present your findings at top-tier systems and HPC venues, develop and maintain open-source software, contribute to teaching and community outreach, and be involved in an industrial/academic consortium (the FNS 6G project). The ultimate goal is for the successful candidate to produce a dissertation leading to a PhD degree after 4 years.

与传统 CPU/GPU 相比，可重构和空间硬件（例如 FPGA、CGRA 和许多机器学习加速器）为提高性能和能源效率提供了重要机会。然而，移植和优化这些架构的代码仍然是一个关键挑战。该项目将探索如何将可重构/空间计算设备集成到

  • Demonstrate seamless deployment of hybrid workflows in large‑scale, heterogeneous infrastructures.

As part of this position, you will be encouraged and supported to define and drive your own research directions within the project scope, publish and present your findings at top-tier systems and HPC venues, develop and maintain open-source software, contribute to teaching and community outreach, and be involved in an industrial/academic consortium (the FNS 6G project). The ultimate goal is for the successful candidate to produce a dissertation leading to a PhD degree after 4 years.

items.title_en: PhD in A Resilience-Oriented Approach for Multi-Commodity Positive Energy Districts Operation
items.title_zh: 多商品正能量区运营的弹性导向方法博士
items.description_en:
Do you want to be part of a large scale national project and work on multi-commodity energy districts?
The envisioned research is part of the research program Intelligent Energy Systems (IES) performed within the Electrical Energy Systems (EES) group of TU/e. Within the IES program, research is conducted into operation and planning of future sustainable energy systems, with an emphasis on electricity systems, markets and systems integration. This research is performed in two research labs: the Digital power and energy systems lab (EES DigiPES lab) and the Electricity markets and power system optimization lab (EES EMPDO lab). The former focuses on intelligent energy network research, including: demand management and flexibility, digital twinning, data analytics, smart grid ICT architectures and systems integration in multi energy systems. The latter specializes in electricity market design (centralized & decentralized), market products & system services to integrate new technologies, forecasting, market participation strategies and risk management, large-scale, distributed, multi-objective optimization techniques applied to energy markets and power systems and AI for optimization and control in power and energy systems. The EES group has strong ties with industry both nationally and internationally, with several part-time industry researchers working in the group and a large group of strategic collaboration partners.
Recently, the Electrical Energy Systems group received grants for nationally-funded projects in Intelligent Electricity Systems. Therefore, this group currently has multiple vacancies in this field.
We are currently looking for researchers with strong energy systems knowledge, electricity, heat, and gas netwrok modelling & simulation, and research software development skills
that want to develop cutting-edge knowledge and software for the
energy transition. The focus of the work will be on the application of intelligent software approaches (distributed control systems, distributed optimization, market mechanisms, multi-scale modelling, etc.), in electrical power systems (energy system flexibility coordination, local energy markets, capacity & congestion management, etc.).
Information
The transition to sustainable urban energy systems is a cornerstone of climate-neutral cities. Positive Energy Districts (PEDs) are emerging as a key concept in this transition, aiming to produce more energy than they consume on an annual basis. However, the operation of PEDs is increasingly complex due to the integration of multiple energy vectors (electricity, heating, gas, water, etc.), the variability of renewable energy sources, and the need for real-time coordination among distributed assets.
Resilience —the ability of a system to anticipate, absorb, adapt to, and rapidly recover from disruptions— is a critical yet underexplored dimension in PED operations. This research is a part of an NWO project called “Enabling Positive Energy Districs through citizen-centered socio-technical models for upscaling pf the heat transition” or EmPowerED that studies various aspects of the PEDs to deliver a theoretically informed and empirically validated scalable integrated systems co-creation approach for carbon-neutral heating that can be tailored to the specific local PED context. This PhD is part of the technical study and modelling of the project that needs to focus on a resilience-oriented operational framework for multi-commodity PEDs, addressing both steady-state optimization and dynamic response to disturbances. EmPowerED is a large project with around 38 partners including different universities, research institutes, municipalities, energy communities, distribution system operators, and technology providers. The student will have the opportunity to be a part of this project and participate in project meetings, contribute to the discussion with the end-users, energy communities, and municipalities. There would be close collaboration between the PhD students in this project and the technology providers as the outcomes of the PhD studies could be incorporated into their commercial solutions.
Current PED operational strategies often prioritize energy efficiency and carbon neutrality but lack mechanisms to ensure resilience against disruptions such as grid outages, extreme weather events, or cyber-physical attacks. Moreover, the multi-commodity nature of PEDs introduces interdependencies that can amplify vulnerabilities. Although the congestion management is and remains one of the main concerns for the stakeholders involved in PEDs, there are further research questions that come to mind when the multi-energy aspect of PEDs is considered:
- How can resilience be quantitatively assessed in the context of multi-commodity PEDs?
- What operational strategies can enhance the resilience of PEDs without compromising energy positivity?
- How do interdependencies among energy vectors affect the propagation of disruptions?
- What are the trade-offs between resilience, efficiency, and sustainability in PED operations?
Considering the above-mentioned research questions and regarding the framework of the EmPowerED project, the objective of this PhD study is defined as follows:
- Develop a comprehensive resilience assessment framework tailored to multi-commodity PEDs, considering electricity, heating, and water drainage networks.
- Design a multi-layered operational strategy that integrates resilience metrics into energy management systems on a district level.
- Model and simulate the dynamic behavior of PEDs under various disruption scenarios, with a focus on electricity and heat networks.
- Validate the proposed approach through case studies and use cases of the project.
These goals are achieved through the implementation of a comprehensive analysis of the existing resilience metrics and operational strategies of PEDs. Various scenarios need to be created and studied for each commodity (i.e., electricity, heat, water drainage) and their interdependencies’ impact on energy management within a district while maintaining energy positivity. The use of new technologies in district heating systems (e.g., low-temperature heating) and their impact should be included in these scenarios.
Conceptual framework development requires establishing resilience indicators for PEDs as well as defining its dimensions considering the interdependence among various networks. The scenarios and the developed concept need to be modelled and simulated for each energy carrier flow, following an optimization problem incorporating resilience techniques. A digital twin of PED needs to be developed integrating real data (where available) and the analysed scenarios. AI models for predictive resilience assessment should be developed and tested. The results of this simulation and modelling can be integrated within the commercial interfaces of the project for the end users involved in the project.
The position is supervised by dr.ir. N. Neyestani and prof.dr. J.K. Kok.
items.description_zh:
您想成为大型国家项目的一部分并在多商品能源区工作吗？
设想的研究是 TU/e 电能系统 (EES) 小组内进行的智能能源系统 (IES) 研究计划的一部分。 IES 计划对未来可持续能源系统的运营和规划进行研究，重点是电力系统、市场和系统集成。这项研究在两个研究实验室进行：数字电力和能源系统实验室（EES DigiPES 实验室）和电力市场和电力系统优化实验室（EES EMPDO 实验室）。前者专注于智能能源网络研究，包括：需求管理和灵活性、数字孪生、数据分析、智能电网ICT架构和多能源系统中的系统集成。后者专注于电力市场设计（集中式和分散式）、集成新技术的市场产品和系统服务、预测、市场参与策略和风险管理、应用于能源市场和电力系统的大规模、分布式、多目标优化技术以及用于电力和能源系统优化和控制的人工智能。 EES小组与国内外业界有着密切的联系，有多名兼职行业研究人员在小组工作，并拥有一大批战略合作伙伴。
最近，电能系统小组获得了国家资助的智能电力系统项目资助。因此，该集团目前在该领域有多个职位空缺。
我们目前正在寻找具有丰富能源系统知识、电力、热力和天然气网络建模与仿真以及研究软件开发技能的研究人员
想要为以下领域开发尖端知识和软件
能源转型。工作重点是智能软件方法（分布式控制系统、分布式优化、市场机制、多尺度建模等）在电力系统（能源系统灵活性协调、本地能源市场、容量和拥塞管理等）中的应用。
信息
向可持续城市能源系统的过渡是气候中和城市的基石。正能量区 (PED) 正在成为这一转型中的一个关键概念，旨在每年生产比消耗更多的能源。然而，由于多种能源载体（电、热、燃气、水等）的融合、可再生能源的可变性以及分布式资产之间实时协调的需要，PED的运行变得越来越复杂。
弹性——系统预测、吸收、适应和从中断中快速恢复的能力——是 PED 操作中一个关键但尚未充分探索的维度。这项研究是 NWO 项目的一部分，该项目名为“通过以公民为中心的社会技术模型提升热转换规模，实现正能量区域”或 EmPowerED，该项目研究 PED 的各个方面，为碳中和供暖提供理论依据和经验验证的可扩展集成系统共创方法，该方法可根据当地特定的 PED 环境进行定制。该博士学位是该项目技术研究和建模的一部分，该项目需要重点关注多商品 PED 的面向弹性的操作框架，解决稳态优化和对干扰的动态响应。 EmPowerED 是一个大型项目，拥有约 38 个合作伙伴，包括不同的大学、研究机构、市政当局、能源社区、配电系统运营商和技术提供商。学生将有机会成为该项目的一部分并参加项目会议，为与最终用户、能源社区和市政当局的讨论做出贡献。该项目的博士生和技术提供商之间将密切合作，因为博士研究的成果可以纳入他们的商业解决方案中。
目前的 PED 运营策略通常优先考虑能源效率和碳中和，但缺乏确保抵御电网中断、极端天气事件或网络物理攻击等中断的机制。此外，PED 的多商品性质引入了可能放大漏洞的相互依赖性。尽管拥堵管理仍然是 PED 利益相关者的主要关注点之一，但当考虑 PED 的多能源方面时，还会出现进一步的研究问题：
- 如何在多商品 PED 的背景下定量评估弹性？
- 哪些运营策略可以在不损害能源积极性的情况下增强 PED 的弹性？
- 能量向量之间的相互依赖性如何影响破坏的传播？
- PED 运营中的弹性、效率和可持续性之间的权衡是什么？
考虑到上述研究问题以及EmPowerED项目的框架，本次博士研究的目标定义如下：
- 制定针对多种商品 PED 的综合复原力评估框架，考虑电力、供暖和排水网络。
- 设计多层运营策略，将弹性指标集成到地区级别的能源管理系统中。
- 对 PED 在各种中断场景下的动态行为进行建模和仿真，重点关注电力和热力网络。
- 通过案例研究和项目用例验证提议的方法。
这些目标是通过对 PED 的现有弹性指标和运营策略进行全面分析来实现的。需要为每种商品（即电力、热力、排水）创建和研究各种情景及其相互依赖性对区域内能源管理的影响，同时保持能源积极性。这些情景应包括区域供热系统中新技术的使用（例如低温供暖）及其影响。
概念框架的开发需要建立 PED 的复原力指标，并考虑到不同网络之间的相互依赖关系来定义其维度。需要对每个能量载体流的场景和开发的概念进行建模和模拟，遵循结合弹性技术的优化问题。需要开发集成真实数据（如果可用）和分析场景的 PED 数字孪生。应开发和测试用于预测弹性评估的人工智能模型。该模拟和建模的结果可以集成到项目的商业界面中，供参与项目的最终用户使用。
该职位由 Dr.ir 监督。 N. Neyestani 和教授博士。 J.K.科克。

items.title_en: Promovendus onderzoek gebruik genetische data voor onderzoek, beleid en innovati
items.title_zh: 博士生研究利用遗传数据进行研究、政策和创新
items.description_en:
De Europese Health Data Space (EHDS) is erop gericht het gebruik van gezondheidsdata binnen de Europese Unie te bevorderen. Door het veilig, transparant en efficiënt beschikbaar maken en delen van gezondheidsdata voor primair en secundair gebruik wordt beoogd de kwaliteit van de zorg te verbeteren, door het bevorderen van data gedreven onderzoek, innovatie en beleid, terwijl tegelijkertijd de privacy en rechten van burgers worden beschermd. De EHDS maakt het mogelijk voor individuele lidstaten om aanvullende voorwaarden te stellen aan het beschikbaar stellen van kwetsbare gezondheidsdata, zoals genetische data. Dit is van belang omdat genetische gegevens specifieke risico’s met zich meebrengen die mogelijk worden beïnvloed door verschillen in wetgeving, praktijken en normen tussen landen. Het formuleren van aanvullende voorwaarden is dan ook van belang om een balans te vinden tussen het benutten van de waarde van genetische data voor gezondheid en innovatie en het beschermen van de rechten en het vertrouwen van burgers.
We zijn op zoek naar een enthousiaste en gemotiveerde promovendus, die met ons de uitdaging aan wil gaan om voorwaarden te formuleren voor het beschikbaar stellen van genetische data.
Wat ga je doen
Je gaat samenwerken met experts uit verschillende wetenschappelijke disciplines en van verschillende organisaties. Op basis van literatuuronderzoek en het bestuderen van de praktijk en de morele afwegingen in een aantal Nederlandse en Europese use cases waarin genetische data (zullen) worden gedeeld, ga je in kaart brengen welke voorwaarden moeten worden gesteld aan het beschikbaar maken van genetische data. Je vertaalt de opgedane kennis in je onderzoek in artikelen die je publiceert in internationale peer-reviewed tijdschriften, je presenteert deze op (inter)nationale conferenties en formuleert voorwaarden voor het verantwoord beschikbaar maken van genetische data voor onderzoek, beleid en innovatie.
items.description_zh:
欧洲健康数据空间 (EHDS) 旨在促进欧盟内部健康数据的使用。通过安全、透明、高效地提供健康数据并共享初级和次级使用，其目的是通过促进数据驱动的研究、创新和政策来提高护理质量，同时保护公民的隐私和权利。 EHDS 使各个成员国可以在提供易受攻击的健康数据（例如遗传数据）时施加附加条件。这一点很重要，因为遗传数据会带来特定的风险，这些风险可能会受到各国立法、实践和标准差异的影响。因此，制定附加条件对于在利用遗传数据促进健康和创新的价值与保护公民的权利和信任之间找到平衡非常重要。
我们正在寻找一位充满热情、积极进取的博士候选人，他希望与我们一起挑战制定提供遗传数据的条件。
你会怎样做？
您将与来自不同科学学科和不同组织的专家合作。根据文献研究以及研究许多荷兰和欧洲共享遗传数据的用例中的实践和道德考虑，您将制定出提供遗传数据所必须施加的条件。您将研究中获得的知识转化为在国际同行评审期刊上发表的文章，在（国际）国家会议上发表文章，并制定条件，使遗传数据负责任地用于研究、政策和创新。

Silicon devices have both nMOS and pMOS to realize power efficient and seamless analog and digital signal conditioning, but is limited to a narrow operation temperature range. GaN is a wide bandgap seminconductor with a strong n-type High Electron Mobility Transistor technology, but the completementary p-type transistor is still early investigation. P-type GaN transduction could enable a new class of transistor circuits as well as novel sensor and transducers. Your PhD project will focus on both the fundamental physics of these devices with modelling, fabrication, and testing of these materials.

您将加入我们由电子仪器 (EI) 领域的教授、教师、技术人员、博士生和硕士生组成的充满积极性、支持性和凝聚力的团队。在 EI，您会发现热情开放的氛围。我们在培养不同学术水平的人才方面拥有良好的记录，并将为您提供在博士阶段发展所需的一切支持。我们的世界一流设施包括设备齐全的 EKL 和 Kavli Nanolab 洁净室，以及用于微系统组装、电气测量和传感器表征的专用实验室。即将推出的一套新的洁净室工具将专注于通过可扩展原子处理线（SAP-NL）制造宽带隙和二维材料。

在代尔夫特理工大学，我们将多样性视为我们的核心之一
价值观

参与
成为一所让您有宾至如归且能够蓬勃发展的大学。我们重视不同的观点和品质。我们相信这会让我们的工作更具创新性，让代尔夫特理工大学社区更加充满活力，让世界更加公正。我们共同想象、发明和创造利用技术对全球范围产生积极影响的解决方案。这就是我们邀请您申请的原因。您的申请将得到公平的考虑。
挑战。改变。影响！
电气工程、数学和计算机科学学院
电气工程、数学和计算机科学学院 (EEMCS) 汇集了三个科学学科。它们相辅相成，是我们日常生活中使用的技术背后的驱动力。我们的教师正在帮助电网等技术实现完全可持续且面向未来的技术。与此同时，我们正在开发未来的芯片和传感器，同时也为在新一代设备上运行的软件技术奠定了基础——当然其中也包括人工智能。与此同时，我们正在突破应用数学的极限，例如使用单细胞数据绘制疾病过程，并使用数学模拟火山喷发后巨大的火山灰羽流。换句话说：学院有足够的空间进行突破性研究。我们培养创新工程师，并拥有优秀的实验室和设施，这些都凸显了我们强大的国际地位。总共有 1000 多名员工和 4,000 名学生在这个创新环境中工作和学习。

items.title_en: PhD in Flexibility Services from Electrified Process Industry: A Focus on Steam-Heated Processes
items.title_zh: 电气化过程工业灵活性服务博士：重点关注蒸汽加热过程
items.description_en:
Do you want to be part of an industry-oriented project and work on flexibility estimation from industrial sites?
The envisioned research is part of the research program Intelligent Energy Systems (IES) performed within the Electrical Energy Systems (EES) group of TU/e. Within the IES program, research is conducted into operation and planning of future sustainable energy systems, with an emphasis on electricity systems, markets and systems integration. This research is performed in two research labs: the Digital power and energy systems lab (EES DigiPES lab) and the Electricity markets and power system optimization lab (EES EMPDO lab). The former focuses on intelligent energy network research, including: demand management and flexibility, digital twinning, data analytics, smart grid ICT architectures and systems integration in multi energy systems. The latter specializes in electricity market design (centralized & decentralized), market products & system services to integrate new technologies, forecasting, market participation strategies and risk management, large-scale, distributed, multi-objective optimization techniques applied to energy markets and power systems and AI for optimization and control in power and energy systems. The EES group has strong ties with industry both nationally and internationally, with several part-time industry researchers working in the group and a large group of strategic collaboration partners.
Recently, the Electrical Energy Systems group received grants for nationally-funded projects in Intelligent Electricity Systems. Therefore, this group currently has multiple vacancies in this field.
We are currently looking for researchers with strong energy systems knowledge, electricity, heat, and gas system components and flexibility modelling & simulation, and research software development skills
that want to develop cutting-edge knowledge and software for the
energy transition. The focus of the work will be on the application of intelligent software approaches (distributed control systems, distributed optimization, market mechanisms, multi-scale modelling, etc.), in electrical power systems (energy system flexibility coordination, local energy markets, capacity & congestion management, etc.).
Information
The decarbonization of the industrial sector is critical to achieving climate neutrality. Steam-based industries, such as chemical manufacturing, food processing, and paper production, are among the most energy-intensive and carbon-emitting sectors. Electrification of thermal processes, particularly through the integration of industrial heat pumps, presents a promising pathway to reduce emissions while offering flexibility services to the energy system.
At the same time, the increasing penetration of variable renewable energy such as wind and solar creates a pressing need for
flexibility services
to balance supply and demand. Industrial processes, with their significant thermal inertia and storage potential, can provide valuable flexibility to the power grid. However, the integration of such services into
steam-heated industrial processes
remains a challenge, especially when considering the role of
large-scale heat pumps,
industrial heat storage, and heat recovery technologies
as both decarbonization and flexibility enablers. The challenge rises from several factors affecting the daily operation of the factories as well as the investment requirements that might not be compensated accordingly when the derived flexibility is offered to the grid/market. In this regard, this PhD focuses on optimizing the use of flexibility in electrified process plants by leveraging dynamic behaviors and market participation.
With the above premises, the main objectives of this study are
- Characterize the thermal demand profiles of steam-based industrial processes and identify opportunities for electrification. => Baseline optimisation
Baseline optimisation
- Assess the technical feasibility and performance of industrial heat pumps in steam generation and recovery. => Design options and technology inclusions
Design options and technology inclusions
- Develop models to quantify the flexibility potential of electrified steam systems, including load shifting, demand response, and ancillary services. => Energy use optimisation
Energy use optimisation
- Assess the techno-economic feasibility of providing flexibility services from electrified steam processes. => Business assessment
Business assessment
- Grid impact assessment and capacity management approaches in an industry-infused network with integrated industrial flexibility services. => Grid impact assessment
Grid impact assessment
In order to achieve these goals, the following tasks would shape the work plan of the PhD:
Energy Portfolio Creation:
A comprehensive estimation of the available flexibility within electrified process plants should be undertaken. This task involves a detailed assessment of the various processes and identifying potential extractable flexibility from electrified thermal systems. The goal is to quantify the extent to which these processes can be adjusted or modulated, taking into account the operational constraints and requirements. This estimation will include analyzing the energy consumption patterns, identifying peak and off-peak periods, and understanding the critical operational parameters that must remain stable. The maximum achievable flexibility that can be harnessed without compromising the efficiency, productivity, and overall operational stability of the process plants can be determined. This rigorous analysis will provide a clear picture of the flexibility potential and set the stage for implementing effective flexibility services tailored to the dynamic behavior of the process industry.
Flexibility service definition and potential calculations:
The next task would be to identify and define flexibility services that are specifically tailored to the dynamic nature of process industries. This involves a thorough examination of the various industrial processes to determine how they can be adapted or modulated to provide flexibility services. The approach includes a detailed analysis of the operational characteristics and requirements of each process, aiming to understand the inherent dynamic behaviors and how they can be leveraged to create flexibility.
Through exploring different strategies for modulating processes, such as adjusting production schedules, varying energy consumption rates, and implementing advanced control systems, new definitions for flexibility services from industry will be provided. This definition would consider the type, feature, and characteristics of the service from both industry side and market side, meaning the conditions that the plant needs to follow to provide such services as well as the market conditions to which the service is offered.
Evaluating implementation potential:
In this task,
the energy market status for the process industry will be analysed to determine the viability of electrified processes considering the increased required electric demand and the new possibilities of saving energy costs using the flexibility of electrified thermal systems. To achieve this, the current status of the markets will be analysed to assess the possibility of incorporating industrial flexibility. Different revenue schemes will be considered to deploy industrial flexibility as a product in the market. The flexibility trade with the characteristics of flexibility from industrial processes will be analysed. The energy market status for both electricity and gas markets will be studied to evaluate the viability of electrification for specific cases and in regard to price growth of electricity and gas. The trade portfolio of an electrified industrial site will be provided with possibilities of energy market participation, flexibility services remuneration, and CO2 to capture revenues.
This PhD is part of a NWO project called “Flexibility in Electric Power from Steam-heated Industrial Processes” (FLEXPower). There are several partners involved in this project including a large distribution system operator, industrial partners, industrial flexibility technology providers, and an applied research institute. The PhD student will be involved in this project, will have the chance to participate in meetings, and have a close collaboration with industry. The study could also benefit from using real data from the industrial partners involved in the project.

您想成为面向行业的项目的一部分并致力于工业现场的灵活性评估吗？
设想的研究是 TU/e 电能系统 (EES) 小组内进行的智能能源系统 (IES) 研究计划的一部分。 IES 计划对未来可持续能源系统的运营和规划进行研究，重点是电力系统、市场和系统集成。这项研究在两个研究实验室进行：数字电力和能源系统实验室（EES DigiPES 实验室）和电力市场和电力系统优化实验室（EES EMPDO 实验室）。前者专注于智能能源网络研究，包括：需求管理和灵活性、数字孪生、数据分析、智能电网ICT架构和多能源系统中的系统集成。后者专注于电力市场设计（集中式和分散式）、集成新技术的市场产品和系统服务、预测、市场参与策略和风险管理、应用于能源市场和电力系统的大规模、分布式、多目标优化技术以及用于电力和能源系统优化和控制的人工智能。 EES小组与国内外业界有着密切的联系，有多名兼职行业研究人员在小组工作，并拥有一大批战略合作伙伴。
最近，电能系统小组获得了国家资助的智能电力系统项目资助。因此，该集团目前在该领域有多个职位空缺。
我们目前正在寻找具有丰富的能源系统知识、电力、热力和天然气系统组件以及灵活性建模和仿真以及研究软件开发技能的研究人员
想要为以下领域开发尖端知识和软件
能源转型。工作重点是智能软件方法（分布式控制系统、分布式优化、市场机制、多尺度建模等）在电力系统（能源系统灵活性协调、本地能源市场、容量和拥塞管理等）中的应用。
信息
工业部门脱碳对于实现气候中和至关重要。化学制造、食品加工和造纸等蒸汽工业是能​​源密集型和碳排放量最高的行业。热力过程的电气化，特别是通过工业热泵的集成，为减少排放同时为能源系统提供灵活性服务提供了一条有前途的途径。
与此同时，风能和太阳能等可变可再生能源的渗透率不断提高，迫切需要
灵活性服务
以平衡供需。工业过程具有显着的热惯性和存储潜力，可以为电网提供宝贵的灵活性。然而，将此类服务集成到
蒸汽加热的工业过程
仍然是一个挑战，特别是当考虑到
大型热泵、
工业储热和热回收技术
作为脱碳和灵活性的推动者。影响工厂日常运营的几个因素以及当向电网/市场提供衍生的灵活性时可能无法相应补偿的投资要求带来了挑战。在这方面，该博士重点关注通过利用动态行为和市场参与来优化电气化过程工厂的灵活性的使用。
有了上述前提，本研究的主要目标是
- 描述基于蒸汽的工业过程的热需求概况并确定电气化机会。 => 基线优化
基线优化
- 评估工业热泵在蒸汽产生和回收方面的技术可行性和性能。 => 设计选项和技术包含
设计选项和技术包含
- 开发模型来量化电气化蒸汽系统的灵活性潜力，包括负荷转移、需求响应和辅助服务。 => 能源使用优化
能源利用优化
- 评估通过电气化蒸汽工艺提供灵活性服务的技术经济可行性。 => 业务评估
业务评估
- 具有集成工业灵活性服务的工业网络中的电网影响评估和容量管理方法。 => 电网影响评估
电网影响评估
为了实现这些目标，以下任务将影响博士生的工作计划：
能源投资组合创建：
应对电气化过程工厂内的可用灵活性进行全面评估。这项任务涉及对各种过程的详细评估，并确定电热系统潜在的可提取灵活性。目标是在考虑操作限制和要求的情况下量化这些流程可以调整或调整的程度。该估算将包括分析能源消耗模式、识别高峰期和非高峰期，以及了解必须保持稳定的关键运行参数。可以确定在不影响过程工厂的效率、生产率和整体运行稳定性的情况下可实现的最大灵活性。这种严格的分析将提供灵活性潜力的清晰图景，并为实施针对流程工业动态行为量身定制的有效灵活性服务奠定基础。
灵活性服务定义和潜力计算：
下一个任务是确定和定义专门针对流程工业的动态性质定制的灵活性服务。这涉及对各种工业流程进行彻底检查，以确定如何调整或调整它们以提供灵活性服务。该方法包括对每个流程的操作特征和要求的详细分析，旨在了解固有的动态行为以及如何利用它们来创造灵活性。
通过探索不同的流程调节策略，例如调整生产计划、改变能源消耗率以及实施先进的控制系统，将为工业的灵活性服务提供新的定义。该定义将从行业侧和市场侧考虑服务的类型、特征和特征，即工厂提供此类服务需要遵循的条件以及提供服务的市场条件。
评估实施潜力：
在这个任务中，
将分析流程工业的能源市场状况，以确定电气化流程的可行性，考虑到所需电力需求的增加以及利用电气化热力系统的灵活性节省能源成本的新可能性。为了实现这一目标，将分析市场的现状，以评估纳入工业灵活性的可能性。将考虑不同的收入计划，将工业灵活性作为市场上的产品部署。将分析具有工业过程灵活性特征的柔性贸易。将研究电力和天然气市场的能源市场状况，以评估电气化在特定情况下以及电力和天然气价格增长的可行性。电气化工业场地的贸易组合将提供参与能源市场、灵活性服务报酬和二氧化碳获取收入的可能性。
该博士学位是 NWO 项目“蒸汽加热工业过程电力灵活性”(FLEXPower) 的一部分。参与该项目的合作伙伴包括大型配电系统运营商、行业合作伙伴、工业柔性技术提供商和应用研究所。博士生将参与该项目，将有机会参加会议，并与业界进行密切合作。该研究还可以受益于使用参与该项目的工业合作伙伴的真实数据。
